Author: frsnworldwide
Paragraphs: ['Nous vivons une p√©riode d‚Äôexp√©rimentation sociale √† grande √©chelle. Les emplois du temps ont saut√©, le travail se r√©invente hors les murs, ailleurs qu‚Äôau bureau‚Ä¶ Quels sont les nouveaux risques d‚Äôali√©nation et comment les √©viter ?', 'Alexandre Lacroix', '¬´ J‚Äôen ai assez, mes p√¢tes ont le go√ªt de mes mails ¬ª', 'Nous sommes nombreux √† √™tre pass√©s d‚Äôun t√©l√©travail impos√© pendant la dur√©e du confinement √† un mod√®le flou qui se cherchent, o√π alternent les journ√©es pass√©es au bureau et chez soi. La crise du Covid-19 ne fait d‚Äôailleurs qu‚Äôamplifier et acc√©l√©rer une tendance de long terme, n√©e de l‚Äôextension du r√©seau et des outils connect√©s, au d√©cloisonnement des temps de travail et de loisir. Or le ph√©nom√®ne est profond√©ment ambivalent. D‚Äôun c√¥t√©, le travail √† la maison supprime les heures perdues dans les transports, il permet de jouir d‚Äôun confort domestique, de la cuisine proche, mais aussi des disques ou des loisirs √† disposition. Il devient possible de partir marcher une heure en pleine journ√©e ou d‚Äôaller voir un film, ce que l‚Äôordinaire du bureau exclut. Mais ce caract√®re agr√©able du d√©cloisonnement n‚Äôemp√™che nullement que la motivation nous quitte parfois, que les r√©unions en visioconf√©rence semblent s‚Äôencha√Æner dans un continuum interrompu et terne que ne ponctuent m√™me plus les discussions autour de la machine √† caf√© ni les plaisanteries lanc√©es √† la cantonade. Lorsque, le matin, on arrive fatigu√© au bureau, par une sorte de transvasement, l‚Äô√©nergie des autres nous r√©veille et nous galvanise. Lorsqu‚Äôon reste chez soi, cette √©mulation n‚Äôexiste plus. Une journ√©e de vague √† l‚Äô√¢me ou de lassitude n‚Äôa plus d‚Äôissue. Nous voici donc, collectivement, le cul entre deux chaises. Nous n‚Äôavons pas envie de revenir √† la triade m√©tro-boulot-dodo. Mais nous nous sentons d√©j√† menac√©s par la dyade boulot-dodo. Comment retrouver ses marques ?', 'Cloisonnement ou tressage ?', 'Avant m√™me d‚Äôouvrir l‚Äôenqu√™te, il n‚Äôest pas inutile de clarifier l‚Äôordonnancement des travaux et des jours.Le temps qui nous est allou√©, nous le r√©partissons, de fa√ßon √† la fois contrainte et libre, entre plusieurs types d‚Äôactivit√©s.\nDans une configuration traditionnelle, l‚Äôactivit√© r√©mun√©r√©e est s√©par√©e spatialement de l‚Äôactivit√© non r√©mun√©r√©e. L‚Äôusine, le bureau sont √† la fois des unit√©s de production ‚Äì du point de vue √©conomique ‚Äì et des th√©√¢tres sociaux o√π chacun rev√™t un r√¥le bien d√©fini.\nCette distinction des espaces offre une certaine libert√© : elle nous pr√©serve, car nous savons que, sortis de l‚Äôusine ou du bureau, on peut enfin redevenir soi-m√™me. On abandonne la tenue, le rictus, le dos droit, la d√©marche √©nergique, mais aussi le jargon professionnel. On redevient le mari ou la femme, l‚Äôamie ou le copain d‚Äôenfance, le p√®re ou la s≈ìur.', 'De pr√©occupantes in√©galit√©s de genre', 'Sociologue √† l‚Äôinstitut national d‚Äô√©tudes d√©mographiques (Ined), Anne Lambert a coordonn√© une √©tude publi√©e dans la revue Population et Soci√©t√©s, ¬´ le travail et ses am√©nagements : ce que la pand√©mie de Covid-19 a chang√© pour les Fran√ßais ¬ª, qui am√®ne clairement √† d√©chanter. Le r√©sultat a √©t√© implacable : dans les faits, le t√©l√©travail a r√©v√©l√© de massives et persistantes in√©galit√©s de genre. Parmi l‚Äôensemble des actifs qui occupaient un emploi au 1er mars 2020, 30% √©taient √† l‚Äôarr√™t deux mois apr√®s et 70% travaillaient encore. Mais, pr√©cise Anne Lambert ¬´ si trois hommes sur quatre ont r√©ussi √† conserver leur emploi au bout de deux mois de confinement, seules deux femmes sur trois ont pu le faire ¬ª.', 'La fin des sons de cloche', 'Le philosophe Pascal Chabot fait partie des chanceux qui ont pu mettre le confinement √† profit pour mener √† bien un projet personnel et cr√©atif : il a pu mettre la derni√®re main √† un essai intitul√© Avoir le temps, qui est paru aux PUF d√©but 2021. Auparavant il a sign√© Global Burn-out (PUF 2013) et Exister, R√©sister (PUF 2017). ¬´ L‚Äôinvention de l‚Äôemploi du temps, rappelle-t-il, c‚Äôest-√†-dire du compartimentage du travail et de la pri√®re, s‚Äôest faite dans les communaut√©s religieuses europ√©ennes, avec l‚Äôapparition des r√®gles monastiques il y a mille cinq cents ans environ. Songez √† la cloche qui synchronise les consciences. Les r√®gles qui encadraient la vie monastique assuraient bonne gestion, pr√©visibilit√©, alternance des rythmes. Et le monde industriel s‚Äôen est largement inspir√©, ce mod√®le ayant pr√©valu dans les usines comme dans les bureaux. Or nous voyons qu‚Äôil est en passe d‚Äô√™tre abandonn√© dans beaucoup de secteurs ! ¬ª Mais n‚Äôest-ce pas une chance ? La r√®gle de saint Beno√Æt ou celle de Frederick Winslow Taylor n‚Äô√©taient-elles pas coercitives ? ¬´ Si bien s√ªr qu‚Äôil y a une opportunit√© d‚Äô√©mancipation ! Avant qu‚Äôapparaissent les emplois du temps, les paysans ne se disaient pas : je vais faucher ce champ en deux heures trente. Un tel compartimentage est abstrait et fait violence √† la vie m√™me, l√† o√π il est bon que le travail ou l‚Äô≈ìuvre dicte sa propre temporalit√©. Quand vous construisez un mur en pierres s√®ches, quand vous √©crivez un chapitre, √ßa prend‚Ä¶ le temps que √ßa prend. Avec le t√©l√©travail, nous essayons de trouver un rapport au temps plus fluide et plus spontan√© et, parfois, nous y parvenons. C‚Äôest un polyphasage qui s‚Äôinvente en ce moment. On peut travailler, exp√©dier mes e-mails, mais aussi bouquiner ou faire la cuisine au milieu de l‚Äôapr√®s-midi. ¬ª', 'LE PHILOSOPHE Yves Citton, auteur de Pour une √©cologie de l‚Äôattention (Seuil, 2014), confirme : ¬´ Ce qui √©tait autrefois r√©serv√© √† une frange restreinte de la population, √† une √©lite, est en train de se d√©velopper, et cela depuis des d√©cennies. Dans le capitalisme industriel classique, un salari√© vend sa force de travail, au sens physique du terme, pendant un nombre d‚Äôheures pass√©es √† l‚Äôusine. Avec le capitalisme cognitif, cette r√®gle de proportionnalit√© ne s‚Äôapplique plus. Vous devez √©crire un article, r√©soudre un probl√®me informatique, monter une campagne d‚Äôinfluence‚Ä¶ Peut-√™tre allez-vous explorer une fausse piste et m√™me ne rien produire de valable pendant une semaine, en travaillant douze heures par jour ? Ou, √† l‚Äôinverse, l‚Äôid√©e d√©cisive vous vient en un d√©clic, dans votre lit ou le week-end. Seuls les savants et les artistes, autrefois, avaient ce r√©gime-temps particulier, o√π la productivit√© n‚Äôest pas en proportion lin√©aire √† la quantit√© d‚Äôheures. C‚Äôest ce qui est en train de se d√©mocratiser. ¬ª']

Author: yellowhippo
Paragraphs: ["\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0The story focuses on the debates and banter between Ikang and her father. Represented by a month ever since the enhanced community quarantine (ECQ) kick-started the sudden change of daily life for Filipinos, we are put in different situations. Every month, the duo talks about certain issues surrounding the pandemic and how the government has been doing things for the Filipinos. Every month, Ikang would start off with a **statement. Her father either berates her or laughs at her little quirks when it comes to her disappointment with the government and with the current situation. The story focuses on portraying how the 'new normal', though greatly affected the day to day life of the characters, they still spend their days with the same love and respect for each other. Through this story, there is hope that the misconceptions of the older generations against millenials and vice versa may be understood.", '\xa0**statement', 'From my personal poem, Utak Na Lasing, which was written a year ago as of this posting.']

Author: frsnworldwide
Paragraphs: ['La pand√©mie de Covid-19 menace l‚Äô√©ducation des enfant et des jeunes. Ceux-ci se sont vu priv√©s d‚Äô√©cole de coll√®ge, de lyc√©e, d‚Äôuniversit√© depuis la mi mars 2020. [‚Ä¶] On sait que certains ont d√©croch√©. Et comme toujours, ce sont d‚Äôabord les plus d√©favoris√©s. Des jeunes qui vivent dans des appartements petits ou surpeupl√©s, qui ne disposent pas d‚Äôordinateurs ou de connexion, dont les parents ne peuvent se transformer en professeurs particuliers, ont rompu avec les √©tudes. D√©but avril 2020, le Ministre de l‚ÄôEducation nationale a annonc√© qu‚Äôau moins 5 √† 8 % des √©l√®ves n‚Äôavaient pas b√©n√©fici√© de l‚Äô√©cole nationale. Et en Juillet 2020, c‚Äôest en r√©alit√©, au moins 50 % des √©l√®ves en grande difficult√© qui ont √©t√© perdus, soit un million d‚Äôenfants et de jeunes ‚Äì sans compter 1,2 million de jeunes d√©j√† sortis du syst√®me √©ducatif sans dipl√¥me. Quand aux enseignements, nombreux sont ceux qui ont eu du mal √† s‚Äôadapter √† l‚Äôenseignement √† distance. La crise du Covid-19 est un terrible acc√©l√©rateur d‚Äôin√©galit√©s, dans Un pays qui ne parvient plus, depuis des d√©cennies, √† donner sa chance √† chacun de r√©ussir. L‚ÄôEcole de la R√©publique a du mal √† remplir toutes ses missions. Avec le Covid-19, elle appara√Æt encore plus fragilis√©e.']

Author: frsnworldwide
Paragraphs: ['On se croirait dans une s√©rie t√©l√© en mettant en vedette la police scientifique, type les Experts. La pand√©mie a mis en lumi√®re un champ d‚Äô√©tudes r√©cent, la phylodynamique, qui s‚Äôint√©resse aux variations g√©n√©tiques des agents pathog√®nes.', 'Quand un virus se transmet, elles laissent des traces dans son g√©nome. Le g√©nome du virus Sars-CoV-2 est ainsi compos√© d‚Äôenviron 30000  ¬´ lettres ¬ª ; sa propagation entra√Æne de minuscules mutations (l‚Äôencha√Ænement des lettres se modifie). La phylodynamique analyse de tels changements, ce qui permet de remonter aux origines du pr√©sent virus, de reconstituer son arbre g√©n√©alogique et de suivre son √©volution. Sur le site Nextstrain, tr√®s fr√©quent√©, on trouve ainsi des cartes permettant de voir o√π il se d√©place, rena√Æt, mute‚Ä¶ Dans son dernier essai M√©tamorphoses, le philosophe Emanuele Coccia d√©finit de mani√®re g√©n√©rale le virus comme ¬´ un m√©canisme chimique, mat√©riel, dynamique de d√©veloppement et de reproduction des √™tres vivants ¬ª. √Ä l‚Äôimage de la vie qui ne cesse de passer de corps en corps, le virus transforme ses h√¥tes tout en changeant lui-m√™me. Cette ¬´ pure puissance de m√©tamorphose ¬ª est ce que la phylodynamique rel√®ve et suit √† la trace.']

Author: worklabournewsresearch
Paragraphs: ['‚ÄúUncertainty, instability and self-doubt have been common themes in  the lives of college students during 2020 as their education and career  plans shift due to the coronavirus pandemic.‚Äù', '‚ÄúThese were the general feelings expressed by about 450 college  students and recent alumni who responded to a small, open-ended survey  conducted by a pair of 2020 graduates, and reiterated on a larger scale  in a new nationally representative survey  of 4,000 undergraduates by the Strada Education Network, a national  organization focused on improving education and career pathways. The  various responses show that heightened stress and anxiety -- whether  about achieving academic success, finding future employment or paying  for the next meal -- is currently dominating the student psyche.‚Äù', '‚Äú[Jesse] Barba, of [national youth advocacy group] Young Invincibles, compared what current students are  facing to what college graduates experienced during the Great Recession  of 2008-09. Over all, he is not optimistic about current students‚Äô  economic futures and noted that there will likely be discrepancies  between students of color and white students in their ability to bounce  back financially.‚Äù', 'Inside Higher Ed, October 15, 2020: ‚ÄúA Generation Defined by the Pandemic,‚Äù by Greta Anderson', 'Strada Education Network, October 15, 2020: Public Viewpoint: COVID-19 Work and Education Survey (One Pager: 1 page, PDF) (Topline Findings: 2 pages, PDF) (Charts: 10 pages, PDF)', 'Medium, October 5, 2020: ‚Äú‚ÄòI feel that the future I‚Äôve been working towards my whole life is gone now‚Äô ‚Äî What Students Have to Say About the Coronavirus,‚Äù by Livia Morris', 'eCornell, register and watch October 23, 2020 at 1 pm: ‚ÄúThriving in Isolation: Health and Human Connection. Sponsored by the Cornell Institute for Healthy Futures in collaboration  with the K. Lisa Yang and Hock E. Tan Institute on Employment and  Disability, this session will highlight academic research and industry  practices to deepen the understanding of diverse employee needs and  strategies for boosting our capacities to thrive in isolation.‚Äù']

Author: mypastself
Paragraphs: ['3,500 new cases today. bloody depressing. it‚Äôs going up in numbers every single day. second wave has cometh.', 'after the nightmare that was April 2020, i said to myself, i don‚Äôt want to ever go back to a time where i switch on the news and i see over a thousand people dead in a single day. but i think we‚Äôre slowly moving back to that horrible part of the pandemic again.', 'it breaks my heart, bolsters my anxiety, and it wears me out.', 'my younger siblings go to school whilst i read books at home. my father goes to work at night whilst i lie under warm covers, head on a soft pillow. i hate it. i hate having to worry about them every single day.', 'i‚Äôm too scared to go outside anymore. if i get close to a crowd, it stresses me out. when my arm accidentally brushes someone else‚Äôs, i internally scream and berate myself repeatedly for ten whole minutes. someone who coughs when passing by me makes me speed walk in the opposite direction whilst trying to suppress a panic attack. i used to find germaphobes funny, but i now find myself among that crowd.', 'fearful of disease, constantly washing my hands, putting my clothes in the wash the moment i come back from the outside. anxious of everything my hand comes in contact with.', 'schools are closing down all over the city, the numbers are swelling. rules are changing, and i feel like we‚Äôve rewound back to the early days.', 'back when the nightmare had begun.', 'and it terrifies me.', 'i don‚Äôt want my parents catching it when they‚Äôve got other illnesses to deal with and they‚Äôre around 50. i don‚Äôt want my little brother getting it when he has a compromised immune system already.\xa0', 'i‚Äôm so scared and the government wasted all summer opening pubs and cutting prices at restaurants to encourage people to\xa0‚Äúeat out to help out‚Äù. now, the numbers have risen because of negligence. too much freedom. people forgetting that there‚Äôs even a pandemic going on.', 'masks? we don‚Äôt know her.', '... i hate it so much.', 'Lord have mercy, people are going to start dying again in the thousands.', 'i‚Äôm so scared.']

Paragraphs: ['Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO), said that the ongoing global Covid-19 pandemic has affected the mental health of millions of people.', '‚ÄúFor many people, the lack of social interaction caused by the pandemic has had a profound effect on their mental health,‚Äù Tedros said at a virtual press briefing from Geneva on Thursday.', 'The WHO chief said that people in long-term facilities such as care homes and psychiatric institutions are at an increased risk of infection, Xinhua news agency reported.', 'He added that mental health professionals have themselves been infected with the virus, and some mental health facilities have been closed to be converted into treatment facilities for people with Covid-19.', 'He recalled that mental health was already ‚Äúa neglected health issue‚Äù globally before the pandemic, with close to one billion people living with a mental disorder.']

Author: gauridesai
Paragraphs: ['Plasma medications are produced from human blood plasma (plasma). Plasma can be obtained from administration of whole blood (recovered plasma) or apheresis procedures (plasma source). The source is plasma a wide range of medicinal therapies products used for treatment and the prevention of various treatment-causing injuries and diseases often associated with a protein deficiency state. Convalescent Plasma Therapy (CP), a classic adaptive immunotherapy, has been used in the prevention and treatment of many infectious diseases for over a century. In the past two decades, CP therapy has been successfully used in the treatment of the 2009 SARS, MERS and H1N1 pandemic with satisfactory efficacy and safety. In 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) recommended the use of convalescent plasma therapy for the treatment of patients with antibody-rich plasma in those recovering from Ebola virus disease.', 'Numerous clinical trials are also being held to evaluate the safety and efficacy of convalescent plasma, and the FDA has also approved a number of individual emergencies (eINDs) for emergencies.', 'Plasma Therapy @https://www.databridgemarketresearch.com/covid-19-resources/covid-19-impact-on-plasma-therapy-in-the-healthcare-industry']

Paragraphs: ['Coronavirus continues to spread even after 9 months from its inception in Wuhan, China . The life at this very planet is really under so much threat due to outbreak of this COVID-19 .', '(to have information about coronavirus, please visit www.talkitfirst.blogspot.com)', 'Global leaders need to take some very important decisive steps in order to curb the spread of this pandemic as the reach of this pandemic has crossed 10 million mark in the world and every day , we get to hear some very scarier news and increase in the number of positive cases .', 'Even, the most powerful and developed nations like Unites States of America, France, Germany, Russia, etc. has to face so much of loss of the lives of their citizens as well as the economies of these countries .', "Many pharmaceutical companies and medical research laboratories are constantly working on to develop a vaccine and many claim to have formulated such vaccine but due to trial period , the vaccine can't be released in the open market .", 'Therefore, it will request from my side to each and everyone reading this article to follow the respective Government guidelines to keep each one of safe and healthy .', 'I hope that no nusance will be entertained by anyone of us doing any irresponsible activity may draw a fatal outcome to all of us .', 'Thanks for reading and reacting .']

Author: xxfrizzyxx
Paragraphs: ['Dear media,', 'When you talk about how students are struggling right now, please don‚Äôt forget to mention relationships.', 'Romantic relationships. Between people who love each other. Who fell in love and then were forced to keep apart for months on end.', 'I don‚Äôt give a shit about school. I honestly don‚Äôt. I would drop out right now if it meant I could spend the rest of my life with my boyfriend. And I don‚Äôt care how naive that sounds.', 'It‚Äôs hard to stay away from the one you love. It‚Äôs  like torture. It‚Äôs some of the worst pain I‚Äôve ever felt.', 'So don‚Äôt you dare act so logical about this, acting with no emotion and as if it‚Äôs hard but easy. It‚Äôs not. Most of the people who act like this are adults. Married adults. Adults who live with their partners.', 'Don‚Äôt forget about the millions of teenagers and young adults who are being locked away from their loved one.']

Author: editdeadactive
Paragraphs: ['Tbh the social experiment of asking humans to wear masks so as to not spread their own germs to the person next to them reminds me of those ancient European soldiers who had shields that mainly protected the person beside them. ', "A more accurate model would be all of the soldiers facing outward in a circle. All of the soldiers could be protected if all of them had their shields. Instead, some of them have decided to forgo shields. Both them and the person next to them have been stabbed. Then another soldier doesn't have to cover he needs to survive, so he gets stabbed. The cycle continues until all of the soldiers are exposed and killed. "]

Author: anonmacka
Paragraphs:
['I want to pose a question-- or rather, series of questions-- to those that this post may reach. 

Mysterious smog hung over Wuhan during the worst of the Covid19 outbreak which was confirmed by satellites to be close to if not exactly the same as smoke those very satellites track in wild and forest fires. They were cremating bodies at a breakneck speed but did not address it or say anything about it. The majority cellphone company had a loss of hundreds of thousands of accounts. That‚Äôs huge because in China they use their phones for everything, they pay bills and buy things with their phones a lot more than America, Canada, etc. and due to the nature of the government there is only one major carrier to facility the ease of control. These cell accounts are tied into the social credit system that china has going-- it‚Äôs to replace normal credit scores-- which means it‚Äôs the same as thousands upon hundreds of thousands of social security numbers just vanishing without an explanation to the world at large. 

So I think we all know what happened there but there‚Äôs more to it, I want to post this question:

It‚Äôs well known that China has concentration camps for Muslims that they essentially call reeducation camps. Conditions in said camps have been reported to be absolutely nightmarish and the population of Muslims in said camps have been reported to be close to and sometimes over 1 million. 

Does anyone really believe China took any additional or precautionary steps to stop the spread of covid19 within these camps and help those that may have contracted the virus? I mean, of course, more than a bullet to the head. 

I ask this because I certainly do not think any additional measures of the sort were taken given that, as previously stated, thousands upon thousands of citizens with good enough social standing to still be free and have cell phones just disappeared. 

Well, no, they didn‚Äôt disappear... you know where they went? 

They likely went to two places: 

The atmosphere within that mysterious ‚Äúsmog‚Äù and wherever the government disposed of the remaining ashes.

I sincerely hope I-- and thousands that think the same as me-- are wrong. I sincerely hope that the camps are not actually concentration camps. I sincerely hope with all of my being that the vulnerable individuals within those camps were looked after as if they were the same as any Chinese citizen in good standing with the government. I sincerely... WITH ALL OF MY HEART... hope that the satellites were wrong and that the smog was just some sort of dust cloud for some desert or just some sort of pollution that was not made up of people that had dreams... that had loved ones waiting for them to come home... that had fears that they faced by placing their complete trust in their government.

Despite how badly I hope this is all just a misunderstanding... I know it‚Äôs not likely to be the case. 

I know everyone that might read this has no idea who I am nor will the majority care and that‚Äôs fine, but please...

Don‚Äôt let the sum of their last moments amount to little more than a ‚Äúhmm, that‚Äôs weird‚Äù. 

Don‚Äôt forget about the millions that-- even though they know the truth and do not agree with their government/do not feel safe in their home country-- have no choice but to have hope. The alternative to not having hope is complete powerlessness and vulnerability that is beyond their means to even dream of correcting. 

Don‚Äôt forget Wuhan and the citizens that were dragged out of their homes before being forced at gun point into a van with a dozen or more strangers. Placed in a van so that even if you weren‚Äôt actually infected with Covid19 you would be sharing an-- at most-- enclosed space of 12‚Ä≤x6‚Ä≤ (and that‚Äôs being generous) with at least ONE person infected with the corona virus which would ensure that the odds of you remaining free of it dropped dramatically.

There‚Äôs a video of a healthcare worker in China just breaking down and screaming in what looks like the staff break room. Screaming and violently sobbing without words or control over herself in the least. This virus would not have been the first time she saw someone die but it would be the first scenario-- and likely the only scenario-- in her lifetime to show her that not only were people dying but they‚Äôd continue dying by the thousands no matter what she did. 

As someone who is a paramedic let me just say... It hurt beyond anything I could imagine the first time someone looked me in the eyes and begged me to save them or asked me to reassure them that they would not die then regardless of how picture perfect and text book my interventions were I lost them. It hurt every time after that, but I can‚Äôt imagine having that experience dozens of times in a single day.

Last thing then I swear I‚Äôm done...

Those of my generation in America (I‚Äôm in my early 30‚Ä≤s) know how watching hundreds and hundreds die on live television can shape a young mind. Imagine being the age we were whilst this pandemic carves a swath out of the world‚Äôs populace. Imagine the fear of an unseen force that no one really completely understands in carriers that may not show any outward symptoms at all and said carriers recovering just fine but the five other people they exposed going on to die.

If you‚Äôre a parent check in on your children, make time to explain everything to them so that-- hopefully-- armed with knowledge they will be better equipped to deal wtih the fact that they‚Äôre being asked to go on as if it‚Äôs still everyday life. 

Children? Check with your parents. They may be beyond stressed wondering how they need to protect you from what‚Äôs happening and wondering how you are mentally but not exactly sure how to ask as they fear they might make your stress WORSE in doing so. 

Just in general-- look out for one another, call or text your friends, family, and loved ones to check in on them. ']

Author: geezerwench
Paragraphs: ['Stole this from  MarieCarro Vanadess√´, who got it from Alyscia who got it from ... somewhere üòÅ like her, I just want this to pop up in my FB memories so I can remember the absurdity of 2020!', 'This is long but totally hilarious and brilliant. ', 'Dear Diary 2020 Edition,\n In January, Australia caught on fire. I don‚Äôt even know if that fire  was put out, because we straight up almost went to war with Iran. We  might actually still be almost at war with them. I don‚Äôt know, because  Jen Aniston and Brad Pitt spoke to one another at an awards show and  everyone flipped the crap out, but then there was thing happening in  China, then Prince Harry and Megan peaced out of the Royal family, and  there was the whole impeachment trial, and then corona virus showed up  in the US ‚Äúofficially,‚Äù but then Kobe died and UK peaced out of the  European Union.', 'In February, Iowa crapped itself with the caucus  results and the president was acquitted and the Speaker of the House  took ten years to rip up a speech, but then WHO decided to give this  virus a name COVID-19, which confused some really important people in  charge of, like, our lives, into thinking there were 18 other versions  before it, but then Harvey Weinstein was found guilty, and Americans  started asking if Corona beer was safe to drink, and everyone on  Facebook became a doctor who just knew the flu like killed way more  people than COVID 1 through 18.', 'In March, stuff hit the fan. Warren  dropped out of the presidential race and Sanders was like Bernie or  bust, but then Italy shut its whole country down, and then COVID Not 1  through 18 officially become what everyone already realized, a pandemic  and then a nationwide state of emergency was declared in US, but it  didn‚Äôt really change anything, so everyone was confused or thought it  was still just a flu, but then COVID Not 18 was like ya‚Äôll not taking me  seriously? I‚Äôm gonna infect the one celebrity everyone loves and  totally infected Tom Hanks, but then the DOW took a crap on itself, and  most of us still don‚Äôt understand why the stock market is so important  or even a thing (I still don‚Äôt), but then we were all introduced to  Tiger King. (Carol totally killed her husband), and Netflix was like  you‚Äôre welcome, and we all realized there was no way we were washing our  hands enough in the first place because all of our hands are now dry  and gross.', 'In April, Bernie finally busted himself out of the  presidential race, but then NYC became the set of The Walking Dead and  we learned that no one has face masks, ventilators, or toilet paper, or  THE FREAKING SWIFFER WET JET LIQUID, but then Kim Jong-Un died, but then  he came back to life‚Ä¶ or did he? Who knows, because then the Pentagon  released videos of UFOs and nobody cared, and we were like man, it‚Äôs  only April‚Ä¶.', 'In May, the biblical end times kicked off historical  locust swarms and then we learned of murder hornets and realized that  2020 was the start of the Hunger Games but people forgot to let us know,  but then people legit protested lockdown measures with AR-15s, and then  sports events were cancelled everywhere. But then people all over  America finally reached a breaking point with race issues and violence.  There were protests in every city, but then people forgot about the  pandemic called COVID Not One Through 18. Media struggled with how to  focus on two important things at once, but then people in general  struggle to focus on more than one important thing, and a dead whale was  found in the middle of the Amazon rain forest after monkeys stole COVID  1 Through 19 from a lab and ran off with them, and either in May or  April (no one is keeping track of time now) that a giant asteroid  narrowly missed Earth.', "In June, science and common sense just got  thrown straight out the window and somehow wearing masks became a  political thing, but then everyone sort of remembered there was a  pandemic, but then decided that not wearing a mask was somehow a God  given right (still haven't found that part in the bible or even in the  constitution), but then scientists announced they found a mysterious  undiscovered mass at the center of the earth, and everyone was like  DON‚ÄôT YOU DARE TOUCH IT, but then everyone took a pause to realize that  people actually believed Gone With The Wind was like non-fiction, but  then it was also announced that there is a strange radio single coming  from somewhere in the universe that repeats itself every so many days,  and everyone was like DON‚ÄôT YOU DARE ATTEMPT TO COMMUNICATE WITH IT, but  then America reopened from the shut down that actually wasn‚Äôt even a  shut down, and so far, things have gone spectacularly not that great,  but everyone is on Facebook arguing that masks kill because no one knows  how breathing works, but then Florida was like hold my beer and let me  show you how we‚Äôre number one in all things, including new Not Corona  Beer Corona Virus. Trump decides now is a good time to ask the Supreme  Court to shut down Obama Care because what better time to do so than in  the middle of a pandemic, but then we learned there was a massive dust  cloud coming straight at us from the Sahara Desert, which is totally  normal, but this is 2020, so the ghost mummy thing is most likely in  that dust cloud, but then I learned of meth-gators, and I'm like that is  so not on my flipping 2020 Bingo card, but then we learned that the  Congo's worse ever Ebola outbreak is over, and we were all like, there  was an Ebola outbreak that was the worse ever?\nIn July‚Ä¶. Aliens? Zeus? Asteroids? Artificial Intelligence becomes self aware?", 'I have no idea who wrote this; and dang it, I want to know.']

Author: rosiegeall
Paragraphs: ['Back at the beginning of the year I wrote a paper for one of my courses where I talked about the inevitability of pandemics. And I would like to brag that did get 87% on this paper.', 'This was the title of the paper I wrote, the main subject of this was a type of vaccine which I‚Äôm not going to talk about, I might write a different post about it another time. Instead I‚Äôm going to talk about pandemics, specifically viral ones.', 'First I‚Äôll explain the title a bit, a zoonotic virus is a virus that has been spread to humans from an animal, this virus will have originally infected an animal, like a bat or a pig, then will mutate and change to have the ability to infect humans. Some notable examples of these would be swine flu (influenza virus that infected pigs), bird flu (influenza virus that infected birds) and Covid19 (coronavirus, specifically SARS-CoV-2, a virus that likely infected bats with a possible intermediate species).\xa0I‚Äôd also like to note the difference between Covid19 and SARS-CoV-2, Covid19 stands for coronavirus disease 2019, so is the disease which arose in 2019, whereas SARS-CoV-2 which stands for\xa0                 Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome-CoronaVirus-2, it is the actual virus which causes the disease. This isn‚Äôt a particularly important difference for this post but I just wanted to explain because I‚Äôm a nerd who likes this sort of thing. A Pandemic is the spread of a new disease on a global scale, previous pandemics have been caused by zoonotic influenza viruses, the difference of this to epidemics is the scale, epidemics are much smaller. So when people say global pandemic they are basically saying a global spread of a disease on a global scale which irritates me slightly.', 'You might be wondering why I‚Äôve put an emphasis on zoonotic viruses, the reason for this is that they are much more likely to cause pandemics. This is because the population lacks immunity to the virus as they haven‚Äôt been exposed to it or a closely related virus and so it spread much more quickly and easily.', 'The\xa0risk of pandemics has increased with the increase of travel around the globe, the development of urban areas, natural environments being exploited and changes in land use. For the prevention of a pandemic,      strict infection control is used, when patients show symptoms of the disease, they are quarantined and then monitored in isolation. The disadvantage of this strategy of controlling the spread by isolation of those showing symptoms is that some viral diseases are infectious during their incubation period before symptoms appear. This shows the difficulty of containing many viral diseases due to their complexity and shows the need to quickly immunise individuals against epidemic causing diseases to stop the development of a pandemic.\xa0To immunise people vaccines which are very useful for protecting against the spread of diseases are used, however, to create, equip and commission a vaccine it takes on average 7 years, and manufacturing takes 0.5 - 3 years. This length of time it takes to get a vaccine is far too long to stop a pandemic as viruses can spread extremely quickly.\xa0', 'Vaccines against the flu (influenza viruses) is slightly different because we have a vaccine for it which just needs to be changed for each strain, for each seasonal vaccine different strains are selected to protect against which are likely to cause disease. But the process of selecting a strain to distributing the vaccine takes 6 months, and if a new strain emerges this might not be quick enough to stop the pandemic. This happened with the 2009 H1N1 pandemic. So even though this process is much shorted, it is still not short enough', 'These measures are different than the ones we are currently seeing, such as lockdown, but that is because controlling a pandemic and preventing one are different.', 'There is more to it than i have said, as pandemic prevention is an incredibly complicated issue, but the main point I am trying to make is that a pandemic has been likely for many years we just needed the right virus for it to happen. There is so much research out there that proves that more effort needed to have gone into preventative measures as our pandemic risk was obviously high as we now see.', "I hope i explained this alright and that I didn't ramble too much, if anyone wants the resources where i got the info or any questions feel free to ask x"]

Author: mr880fan
Paragraphs:
["World Well being Group (W.H.O.) Director-Basic Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus introduced on Friday his company would not designate the Wuhan coronavirus pandemic a Public Well being Emergency of Worldwide Concern (PHEIC).

The unfold of coronavirus ‚Äúis not an uncommon or surprising occasion‚Äù and ‚Äúthe\xa0world has made important and spectacular international progress because the declaration of the PHEIC in January 2020,‚Äù permitting for a change in strategy to the illness.

The PHEIC designation is likely one of the most extreme alarms that the W.H.O. can sound concerning illness outbreaks or different well being struggles; it's given to conditions that ‚Äúrequire fast worldwide motion‚Äù and jeopardize the well being and security of a number of international locations, if not the entire world. Tedros declared the coronavirus then-epidemic a PHEIC on January 30, 2020, practically a month after the nation of Taiwan first alerted the W.H.O. to the unfold of an unknown infectious illness in central China.

Tedros introduced the downgrade following a gathering of the W.H.O.‚Äôs emergency assembly to deal with the pandemic.

‚ÄúWith nice hope I declare COVID-19 over as a worldwide well being emergency,‚Äù he wrote on social media.

Yesterday, the #COVID19 Emergency Committee met for the fifteenth time and beneficial to me that I declare an finish to the general public well being emergency of worldwide concern. I've accepted that recommendation.

With nice hope I declare COVID-19 over as a worldwide well being emergency.

‚Äî Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus (@DrTedros) May 5, 2023

The W.H.O. issued a press release explaining the rationale for the announcement, noting ‚Äúthe lowering pattern in COVID-19 deaths, the decline in COVID-19 associated hospitalizations and intensive care unit admissions, and the excessive ranges of inhabitants immunity to SARS-CoV-2 .‚Äù

‚ÄúWhereas the worldwide danger evaluation stays excessive, there may be proof of lowering dangers to human well being pushed primarily by excessive population-level immunity from an infection, vaccination, or each;‚Äù the company detailed, ‚Äúconstant virulence of presently circulating SARS-CoV-2 Omicron sub-lineages in comparison with beforehand circulating Omicron sub-lineages; and improved medical case administration.‚Äù

‚ÄúThese components have contributed to a major international decline within the weekly variety of COVID-19 associated deaths, hospitalizations, and admissions to intensive care items because the starting of the pandemic,‚Äù it continued. ‚ÄúWhereas SARS-CoV-2 continues to evolve, the presently circulating variants don't seem like related to elevated severity.‚Äù

The change in designation will enable the W.H.O. to shift to addressing the virus with modifications to long-term care as a everlasting problem fairly than an ongoing emergency. The company emphasised that it could proceed to supply vaccine merchandise and work to extend entry to those merchandise to poorer nations regardless of the de-escalation of the emergency stance. Vaccine merchandise that the W.H.O. accredited in an emergency course of would stay obtainable beneath these licenses, it additionally famous.", 'Tedros Adhanom, Director Basic of the World Well being Group, (L) shakes fingers with Chinese language President Xi Jinping earlier than a gathering on the Nice Corridor of the Folks, on January 28, 2020 in Beijing, China. (Naohiko Hatta ‚Äì Pool/Getty Photos)

Some vaccine merchandise first heralded as being on the forefront of confronting the illness have been lately retired. In america, the Meals and Drug Administration (FDA) announced in April that it had withdrawn emergency use authorization for the unique monovalent mRNA-technology vaccine merchandise developed by the companies Moderna and Pfizer-BioNTech, on the grounds that they didn't deal with the most typical variants presently in circulation right this moment. The FDA famous that it continued to authorize up to date vaccine merchandise that addressed the ‚Äúomicron‚Äù subvariants of Wuhan coronavirus developed by these firms.

The W.H.O. concluded its announcement with options to governments, together with calls to ‚Äúcombine‚Äù coronavirus vaccine merchandise into already present vaccine schedules for different ailments and to finish all coronavirus journey restrictions.



Woman Gaga to embattled WHO Chief: "Dr. Tedros, you‚Äôre really a celebrity." https://t.co/ECdhCJFhcq

‚Äî Breitbart Information (@BreitbartNews) April 19, 2020

The W.H.O. declined to finish the emergency as lately as this January. Tedros famous then that, whereas the world was ‚Äúin a much better state of affairs now‚Äù than a 12 months prior, tens of 1000's of coronavirus-related deaths had been nonetheless being documented across the 12 months.

‚ÄúWe stay hopeful that within the coming 12 months, the world will transition to a brand new part wherein we scale back hospitalizations and deaths to the bottom potential stage,‚Äù he said on the time.
Tedros made the announcement that coronavirus illness rose to the extent of a PHEIC in late January, expressing concern that it might devastate international locations with weak healthcare infrastructure. Tedros went out of his method to emphasize that the designation was not meant to sentence China, because the origin nation of the virus, for its poor dealing with of the illness.



‚ÄúThis declaration shouldn't be a vote of non-confidence in China. ‚Ä¶Quite the opposite, WHO continues to have the arrogance in China‚Äôs capability to manage the outbreak,‚Äù he insisted.



I'm declaring a public well being emergency of worldwide concern over the worldwide outbreak of #2019nCoV, not due to what is occurring in #China, however due to what is occurring in different international locations.https://t.co/HNrxyGeoBA

‚Äî Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus (@DrTedros) January 30, 2020

The Wuhan coronavirus first emerged in that central Chinese language metropolis in late 2019; leaked Chinese language authorities paperwork surfacing within the\xa0South China Morning Submit counsel that the federal government diagnosed its first an infection in people on November 17, 2019. The Taiwanese authorities alerted the W.H.O. to the existence of a brand new illness within the final days of December 2019 ‚Äì regardless of the W.H.O. blocking the island nation from membership to the United Nations group ‚Äì noting that its intelligence revealed worry amongst well being employees of the unfold of an unidentified infectious illness. Taiwanese officers famous a necessity for isolating sufferers within the letter, suggesting human-to-human transmission.

‚ÄúTaiwan did report our concern on the severity of coronavirus final December to the WHO,‚Äù The Taiwanese Financial and Cultural Consultant Workplace (TECRO) in Washington, DC, told Breitbart Information in March 2020. ‚ÄúHowever as a rule, our reporting is at all times a one-way road. W.H.O. largely ignored our messages and by no means shared data as they do to different international locations.‚Äù

On January 14, 2020, the W.H.O. introduced it had ‚Äúno clear proof of human-to-human transmission of the novel coronavirus.‚Äù



Preliminary investigations carried out by the Chinese language authorities have discovered no clear proof of human-to-human transmission of the novel #coronavirus (2019-nCoV) recognized in #Wuhan, #Chinaüá≥. pic.twitter.com/Fnl5P877VG

‚Äî World Well being Group (WHO) (@WHO) January 14, 2020

The W.H.O. admitted such transmission lower than two weeks later and declared the PHEIC earlier than the tip of January. By then, 5 million folks had traveled out of Wuhan in the course of the Lunar New 12 months vacation, spreading the illness worldwide.

Author: chrissysblogliveshere
Paragraphs: ['This article by Mediawatch raises some interesting arguments, let me tell you about them. \xa0', 'When the Covid-19 pandemic first arrived in New Zealand back in 2020 (World Health Organization, 2022), it put the country into crisis mode.\xa0', 'We experienced our first ever nationwide lockdown and began social distancing. Suddenly we could no longer pop around to our friend‚Äôs houses for a quick cup of tea. We were encouraged to stick to our household bubbles, to wear face masks and to regularly sanitize our hands (World Health Organization, 2022).', 'But none of this could prepare us for the destruction that this virus was about to cause to many kiwi families (World Health Organization, 2022). ', 'I still remember exactly where I was on the day the NZ (New Zealand) Government made the announcement 2 years ago. I was living in a rural area at the time, sitting outside on the deck, soaking up the sun, looking out at the farmland and deep forests beyond. So quiet and peaceful, and with plenty of fresh air to breathe, it was exactly the sort of place you could relax and unwind. ', 'That was the day we found out we were going into lockdown. ', 'Stay within your bubbles and if you need to go outside for exercise, walk around your neighborhood. One person per household could go shopping and we all had to stand in line while a few people at a time were let into the store, as others came out. No more public gatherings and more social distancing (Covid19 Response, 2022). ', 'It was also the day that I had broken my phone and there were no stores open for me to buy a replacement. I bought a simple and cheap phone from the gas station, which turned out to be one of the worst purchases I ever made. Going through lockdown without a phone was not an option for me though because I wanted to stay connected to people. \xa0', 'Two years on since our first lockdown and the coronavirus pandemic in New Zealand is ongoing, just like in many other parts of the world (Donnell, 2022). Most of us are aware that the pandemic is ongoing, despite alert level systems, lockdowns, managed quarantines, isolations, and traffic light systems, which aimed to hold the virus now gone. Even though we do not all need to wear face masks or do social distancing anymore, covid is in fact still here. ', 'Take the influenza pandemic for example which started in 1918, a virus that was here 100 years ago, and is still around to this day in 2022. People are affected every year by the flu, but now we can manage the symptoms better and the death toll has significantly decreased. Covid-19 is the next influenza virus (Donnell, 2022). ', 'When Newstalk ZB host Heather du Plessis-Allan announced on the talk show (Donnell, 2022) that the pandemic was over, it could not have been more poorly timed, or perfectly timed as it could serve as a lesson about sensitivity and awareness. Despite lesser news reports and conversation about the virus, just because the restrictions and mandates had been lifted, does not mean we are taking a break from Covid-19. \xa0', 'On that same day, eight people had been announced dead with Covid-19 in New Zealand (Donnell, 2022). ', 'I think the issue there is that du Plessis-Allan didn‚Äôt choose her words carefully when describing the current pandemic status. I don‚Äôt believe she meant to dismiss all the tragedy and loss that so many New Zealand families have endured since the first case here in 2020.\xa0', 'I think she came from a place that we can all relate to about the restrictions and vaccination mandates that were placed on us for so long. Speaking about the frustrations we all experienced, for everyone nationwide who endured loss and adjusting to life with the pandemic. If the pandemic is here to stay, then we may as well get on with our lives with business as usual. \xa0', 'But she isn‚Äôt alone in feeling this way with Stuff news reporting that their audience was no longer interested in covid related news. National leader Christopher Luxon returned from an overseas trip and reported that covid conversations were not happening anymore (Donnell, 2022).\xa0', 'In New Zealand, our hospitals are in a crisis, struggling to accommodate patients in need of beds for recovery after surgery due to them being occupied by patients affected by covid (Donnell, 2022). This is truly alarming to me as we are still in the early stages of the pandemic, just two years after the first reported case in NZ. If this is happening now, what will happen in the future if we can‚Äôt resolve this? \xa0', 'New Zealand journalists can definitely have a bigger impact on what direction we should now take when dealing with covid content. When the pandemic first hit, the media flooded us with information about what we should do in a crisis. Now that we are aware the coronavirus is likely to be around for a longer period of time, the media should focus on how covid will continue to be an ongoing issue and deliver us the truth surrounding covid issues, as they have an obligation to serve the public‚Äôs best interest (Myllylahti, 2022). ', 'On the surface, the lack of covid representation in the media and public conversations does make it easier to feel like it‚Äôs over. It‚Äôs like the old saying ‚Äúout of sight, out of mind‚Äù. The truth is that the virus is still here, fatally harming New Zealanders, even if there is now less media coverage and restrictions, we are not on a covid holiday. We shouldn‚Äôt go on about our lives like nothing is wrong, but even if we do it is not denial but wanting to regain a sense of normalcy again after our lives have changed dramatically. \xa0 ', 'So, what can our journalists do? Apply pressure to government to bring back traffic light or alert level systems, wearing masks in public and social distancing? Do we need to bring back lockdowns when cases begin to rise again? Masks were horrible to wear during the warmer months, but I think we do need to make sure our safety measures are in place to protect those who are more vulnerable than others. I‚Äôm not sure that going into lockdown again would be a good idea. \xa0', 'As someone who has medical conditions that can affect chances of getting covid (CDC, 2022) and living with an at-risk individual, we both have taken personal safety measures and I would support the idea of the traffic light system returning instead of the alert level system. I don‚Äôt agree with going into lockdown and I think businesses would suffer even more if they had to shut down again. The traffic light system allowed us to have more freedom, as well as access to essentials, although it does come at the cost of being vaccinated which many do not agree with. \xa0', 'I had my covid vaccinations done to protect myself and my family which is the most important reason to consider when deciding to get the vaccination. It‚Äôs a personal choice, some people might not live with their family or be around a person who is at risk, so the most important reason then would be if it was right for them. Some do not agree with having the vaccine and that is okay too. \xa0']

Author: chiragblogs
Paragraphs: ['Equity-oriented schemes show negative sales:\xa0A sharp slowdown in economic activity across the globe and volatility in equity markets caused by the sudden outbreak of coronavirus has led to the negative fund flows in equity mutual fund schemes since July-August months of 2020.', 'REIT has witnessed a whopping investment of Rs 735 crore in 2020:\xa0REIT comprises a portfolio of commercial real estate assets, a considerable portion of it consist of leased out assets. Although, relatively new investment instruments in the Indian context, lowered interest rates post-pandemic is currently fuelling some investment in the sector.', 'Modified segregation of portfolio by SEBI:\xa0According to the partially modified norms related to segregation of portfolio amidst COVID19 by Sebi, the restructuring by the lenders/ investors solely due to COVID-19-related stress or under the RBI framework, the credit rating agency are not supposed to consider the same as a default event. The circular further stated that AMCs should treat the date of the proposal for restructuring of debt received by them as the trigger date for the creation of a segregated portfolio. Once the AMCs receive the request of restructuring of debt, they are to report the same to the valuation agencies, credit rating agencies, debenture trustees and AMFI (Association of Mutual Funds in India). AMFI should further disseminate the same to its members.', 'The new directive of SEBI will impact SIPs and cheque-based transactions:\xa0The new guidelines necessitate the mutual fund houses to allocate units upon realization of funds irrespective of the ticket size. That might influence the systematic investment plans (SIPs) and cheque-based transactions. Besides, it would further bring uniformity to net asset value (NAV) allocation as it discontinues the investment limit criteria and makes it uniform for any amount of investment.']

Author: brisbanelife
Paragraphs: ["Queensland has recorded one of its highest death tolls of the pandemic, with 27 COVID-related fatalities in the latest reporting period.\nActing Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken said today's death toll included 23-month-old Ruby Edwards, who died from COVID-19 at the Queensland Children's Hospital on Sunday.", '"But the bulk of them [the deaths], the rest of them, are people aged over 50," Dr Aitken said.', '"The vast majority are people in their 80s and 90s at 17 of the 27, and a significant number of those people either had not been vaccinated or have only had one vaccine and certainly have not had their full access to boosters.', 'Read More: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2022-07-28/qld-coronavirus-covid19-record-deaths-ruby-edwards/101276448']

Paragraphs: ['Considering travelling during the pandemic would require quite some precautions that are essential to protect yourself and others in contact with you from COVID-19. The wide-spread vaccination holds promise for ending the coronavirus disease. As we get vaccinated, it remains crucial to take all sorts of necessary precautions. Thoroughly check and follow all safety requirements. There are CDC recommended coronavirus travel advice, that you can follow up on while on the go for a safe trip. You can also visit your nearby clinics for Travel vaccinations in Uxbridge', "If you're on a travel plan during the pandemic some questions are recommended that you need to find out for yourself.", '‚óè \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 What is the condition of COVID19 in the region that you are opting to travel to?', 'The more cases in your community or at your desired location of travel, the more likely you are to contract and spread COVID-19 during travel. So, make sure you have a thorough knowledge of the coronavirus travel restrictions in case there are any for your destination.', '‚óè \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Are you at a heightened risk for serious illness?', 'Anyone can get COVID-19, but the older adults and people of any age with certain medical conditions or immunologically compromised beings are at an increased risk for severe illness from COVID-19.', "‚óè \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Do you reside with someone who's at intensified risk for drastic indisposition?", "There's always a possibility to get infected while travelling. This will cause you to spread the virus to the people you live with when you return, even if you are asymptomatic. Travelling amidst the pandemic or not, one must always refer to Travel vaccinations in Hillingdon, to ensure that they have an immunization with regards to every disease that is rampant in the area that they are planning to travel.", 'The need for Corona vaccination:', 'The world is amid a COVID-19 pandemic and the vaccines and precautions are the only way that this disease can be eradicated once and for all. You can opt for the COVID-19 vaccine all the while searching for Tips for Specific Medical Conditions to keep you healthy and protected. You can also visit the Travel Clinic in Hillingdon for more information with regards to travelling amidst the pandemic.', 'For more services click here: https://www.lawtonpharmacy.com/ ']

Author: solarhealthsupplies
Paragraphs: ['Masks should be worn as part of personal protective equipment and as a public health measure to prevent the spread of the coronavirus (COVID19). However, their use is deeply associated with social and cultural practices and has many personal and social connotations.', "The CDC states that you should wear the best possible protective mask that fits right and is comfortable. Best breathable face mask like cloth mask is comfortable but doesn't provide as much protection as a waterproof medical face mask. However, the washable face mask made in the USA like nonsurgical N95 provides maximum protection against coronavirus. For this reason, CDC said that it should be reserved for healthcare providers.\xa0", "However, this much information is not enough to decide which mask to choose and which not to. Therefore, let's dig in deep to know how different types of masks work?\xa0", "Although every type of mask safeguards us from the spread of coronavirus, it is essential to know the usage of different types of masks. This is because by knowing the usage of different types, we'll know which mask to wear while entering the contagious area.\xa0", 'Waterproof Medical Face Mask', 'Also known as a surgical mask, this is a removable disposable mask. They are intended to protect the wearer from contact with droplets and sprays that may contain germs. Medical masks also filter large particles in the air when inhaled by the wearer.\xa0', 'For a more snug fit, tie the ear loops where they attach to the mask. Then fold and tuck unnecessary material under the edges. Wearing a surgical mask does not increase the level of carbon dioxide in the air you breathe.', 'Cloth Mask\xa0', "Cloth masks stop the release of droplets from the wearer's mouth in the air. They stop the release even when he speaks, coughs, or sneezes. Cloth masks, aka cotton dustproof face mask, also act as a barrier to protect the wearer from inhaling droplets released by others.\xa0", 'The most effective cloth masks are made from several layers of tightly-woven fabric, such as cotton. Masks with multiple layers will prevent more water droplets from getting through or out of your mask. Wearing a mask does not raise the level of carbon dioxide in the air you breathe.\xa0', 'KN95 Masks\xa0', 'A KN95 mask is a type of mask that meets certain international standards. It provides better protection than a medical mask because it screens out both large and tiny particles when inhaled by the wearer. However, be cautious when buying KN95 because many phony masks sold are not up to the mark.', "Once vaccinated, you can safely resume activities that are not possible due to the pandemic. However, if you're in a place where many people are hospitalized with COVID 19, the CDC recommends wearing a mask in public. Even if you are completely vaccinated, the government still advises wearing a mask in public areas. Therefore, wearing a mask every time we go out has become a must for us. To buy the best breathable face masks, visit the Solar Health Supplies website and get the best-rated deals."]

Author: decentralvaccine
Paragraphs: ['Pfizer and its partner BioNTech asked U.S. regulators Tuesday to authorize an additional booster dose of their COVID-19 vaccine for seniors, saying data from Israel suggests older adults would benefit.', '', 'Currently the U.S. urges two primary shots followed months later by a booster dose for everyone age 12 and older. The new application seeks to add a fourth shot only for the over-65 population that has been hit hardest by the pandemic.', '', 'The Food and Drug Administration and the Centers for Disease Control would have to approve the request. If so, a key question would be how soon seniors would be advised to roll up their sleeves.', '', 'While authorities say the vaccinations continue to offer strong protection against severe illness, they haven‚Äôt held up as well against milder infections especially those due to the omicron mutant. With COVID-19 cases finally plummeting after the intense omicron surge, public health experts are starting to look ahead to what next steps might be needed ‚Äî if a new variant crops up or, barring that, whether to try shoring up coronavirus protection in the fall at the same time people get flu vaccinations.', 'https://apnews.com/article/pfizer-seeks-approval-for-fourth-covid19-booster-0f4477f4dcc5d10f36974b66eac86d6c']

Author: ziqitzahealthcare
Paragraphs: ["The expansion of the coronavirus and its global reach has been a source of alarm and a call for coordinated action to stop it from spreading further. While you may be concerned about how to be safe during the pandemic, it's vital that we keep coronavirus-related stigma to a minimum, as it could exacerbate an already difficult situation.", '\xa0Individuals have been subjected to verbal and even physical harassment around the world because their ethnicity was incorrectly linked to the illness.', "\xa0Everyone who is affected by a public health emergency service is under a lot of stress. It's critical to keep informed as well as to be polite and supportive of one another. Words have power and adopting language that reinforces stereotypes might discourage people from getting tested and taking the steps necessary to protect themselves and their communities.", '\xa0What is social stigma? ', 'In the context of health, social stigma is the negative association that develops between a person or group of people who share characteristics and a certain illness. Because of a perceived association with a disease, persons may be labelled, stereotyped, discriminated against, treated separately, and/or lose status during an outbreak.', "\xa0Patients with the disease, as well as their caregivers, family, friends, and communities, maybe badly affected by such treatment. Even if they don't have the condition, those who share other features with this group may be stigmatised.", '\xa0\xa0Why is COVID-19 causing so much stigma?', '\xa0The level of stigma associated with COVID-19 is influenced by three main factors: ', "1) It's a new disease with many unknowns;", "2) we're afraid of the unknown; and ", "3) it's easy to associate our fear with 'others.'", "\xa0The public's confusion, anxiety, and fear is understandable. Regrettably, these factors also contribute to the spread of harmful stereotypes.", '\xa0What is the impact of stigma?', '\xa0Stigma can destroy social cohesion and lead to social isolation among groups, which may contribute to a situation in which the virus is more likely to spread, not less. This can lead to more serious health problems and make containing a disease epidemic more difficult.', '\xa0Stigma can:', '\xa0‚óè\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Encourage people to conceal their disease in order to escape discrimination.', '‚óè\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Prevent people from obtaining medical help right away.', '‚óè\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Dissuade people from engaging in good habits.', "Dr. Santosh Datar ‚Äì Medical Director Ziqitza Healthcare limited says such treatment can contrarily influence those with the infection, as well as them and their family, companions, and networks. Individuals who don't have the sickness however", 'share different attributes with this gathering may likewise experience the ill effects of disgrace.', 'The current COVID-19 flare-up has incited social shame and prejudicial', 'ways of behaving against individuals of specific ethnic foundations as well as anybody', 'seen to have been in touch with the infection. Which causes phycological illness and mentally issue. ', '\xa0In compliance with National Health Mission (NHM) Ziqitza Healthcare has set up 104 medical advice helpline which operates 24x7 through a call centre in the state of Odisha and Madhya Pradesh. The main objective of this helpline was to aid minor phycological illness and counselling. During Covid19 pandemic 104 was declared as official helpline for COVID related enquires and Ziqitza has been managing over 10,000 calls. ', '\xa0The "Saving & Enhancing Lives" mission of Ziqitza Rajasthan has resulted in the saving of over 42 million lives, as well as the transfer of 2.5 million corona patients and the management of over 2 million telehealth calls. ', '\xa0\xa0How to address social stigma', '\xa0Experts advise people to exhibit empathy for those who are afflicted, to learn about the condition, and to take effective, practical steps to keep themselves and their loved ones safe. Each of us may help to prevent discrimination by being nice, speaking up against negative stereotypes, learning more about mental health, and sharing personal experiences to provide the essential support.', '\xa0Words matter', '\xa0Certain phrases (i.e. questionable case, seclusion) and terminology used while discussing coronavirus disease may have a negative connotation for some people, fuelling stigmatising attitudes. They can reinforce negative stereotypes or beliefs about the condition, promote incorrect links between the disease and other causes, disseminate dread, and dehumanise those who suffer from it. This may cause people to refuse to be screened, tested, or quarantined.', '\xa0Spread facts, not fear', '\xa0Inadequate knowledge about how the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is spread and treated, as well as how to avoid infection, can exacerbate stigma. Here are a few things you can do to assist stop misinformation from spreading:', '\xa0‚óè\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Use only official, reliable sources such as the Ministry of Health, the World Health Organisation, and UNICEF.', '‚óè\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Before acting, believing advice, or spreading information online, check the facts on official websites or social media platforms.', '‚óè\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Spreading false information, even if it appears to be accurate, is not a good idea.']

Author: industryforecastnews
Paragraphs: ['The global\xa0telemedicine market\xa0size is expected to reach USD 298.9 billion by 2028, according to a new report by Grand View Research. The market is expected to expand at a CAGR of 22.4% from 2021 to 2028. Key drivers of the market include increasing incidences of chronic conditions and rising demand for self-care. Furthermore, enhancing internet application, virtual medicine and rising demand for centralization of healthcare are expected to save on cost incurred, which is one of the critical success factors attributing to market growth.', 'In the U.S. both state and federal laws have evolved to facilitate the widespread use of telemedicine to cope up with the COVID-19 pandemic. For instance, in March 6, 2020 the U.S. president signed Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act. It includes USD 8.0 billion emergency funding for the federal agencies and to expand reimbursement coverage for telehealth services. Various U.S. states also waived of the licensure for better utilization of the service. This positively impacted the market growth during the pandemic.', 'Rapid advancements in technology is further expected to boost the demand for online consultation, thereby contributing to the market growth of telemedicine solutions and services over the forecast period. For instance, in April 2020, American Well launched Amwell Private Practice that is a secure, simple and cost-effective solution for doctors to deliver virtual primary or specialty care for COVID19 patients. There has been a significant rise in telemental health visits over the past decade in the U.S. and the trend is expected to continue during the forecast period, thereby contributing to the adoption of telemedicine systems by hospitals and healthcare settings.', 'North America dominated the market for telemedicine and accounted for the largest revenue share of 34.4% in 2020 owing to high demand in the recent past followed by Europe. These regional markets are expected to show a similar trend over the forecast period due to rising healthcare awareness coupled with cloud-based technologies acceptance over the forecast period. A developed region such as North America has accounted for the maximum revenue share in the global industry due to the constant research and development initiatives.', 'Developing regions such as Asia Pacific and the Middle East and Africa are expected to experience positive growth in the industry owing to rapid demand for healthcare assistance, especially in the rural areas. Emerging economies including India and China are estimated to witness growth over the next eight-year period. Innovation and development towards telecommunication are anticipated to enhance further the growth in this region in near future.', 'Request Free Sample Report: https://www.grandviewresearch.com/industry-analysis/telemedicine-industry']

Author: krishnamaheshwari30098
Paragraphs: ['100 years ago, influenza (flu) pandemic (Spanish flu) cleared the globe, infecting an approximated one-third of the world‚Äôs population and eliminating at least 50 million people. The pandemic related deaths were greater than the cumulative number of military and civilian deaths from World War I, which was occurring simultaneously. At the time, experts had not yet identified flu viruses, but we know today that the 1918 pandemic was caused by an influenza A (H1N1) virus. The pandemic is commonly assumed to have transpired in three waves. ', 'More than 12,000 Americans died through the H1N1 (or ‚Äúswine flu‚Äù) pandemic that began from 2009 to 2010. The novel coronavirus pandemic of 2020 is expanding around the world as countries race to find a cure for COVID-19 and citizens isolated themselves from the crowded places to avoid spreading the infection since many carriers are asymptomatic for days before realizing they are affected.', 'As the COVID-19 outbreak advances to grow, comparisons have signified to influenza. Both aggravate the respiratory disease, yet there are significant differences between the two viruses and how they grew. This has important indications for public health measures that can be completed to respond to each virus. Firstly, COVID-19 and influenza viruses have similar symptoms. \xa0That is, they both influence respiratory condition, which manifests as a broad range of sickness from asymptomatic or mild through to severe disease, also death. Secondly, both viruses are spread by contact, touch, droplets and fomites. As a result, the same public health measures, such as hand hygiene and healthy respiratory etiquette (coughing into your elbow or a tissue and immediately disposing of the tissue), are important actions all can take to limit infection. ', 'The speed of transmission is an important point of difference between the two viruses. Influenza has a shorter median incubation period (the time from infection to appearance of symptoms) and a shorter serial interval (the time between successive cases) than COVID-19 infection. The serial interval for COVID-19 virus is estimated to be 5-6 days, while for the influenza virus, the serial period is 3 days. Children are significant drivers of influenza virus transmission in the community. For COVID-19 virus, initially, it was shown that children are less affected than a grown-up.', 'Spanish flu infection was most dangerous to children, pregnant women, elderly, those with underlying chronic medical diseases and those who are immunosuppressed. For COVID-19, the current studies show that the older age and underlying conditions increase the risk for severe infection. Mortality for COVID-19 seems higher than for influenza, especially seasonal influenza. The worldwide attempt to create a safe and efficient COVID-19 vaccine is bearing fruit. A handful of vaccines presently have been authorized around the globe; many more remain in development.', 'Indian vaccine tracker presently has been split in two. The first chart details vaccines that have gained regulatory authorization or approval; the second continues to follow candidates in Phase 1-3 clinical trials and some hopeful candidates in early development.', 'India began one of the world‚Äôs most ambitious vaccination plans, aiming to inject 300 million of its population of 1.3 billion by July 2021. India has the world‚Äôs second-largest number of coronavirus cases, almost 10.5 million. It has so far passed two vaccines for use: the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine manufactured by an Indian company, and a domestic vaccine developed by Bharath Biotech which is yet to make clinical trials.', 'Vaccines are the most important thing in this world right now and we need to co-operate and understand the government about their distribution patterns. Knowing that India is the second country with the covid cases, it is important to have the spreading of Covid19 under control. ', 'Right now, vaccines are provided to the frontline workers who are fighting against the Covid19 \xa0even now. India is the second largest country in the world in terms of population and to distribute vaccines to all 1.3 billion people, the quantum of vaccine production has to be very high on a daily basis. ', 'While the Government is trying to make the vaccine affordable to the common man, it may still remain a challenge to distribute the vaccine effectively and some may still find it difficult to buy the same.', 'Some crowdfunding platforms may come forward to raise funds for the distribution of vaccines to those who can not afford it. Covid19 vaccine should be available to everyone as even one single positive Covid case can cause a butterfly effect.', 'Every life is valuable.', 'Source :-\xa0https://filaantro.org/blog/index.php/post/vaccines-are-important-in-this-world-right-now/49']
