Author: krishnamaheshwari30098
Paragraphs: ['COVID19 originated in Wuhan, China last year. COVID19 also known as coronavirus is an infectious disease. After WHO declared COVID19 as a pandemic on March 11 2020. India went under the lockdown for 21 days initially on March 24 2020. India with a 1.3 billion population across various states, health irregularities, unfolding economic and social differences, and different cultural and social values present unique challenges. The number of lockdown days ahead seems to be dependent on the recovery rate and economic criteria.', 'Current Hospital Setup in India', 'Health care is one of the most complicated activities in which human beings engage. Hospitals are service organizations. Healthcare services make up a significant portion of national expenses, and thus the nature and quality of services must be explored.', 'The Pandemic outbreak has set off a chaos in the healthcare system and the fragile healthcare infrastructure has not be able to cope with such an outbreak. The Indian government which is trying hard to tackle this crisis is now are focusing on ramping up its tattered healthcare facilities to face the pandemic.Every Indian state today has similar priorities: add new beds, improve the capacity of intensive care units, requisition portions of private hospitals, order lifesaving ventilator or a respiratory machine, recruit medical practitioners on contract, weigh in on extending services of retiring doctors and nurses and maintain select government hospitals for Covid-19 patients.Further means like converting medical colleges and railway coaches into isolation wards, stadiums into quarantine facilities, and readying part of hospitals under defense, central police forces, and railways for Covid-19 patients. The railway factories were asked to immediately assess the feasibility of manufacturing items such as hospital beds, medical trolleys, masks, sanitizers, and, most importantly, ventilators.There are only 94 ventilators in 128 railway hospitals across India where the ventilator inventory is estimated to be a mere 40,000, clearly inadequate given the rampage created by Coronavirus so far. International experiences have shown that 5-10% of patients need ventilator support to survive.In India out of all the positive cases 70 percent of cases affected by the infection either exhibit mild or very mild symptoms. Such cases may not require admission to COVID-19 blocks or dedicated COVID-19 hospitals.Hygiene being one of the most important factors today to deal with health and with Covid19, we need to understand the importance of Hygiene in everything i.e Hospitals, Homes, food, and the topmost important factor of keeping yourself hygienic.', 'PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)', 'Personal protective equipment is the special equipment that a person wears to create a barrier between you and germs. This barrier reduces the chance of touching, being exposed to, and spreading germs. It is necessary for all the health care workers and all the fighters fighting in the frontline to have this as a protection layer.', 'Child Help Foundation has performed multiple activities where they have guided the Frontline Workers on the knowledge of COVID19, how to avoid infections, distributed masks, gloves sanitizers, and PPEs to the needy.', 'Nutrition', 'Good nutrition is very important before, during, and after an infection. While no foods or dietary supplements can prevent COVID-19 infection, maintaining a healthy diet is an important part of supporting a strong immune system. A good and healthy diet is one of the main sources to keep a human body healthy. During this time poor nutrition in childhood is associated with both short-term and long-term adverse consequences such as poorer immune status, higher caries rates, and poorer cognitive function and learning ability. These problems arise primarily because parents do not have enough money to spend on food, not because money is being spent unwisely on different things.', 'During these tough times where the world fights against COVID19, Children living on the streets require the most attention concerning food and nutrients. They are exposed out in the open where they need proper dietary food to face the risk.The Child Help Foundation has been on the forefront to ensure food to the needy. Child Help Foundation, along with its Partner NGOs and Volunteers has catered to more than 3 Lakh Individuals with rations and basic medical supplies. During these difficult times, we all need to come together and fight as one for everyone against the risk which we all face.Kids living on the streets may not have all the privileges which becomes a more difficult war for them to survive this outbreak. .Malnutrition plays a vivid role in almost all the children on the streets. In India 44% of children under the age of 5 are underweight. 72% of infants have anemia.When food prices rise and supply chains break down, the wages of the poor and vulnerable fall substantially. All the daily wagers and the poor are struggling to fight for a living, first and then fighting against the virus. At such times, it is always the women and young children who are the hardest hit, especially children with deficiencies and low immune system. Notable management intervention is then needed to ward off undernutrition and poverty, which can weaken the immune system and increase susceptibility to the disease.Child Help Foundation workers, therefore, continue to distribute rations of rice, dal (pulses), wheat, and oil - to the needy and young children, to ensure that they receive their regular supply of nutrients during these critical periods of their life. Rations are being provided from door to door at the homes of the needy.Today, we have reached a place where we need to think of everyone as family and help them to survive. Doctors, Policemen, Medical staff, Corporation workers, daily wagers, kids, youngsters, and as Indians we all need to stay strong and support each one. It is a phase, it will pass, but it will become a little easier and less scary if we do it together.In the days to come, as the challenges of healthcare, food becomes too chaotic for Governments and too costly for NGOs to manage, the onus ultimately will fall on the Government. A good amount of infusion of funds is required to set things right so that we are prepared in advance to face such situation. Child Help Foundation is focussed on Medical Emergencies, Education, Water and Sanitation, Menstrual Hygiene, Gender Equality, Zero Hunger, and Calamity Relief.  ']

Author: hniverntt
Paragraphs:
['One of the most effective ways healthcare workers or the coronavirus  frontline workers can be safe is by wearing virus protection clothing. Personal  protective equipment or PPE acts as a protective barrier against disease-causing  viruses, which are often secreted by the patients in the form of droplets while  they cough or sneeze. A coronavirus is a highly contagious disease that can even  be fatal, it is essential to wear proper protective clothing while caring for or  treating Covid19 patients. Virus protection clothing includes gloves, gowns,  facemasks, aprons, boots, eyewear, and so forth. So, does everyone need to wear  virus protection clothing, or should only healthcare workers wear  it?

Significance of wearing protective gear

The recent global  coronavirus pandemic has turned the entire world system topsy-turvy with its  highly contagious feature and death toll. Though it originated in a wet market  in , it spread to the entire world within a few months, infecting billions with  the exponential growth of death rate in several countries such as the USA,  Italy, Spain, Brazil, and Iran.

The novel coronavirus continues to spread  all across the countries in the world with health officials stepping up efforts  to contain the pandemic through various channels. As the virus is known to  spread through the droplets of the infected people, which include mucus and  saliva, it is important to wear protective clothing while you are in close  contact with them. This is precisely the reason doctors, nurses, and other  healthcare professionals need to wear PPE while treating or caring for a COVID  positive patient.

According to medical research, the deadly virus can  stay suspended in the air for more than 10 minutes when an infected person  coughs or sneezes. It is also believed that an asymptomatic person can also be  contagious which is why it is necessary to wear facemasks and gloves when you  are in a public place.

To protect your loved ones and yourself from the  coronavirus, you need to follow the standard protocol of social distancing,  wearing protective facemasks, washing your hands frequently with soap and water,  using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer, covering your face with a tissue or  sneezing into your elbow while you are at a public place. All these measures  will help to reduce the risk of transmission and slow down the progress of the  contagion. Though a complete lockdown or restricted movement can seldom halt the  spread of this contagious disease, it will slow down the process of mass  infection. It will also limit the amount of strain howo  rear bridge universal joint pin on the medical infrastructural facilities,  which are quite limited even in advanced countries.

Due to the alarming  rise in coronavirus cases across the globe, there has been a substantial  shortage of virus protective clothing, which is extremely essential for  healthcare frontline workers. Today, millions of companies across the globe have  initiated the process of manufacturing protective gear to safeguard human  lives.']

Author: athravpharmaofficial
Paragraphs: ['COVID19, also known as coronavirus 2 of the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARSCoV2), is an infectious disease derived from bats and thought to infect humans. Because this is a new form of virus, the etiology that causes the disease is not fully understood, drugs and vaccines for this virus are still being tested, and regulatory agencies recommend effective drugs and vaccines. not. Not only coronaviruses, but many other viruses also lack preventative vaccines and effective antivirals. Studies show that these viruses may create drug-resistant variants that reduce the effectiveness of existing drugs. Therefore, these viruses can pose a threat to humankind for a long time.', 'Ayush Kwath for Covid', 'Considering the importance of immunity-boosting measures after the COVID19 outbreak, the AYUSH Ministry, Government of India in the interest of promoting public health, recommends ‚ÄúAyush kwath powder immunity booster‚Äù or ‚ÄúAyush immunity booster powder‚Äù or ‚ÄúAyush kwath powder‚Äù ‚Äù includes four types of medicinal herbs. Herbs such as basil, cinnamon, ginger, and black pepper are readily available, easily accessible and widely used in cooking, and handy for the education and training of public and community health workers. and even the public in treatment. with herbal home remedies. This will help boost immunity and reduce gatherings in hospitals and pharmacies during this pandemic. This type of public health measure will promote ‚Äúhealth for all‚Äù with the theme of ‚Äúour health in our hands‚Äù by empowering each person by participating actively in their own health. they instead rely on the mass distribution of certain drugs. As people leave their homes to earn a living, this herbal decoction will ensure widespread access to healthcare. WHO SEARO adopted a resolution to revive primary health care through strengthening health systems to achieve health for all with a focus on health promotion and disease prevention. This kwath is not just a mechanical mixture invented for the COVID19 pandemic, it is a revival of medical traditions.', 'Atharva Pharmaceutical Pvt. Ltd., is a unit of Pran Sanjeevan Aushadhalaya and set up by Ayurveda Acharya Pt. Born in Haveli Kharagpur in Munger Bihar in 1910. Murari Lal Ji‚Äôs sole purpose is to treat needy and poor patients. He focuses on providing the best treatment using Ayurveda, and Jibic products made under strict quality control. Athrav Pharmaceutical Pvt. Ltd., develops its own medicines like Ayush kwath powder, Shilajit, Dee Veda to cure diabetes herbally, Hair and skincare products like skin whitening cream, anti-aging cream, under-eye cream, hair oil, and shampoo combos, etc. Athrav Pharma believes that Ayurveda is an effective way to prevent and treat illnesses more personalized. Athrav Pharma‚Äôs products are known for their strict quality protocols and standards and their efficacy because the ingredients being used in its products are scientifically proven. To boost immunity across all ages, Athrav Pharma has launched a range of immunity-boosting Ayurvedic medicines that promises to keep you healthy and immune. These products are now available online in India at the Athrav Pharma website.']

Author: galeriaripens
Paragraphs: ['The COVID19 new coronavirus was declared a global pandemic by the World Health Organization in 2020 [1]. In nearly 200 countries/territories, millions of people have been found to be infected with the disease, and the death toll has increased to millions [2]. Governments around the world have taken significant, and often unprecedented, steps to limit the behavior of their citizens by imposing limits on gatherings, requiring mandatory testing, restricting travel, and enforcing mandatory quarantine for citizens crossing national and international borders [3]‚Äì[5]. In order to counteract the spread of COVID-19, a number of technical interventions have been implemented in addition to movement and interaction restrictions.', 'Many countries, including Australia, Singapore, Germany, and the United Kingdom, have deployed mobile phone applications to track individual contacts [6]. These apps offer granular bigdata analytics on the spread of the disease in the community, as well as speedy identification of persons who have been in contact with others and are being tested. They also provide alerts to individuals who need to be tested. Researchers are also working on a variety of other assistive technologies that could help combat the COVID-19 pandemic, including the use of drones for surveillance and package delivery, as well as the deployment of AI and machine learning algorithms to improve detection and diagnosis from medical images [7], [8].', 'Non-contact fever-screening stations were one area where new technology use grew throughout the pandemic. These devices are deployed in places where people can be quickly screened for higher body temperature, such as at the entry to workplaces and other high-risk areas, and only admitted if their temperature measurement is below a predetermined threshold.', 'Along with blood pressure, heart rate, and respiration rate, body temperature is one of the four vital indicators that healthcare practitioners measure on a regular basis [9]. Because it is generally carefully controlled by a number of thermoregulation processes within the body, it is a significant vital indicator. Significant changes in body temperature are a warning sign that something is wrong with the underlying physiological processes. Fever is one of the oldest medical phenomena, characterized by an increase in core body temperature, and has been researched extensively for millennia [10]. The development of thermometry, and now widespread use of it, has made core-body temperature a standard clinical diagnostic tool in both acute and non-acute situations. This is especially important during the COVID-19 pandemic, because fever is a common first-line diagnostic sign of the disease.', 'The result is that the usefulness and utility of NCIT and IRT fever-screening systems should be assessed in light of the risk profile of the measurement situation in question. A lesser sensitivity may be useful in a high-traffic setting, such as a train station, if no other monitoring approach is fast or low-cost enough. The capacity to detect and quarantine any large group of feverish people traveling in public could be extremely beneficial. In a high-risk lower-traffic environment, such as a hospital or an aged-care facility, where a false-negative measurement could have serious effects, the employment of these devices should be carefully examined.']

Author: goldcoastcitytalks
Paragraphs: ['Queensland has set a new daily record for vaccinations, with 62,409 administered yesterday, beating the previous daily record by more than 3,000 jabs. \nThe vaccination surge comes as Queensland braces for a rise in COVID-19 cases after opening its border to fully vaccinated travellers from interstate hotspots yesterday, marking a new phase in the pandemic.', 'New Chief Health Officer John Gerrard has warned the state could see "more than hundreds" of COVID-19 cases in the coming months.', 'Read More: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2021-12-14/qld-coronavirus-covid19-vaccination-rates-revisited/100696520']

Author: newsdata
Paragraphs: ['Digital news sources have flourished at an extraordinary rate, ranging from a handful of digital news posts to many digital news sources and publications. This is because news posts now cover a wide range of issues and events, increasing their reach. These publications not only represent the world but also change and shape our perception of it.', 'Storing news data is now common due to the high demand for instant access to historical news data, for which people commonly use the News API. These news datasets can be useful for research purposes and for personal and professional artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML).', 'If you are looking for historical news data to power your AI and ML algorithms, you can use these free news datasets or the Newsdata.io tool which I will mention below. News datasets can help you find a wide range of historical stories related to any topic, organization, person, and more.', 'In this article, we will discuss a simple and reliable way to access historical news data sets. Let‚Äôs get right into it.', 'Here are the top 20 news datasets that you can download for free for your personal and professional AI, machine learning, and data analytics projects.', '1. Newsdata.io', 'Name- Covid-19 news dataset', 'Link- https://newsdata.io/files/datasets/covid19-news', 'This Covid-19 dataset contains the latest world news related to Coronavirus.', '2. Kaggle.com', 'Name- BBC News Classification (News article categorization)', 'Link- https://www.kaggle.com/c/learn-ai-bbc', 'The dataset is broken into 1490 records for training and 735 for testing. The goal will be to build a system that can accurately classify previously unseen news articles into the right category.', '3. BBC', 'Name- BBC datasets', 'Link- http://mlg.ucd.ie/datasets/bbc.html', 'Two news article datasets, originating from BBC News, provided for use as benchmarks for machine learning research.', '4. Harvard Dataverse', 'Name- A Million News Headlines', 'Link- https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/SYBGZL', 'This contains data on news headlines published over a period of eighteen years. Sourced from the reputable Australian news source ABC (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)', '5. Newsdata.io', 'Name- Covid-19 and vaccine news dataset', 'Link- https://newsdata.io/files/datasets/covid-vaccine-news', 'This contains data on the latest published news headlines from across the web. News headlines with all the metadata and full description.', '6. Webz.io', 'Name- Political news articles', 'Link- https://webz.io/free-datasets/political-news-articles/', 'This contains world politics-related news article data fetch with the help of Webz.io news API.', '7. Paperswithcode', 'Name- COVID-19 Fake News Dataset', 'Link- https://paperswithcode.com/dataset/covid-19-fake-news-dataset', 'Along with the COVID-19 pandemic, we are also fighting an `infodemic‚Äô. Fake news and rumors are rampant on social media. Believing in rumors can cause significant harm.', '8. Kaggle', 'Name- India News Headlines Dataset', 'Link- https://www.kaggle.com/therohk/india-headlines-news-dataset', 'This news dataset is a persistent historical archive of notable events in the Indian subcontinent from start-2001 to end-2020, recorded in real-time by the journalists of India. It contains approximately 3.4 million events published by the Times of India.', '9. Data.world', 'Name- Economic News Article Tone', 'Link- https://data.world/crowdflower/economic-news-article-tone', 'Contributors read snippets of news articles. They then noted if the article was relevant to the US economy and, if so, what the tone of the article was.', '10. Archive.org', 'Name- World Politics news dataset', 'Link- https://archive.org/details/world-politics-news-dataset', 'This dataset contains the latest news related to politics around the world with the available news article‚Äôs metadata.', '11. IEEE.org', 'Name- Covid-19 and vaccine', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/covid-19-and-vaccine-news-dataset', 'This dataset contains world news related to Covid-19 and vaccine and also with the news article‚Äôs available metadata.', '12. IEEE.org', 'Name- World politics news', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/world-politics-news-dataset', 'This dataset contains world news related to politics and also with the news article‚Äôs available metadata.', '33. IEEE.org', 'Name- Covid-19 news', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/covid-19-news', 'This dataset contains all the latest news data related to Covid-19 from around the world.', '14. IEEE.org', 'Name- COVIFN : FAKE NEWS ON COVID19', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/covifn-fake-news-covid19', 'COVIFN is a CoVID-19-specific dataset that consists of fact-checked fake news scraped from Poynter and true news from news publishers‚Äô verified portals. The dataset was pre-processed, the removal of special characters and non-vital information is performed.', '15. IEEE.org', 'Name- FAKE NEWS ON HEALTHCARE', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/fake-news-healthcare', 'The Internet is a vast repository of useful knowledge, but it has been contaminated by the spread of false information. Relying on misinformation can be disastrous. According to a World Health Organization survey, about 6,000 individuals were hospitalized throughout the world as a result of fake news on COVID-19 in the first three months of 2020.', '16. IEEE.org', 'Name- NEWS CREDIBILITY DATASET', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/news-credibility-dataset', 'Features of each news according to seven credibility categories', '17. IEEE.org', 'Name- AI-Based automated extraction of entities, entity categories, and sentiment on Covid-19 situation.', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/ai-based-automated-extraction-entities-entity-categories-and-sentiments-covid-19-situation', 'Artificial Intelligence (AI) based in-depth analysis of social media content would allow a strategic decision-maker to obtain evidence-based responses to complex queries', '18. Kaggle', 'Name- Reddit Omicron Panic', 'Link- https://www.kaggle.com/yamqwe/reddit-omicron-panic', 'As we all know, a new variant of COVID-19 is spreading worldwide causing massive panic. This dataset captures mentions of the new variant on Reddit.', '19. Kaggle', 'Name- Omicron daily cases by country (COVID-19 variant)', 'Link- https://www.kaggle.com/yamqwe/omicron-covid19-variant-daily-cases', 'Tracking the progression of the new omicron COVID-19 variant', '20. IEEE.org', 'Name- Daily report of Covid-19 confirmed cases in Thailand.', 'Link- https://ieee-dataport.org/documents/daily-report-covid-19-confirmed-cases-thailand', 'A dataset contains a total of 578,375 COVID-19 confirmed cases reported in Thailand that were being recorded between 22 January 2021 to 30 July 2021.']

Author: mdadigitalcommunities
Paragraphs: ['Coronavirus has been the talk of the town ever since it ‚Äúgraced the world with its presence‚Äù at the end of 2019. Since its spread from a small city called Wuhan, the world has been affected massively in a negative fashion (Zhu, Wei & Niu 2020). Businesses, workplaces, social gatherings, the entertainment industry, the sports world, and people‚Äôs social lives, in general, have all been forced to make changes to adapt to the current circumstances. However, the primary issue is the ‚Äúvery real‚Äù threat of the virus and how society deals with this abomination is widely discussed or argued between the different factions of society. To counter the pandemic, Twitter, Facebook, and even Instagram are often used as tools to spread knowledge and raise awareness of Covid-19. ', 'Image Taken From Wikimedia Commons', 'So what has social media done so far to ease tensions and spread awareness of the current situation of Covid-19 so far?', 'Utilizing social media platforms in times of crisis is a regular occurrence, either it is in the face of natural disasters to send aid and inform the locals to avoid potential threatening locations or to educate the public on the spread of an epidemic. The process of integrating online media platforms with crisis management has been a known practice (Padeiro, Bueno-Larraz & Freitas 2021).\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'Image Taken From Tech Crunch', 'The influence of the current climate has people relying on social media, even more, to receive updates on the health benefits, prevention procedures, and overall methods to counter the unpredictable nature of this global pandemic and avoid contracting the virus. The middle eastern country of Saudi Arabia is a prime example of this, demonstrating an increase of social media users by two million from April 2019 to January 2020, at a time when the virus started receiving massive international attention (Almotawa & Aljabri 2020). The city of Riyadh, through a survey, reported a 58 percent level of awareness amongst the citizens through the use of Twitter and Facebook.\xa0', 'According to an article by Piper Liping Liu, the importance of personal responsibility is emphasized in various forms of social media. This includes an array of practices including social distancing, working remotely, avoiding participation in large social gatherings, and the vital use of masks    (Liu 2021)  . This is a clear indication of the fact that the general consensus in social media is the tendency of the virus to spread and being individually responsible is a gateway to containing Covid-19.', 'Image Taken From PAHO', 'A Video by the University of Pretoria Urging People to Act Responsibly during the pandemic', 'On the other hand, these platforms have also connected millions of people around the globe to deal with the large-scale psychological consequences of social distancing (Fullerton 2021).', 'References List', 'Almotawa, T & Aljabri, D 2020, Role of social media in creating awareness during COVID19 pandemic.', 'Fullerton, N 2021, ‚ÄúInstagram vs. Reality: The Pandemic‚Äôs Impact on Social Media and Mental Health - Penn Medicine,‚Äù www.pennmedicine.org, viewed <https://www.pennmedicine.org/news/news-blog/2021/april/instagram-vs-reality-the-pandemics-impact-on-social-media-and-mental-health>.', 'Liu, PL 2021, ‚ÄúCOVID-19 information on social media and preventive behaviors: Managing the pandemic through personal responsibility,‚Äù Social Science & Medicine, vol. 277, p. 113928, viewed 26 April, 2021, <https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0277953621002604>.', 'Padeiro, M, Bueno-Larraz, B & Freitas, √Ç 2021, ‚ÄúLocal governments‚Äô use of social media during the COVID-19 pandemic: The case of Portugal,‚Äù Government Information Quarterly, vol. 38, no. 4, p. 101620.', 'Zhu, H, Wei, L & Niu, P 2020, ‚ÄúThe novel coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan, China,‚Äù Global Health Research and Policy, vol. 5, no. 1.']

Author: jebecoblog
Paragraphs: ['The Federal Reserve came up with a wide range of ways to combat the effects happening to the economy from the covid 19 pandemic. One of those ways included FRB giving out money to combat the crash of the economy as they gave away ‚Äú$2.3 trillion in lending to support households, employers, financial markets, and state and local governments.‚Äù All though there is a lot of controversy on this topic I believe that this was a very smart decision on the FRBs part. This was a major step in stopping the affects of covid 19, it was very crucial and we wouldn‚Äôt be in the position we are today without it. Jerome Powell chair of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors was fully backing this process as he stated,\xa0‚ÄúWe are deploying these lending powers to an unprecedented extent [and] ‚Ä¶ will continue to use these powers forcefully, proactively, and aggressively until we are confident that we are solidly on the road to recovery,‚Äù Since this we have been on an amazing road to recovery. There are risks that come with this too, now that the FRB has lent this large sum of money it has to be payed back, by who and how? The federal government has also done many things to help like unemployment benefits. Millions of people lost there jobs due to covid 19 so the Federal Government stepped in and ‚ÄúOn March 18, 2020, President Trump signed into law the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA), which provided additional flexibility for state unemployment insurance agencies and additional administrative funding to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic. The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act was signed into law on March 27. It expands states‚Äô ability to provide unemployment insurance for many workers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, including for workers who are not ordinarily eligible for unemployment benefits.‚Äù With the new unemployment benefits that were being provided by covid 19 brought a lot of positive and negatives with it. It was amazing for someone who lost there job and were on the search for a new one, this would help them and there family live until they figured something out, but then this brought people who no longer wanted to get a job and thought that unemployment was nice and waited longer and longer to start looking for a new job. I think this was necessary to help people and families that truly needed this to survive during the pandemic but it is unfair that people that just took advantage of the unemployment checks. Yes I believe the stimulus helped get our economy going. This allowed people to pay rent, buy food, buy clothes etc. When this happens it supports businesses and the cycle of the economy starts to get going again, yes I agree with the stimulus bill. The federal government has major plans ahead of them to keep fighting the affects of covid 19. The Biden-Harris plan has many things planned ahead in the future that is going to help our economy extremely well.\xa0', 'Work cited -\xa0', 'https://www.brookings.edu/research/fed-response-to-covid19/']

Author: lsundarinfo
Paragraphs: ['The ongoing COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted our travel plans globally as lockdown measures restrict much of the world‚Äôs population home quarantined during peak seasons of traveling. The stringent travel restrictions have forced us to shelve our vacations. As per the official records of the United Nations World Tourism Organisation, more than 200 countries have imposed procedures to break the spread of Covid-19. Such curbs have resulted in turning the tourism industry into one of the largest casualties of the coronavirus pandemic, deterring people from entering international borders. However, with businesses across the world taking precautionary measures and an increasing number of countries opening their arms to tourism, you can begin planning to travel once again.', 'Countries to explore during the Covid-19 pandemic:', 'If you are planning to travel abroad, and enjoy the vacation you deserve, there are many options for you to explore. These places are considered to be safe to travel during the Covid pandemic since they decided to close their borders as soon as the first few cases started to get detected and therefore, they are pertinently in a healthier state. As countries around the world have started to unbar their borders to tourism again after a long period of lockdown, it is time for us to dive deeper into what travel looks like under this new normalcy of social distancing protocols. In this blog, you will get to know which places are the best to travel to in the COVID-19 world.', 'Tourists are considering their next travel destination and to help them in the quest, we have curated a list of the countries which have unfastened their travel restrictions and are open to international passengers. The state of Qatar, United States of America, United Kingdom, Bhutan, South Africa, Ukraine is some of the places which are allowing inbound travel to the country with health guidelines to curb the virus spread.', 'A trip to Australia: Vacation amidst restrictions!', 'One such green country to travel to amidst the challenging times in Australia. Concerning the ongoing virus, this country has been making its best efforts to curb the spread of covid-19, making it one of the greatest countries to travel to. In March 2021, Australia also opened its travel bubble with the New Zealand borders for travellers to have a free-quarantined journey between the two nations. It is also mandatory for all passengers to show a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours before departure from their state. You should complete the Australia Travel Declaration that collects your information to help the Australian Government determine your quarantine arrangements.', 'On arrival, all travellers must quarantine themselves for two weeks at a designated hotel at their own expense. The government has also imposed new rules wherein passengers won‚Äôt be allowed to travel if they had a positive Covid-19 test in the previous 14 days or present flu-like symptoms. These restrictions have helped the country control the covid19 situation effectively. In addition, swift border closures have brought numbers down again.', 'In Australia, conditions are relatively normal, although new rules are brought in when case numbers rise. Masks are not mandatory but recommended when there is a significant flare-up of state-wise cases. Currently, in Melbourne, face masks must be worn on public transport, in hospitals, care facilities, shopping malls, markets, and stalls. Restaurants and bars are required to keep records of their visitors and are requested to limit the number of customers.', 'So, if you are looking for wild open spaces, world-class beaches, delicious food, and drinks, Australia is a traveller‚Äôs paradise for you. Australia is an absolute bundle with every natural beauty in its spade. Its coral reefs, picturesque beaches, national parks, stunning rain forests, and scorching deserts excites you to enjoy, have fun and spend an amazing vacation in this country. With so many places to visit in the beautiful yet peculiar Australia, there are many thrilling and blissful Australian tourist attractions for your next vacation even during the pandemic!', 'Road-Trip on the Australian highways: From renting a car to getting an IDP.', 'Australia is famous for its vast region and there is so much to experience. The best bet to savour your Australian experience is to self-drive throughout the journey. It is a fantastic way to experience some great cities, wide-open spaces and dive yourself into the tremendous natural scenery. If you intend to self-drive and encounter destinations, the best way is to rent a car. The country has over 600,000 miles of highways that can take you all over this continent nation.', 'Before you set off on your expedition, you must know about the Australian car hiring process. To rent a car in Australia and obtain an International Driving License you should be at least 21 years old with a driving license. As an international tourist, you must have an English-written overseas driver‚Äôs license. If you don‚Äôt possess one, the English translated document of your license from your embassy or road traffic authority in your home country will also be valid. If your foreign license does not have a photo, carry formal photo identification with you such as a passport. In Australia, car rental companies usually accept English language driving licenses.', 'However, if your driver‚Äôs license is in a language other than English, you shouldn‚Äôt worry. Your International Driving Permit (IDP) is proof that you hold a current domestic driver‚Äôs license and it is only valid if you carry your domestic driver‚Äôs license with your IDP. An International Driving Permit will help you rent a motor vehicle in Australia, aid in identification or assistance, thereby enabling you to embark on your road journey.', 'The major parts of Australia are sparsely populated indicating rental restrictions in the country. If you plan to travel into Tasmania, Western Australia, and the Northern Territory, it is recommended to check its permission with Auto Europe since many of the Australian agencies restrict travel in these places on certain vehicle categories. In addition, before renting a car in Australia, you must also be aware that it is illegal to smoke in the car; especially if you are traveling with underage children. Moreover, you should always use the left-hand side of the road to park your car.', 'A tour around the country: Famous tourist attractions:', 'One of the most thrilling roads tripping in Australia will be a drive through the Outback region. The desert is the perfect place to maintain social distancing and adhere to restrictions while traveling in Australia. Its remoteness makes the desert a vast unpopulated area. To experience an unforgiving environment, you‚Äôll need to be significantly prepared if you‚Äôre planning on driving across the middle of the continent. You will adventure all the beautiful indigenous sacred spots like Uluru and Kata Tjuta. To reach here, you can either fly from cities like Melbourne or Sydney to Uluru or you can fly to Alice Spring and make your way down to there.', 'Other tourists‚Äô places for you to tour around the land of kangaroos are the Great Ocean Road, Carlton Gardens, Opera House, Canberra, Fraser Island, Sydney Harbour Bridge, and the list is endless. To enrich yourself in a memorable experience, you must also explore skiing at snowy mountains and sky diving in Melbourne.', 'With the Covid 19 outbreak, we at International Traffic Control Association (ITCA) have accelerated the digitization of our services. This has enabled us to issue a pdf version of your original International Driving License on your mail address.\nYou can easily print the softcopy document and carry it with you to a foreign land. Moreover, this will also save you from the shipment charges.', 'So, map out a lifetime trip to Australia and explore the beauty of the island continent. Embark on your journey and find yourself immersed in shopping, sightseeing, and savouring the best of Australian cuisine. A land of diverse occasions, all the Australian tourist attractions are a great place for a vacation.']

Author: basicchemicals
Paragraphs: ['Market Overview', 'The global HoReCa market is projected to reach approximately USD 2.38 trillion, at a CAGR of 3.15%, from 2021 to 2028. HoReCa stands for hotels, restaurant, and caf√©s & pubs and is an important service sector in the global economy. It primarily consists of hotels, restaurants, and bars accounting for about two thirds of the global turnover.', 'The outbreak of Covid-19 has caused a downward trend in the HoReCa industry as lockdown and ‚Äústay at home‚Äù orders given by governments across the globe and consumers preferring to stay indoors to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus. The pandemic has forced restaurants to close their doors to dine-in customers resulting in a sharp drop in HoReCa industry growth. However, with gradual relaxation of government norms, hotels, restaurants, and caf√©s & pubsare primarily focusing on cleanliness and safety precautions to restrict the spread of the virus. Owing to this, there is a significant gap in supply and demand as there is a limitation in dine-in seats, lodging rooms, and has even impacted operation time. Furthermore, the HoReCa industry is highly responsible for crowd management to follow social distancing norms. Moreover, with the increasing Internet penetration in developingregions and the escalating growth of online food delivery services, food service outlets that cannot attract consumers are turning to either home delivery services or approaching third party food delivery platforms such as GrubHub and DoorDash. Therefore, gradual relaxation of government restrictions and rising popularity of online food delivery services are expected to drive the overall HoReCa industry during the forecast period.', 'Competitive Landscape', 'Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. (US)', 'Hyatt Hotels Corporation (US)', 'Marriott International, Inc. (US)', 'InterContinental Hotels Group plc (UK)', 'Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC (US)', "McDonald's Corporation (US)", 'Yum! Brands, Inc. (US)', 'Restaurant Brands International Inc. (Canada)', 'Inspire Brands, Inc. (US)', 'The Coca-Cola Company (Costa Coffee) (US)', 'Market Segmentation', 'Restaurants: This segment accounted for the largest market share in 2020 and is projected to grow at the fastest pace during the forecast period. Restaurants control 46.5% of the sales in the overall HoReCa industry owing to the growth of its fast-food segment over the last few years. The demand for take-out food has boosted the segmental growth as increasing number of consumers are opting for convenience along with quality food and wide variety. Furthermore, restaurants offer curbside service where consumers place ordersvia phone calls or e-mails and provides the restaurant with their car license plate number. When aconsumer drives into the parking lot, a restaurant employee brings the ordered food out to the car. This type of service has been a very popular service specially in the US and has fueled the restaurants market across the globe.', 'Access Full Report Details and Order this Premium Report @', 'https://www.marketresearchfuture.com/reports/horeca-market-10535', 'Regional Analysis', 'North America: North America dominated the global HoReCa market in 2020. Strong real estate industry, presence of popular hotel chains, and hectic schedule have impacted the lifestyle of Americans. Growing travel and tourism industry;increasing number of emigrants; presence of diverse food culture;and wide availability of a range of cuisines have led to the growing demand for HoReCa industry in the region.', 'Europe:', 'Asia-Pacific: Asia-Pacific is a new revenue pocket for the HoReCa market.The growing populationin China and India hascreated an opportunistic market for the existing players.Increasing exposure to international cuisine and culture andthe willingness to experiment with food items have further fueled the regional market growth. Additionally, attractive seasonal offers and happy hour discounts offered by HoReCa are further aiding to the growth in Asia-Pacific market.', 'NOTE: Our Team of Researchers are Studying Covid19 and its Impact on Various Industry Verticals and wherever required we will be considering Covid19 Footprints for Better Analysis of Market and Industries. Cordially get in Touch for More Details.', 'About Market Research Future', 'At Market Research Future (MRFR), we enable our customers to unravel the complexity of various industries through our Cooked Research Report (CRR), Half-Cooked Research Reports (HCRR), Raw Research Reports (3R), Continuous-Feed Research (CFR), and Market Research & Consulting Services.', 'MRFR team have supreme objective to provide the optimum quality market research and intelligence services to our clients. Author: net4news
Paragraphs:
['NEW DELHI: Seventy percent of India's adult population has been administered the first dose of Covid-19 vaccine, Union health minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Monday as the total doses given across the country crossed 91 crore. 
According to officials, 25 percent of the adult population has been administered both doses. 
"Strong Nation, Rapid Vaccination: India has administered the first dose of #Covid19 vaccine on 70% of the population. Under PM @NarendraModiji, India is achieving new landmarks in the fight against the pandemic. Keep it up India, let us fight Corona," the minister said in a tweet. 
The cumulative Covid-19 vaccine doses administered in the country under the nationwide anti-coronavirus inoculation drive crossed 91 crore on Monday. 
More than 71 lakh vaccine doses have been administered till 9.50 PM, according to the Co-WIN portal. 
The daily vaccination tally is expected to increase with the compilation of the final reports for the day by late night. 
More than 5.67 crore (5,67,37,905) balance and unutilised vaccine doses are still available with the states and UTs to be administered, the ministry said. 
According to government data, the average daily doses administered in a month increased from 19.69 lakh in May to 39.89 lakh in June, then further to 43.41 lakh in July and to 59.19 lakh in August. 
The average daily vaccination in September has been 79.08 lakh per day. 
The vaccination exercise as a tool to protect the most vulnerable population groups in the country from Covid-19 continues to be regularly reviewed and monitored at the highest level, the ministry underlined. 
The countrywide vaccination drive was rolled out on January 16 with healthcare workers (HCWs) getting inoculated in the first phase. The vaccination of frontline workers (FLWs) started on February 2. 
The next phase of Covid-19 vaccination commenced from March 1 for people over 60 years of age and those aged 45 and above with specified co-morbid conditions. 
The country launched vaccination for all people aged more than 45 years from April 1. 
The government then decided to expand its vaccination drive by allowing everyone above 18 to be vaccinated from May 1. 


Source link
Read the full article']

Furthermore, ongoing efforts to flatten the curve of infection, globally, have prompted contact tracing and rapid diagnostic tests, which is likely to minimize the spread of the infection.', '¬∑ Growing pandemic of COVID-19 and rising fear among people, along with healthcare care professionals advocating early diagnostics to reduce the risk of infection, fuel the COVID-19 diagnostics market', 'Request a PDF Brochure- https://www.transparencymarketresearch.com/sample/sample.php?flag=B&rep_id=80305', 'RT-PCR Test to Lead Global Market', '¬∑ The global COVID-19 diagnostics market can be segmented based on test type, end-user, and region', '¬∑ In terms of test type, the global COVID-19 diagnostics market can be divided into polymerase chain reaction (PCR), POC test, and immunoassay test. Author: mercy701
Paragraphs: ['‚Äú Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.‚Äù (Curie, 1934)', 'As opposed to the general consensus, my outlook on the Covid-19 pandemic is optimistic in nature, although I have had my fair amount of trials and tribulations. At the start of this pandemic last year, we were all overcome with shock and fear of what was to come, and to a certain extent we still have this fear at the back of our minds.\xa0', '(Sharma, 2021)', 'Thereafter came the lockdowns and the quarantining, this impacted both our mental and physiological health, as we were confined to our homes, banned from any social gatherings and were forced to endure the fear of not only contracting the virus, but also dealing with the deaths of those around us.   Thus we see a need to increase\xa0 access to mental health support services geared towards providing measures for developing healthy coping mechanisms during the current crisis.‚Äù  (Singh et al., 2020).\xa0 Dealing with the ongoing loss of our loved ones really showed us the strength of our minds, and how without even knowing, we are all capable of enduring any challenge that may come our way.', 'Another important factor which this pandemic has taught us is the power of unity. Although we are not allowed to physically be united, due to social distancing, we need to maintain our unity in mind and spirit. The only way through this pandemic is together, if we all work together to learn and teach one another about the virus, abide by the protocol and restrictions, as well as provide support to those that are in need we can overcome this battle.', 'Personally one the main disadvantages of this pandemic to my life was the fact that I was prevented from doing my ‚Äúseva‚Äù (service to mankind)   (Jois, 2021)  , as we are currently not allowed to perform any voluntary work due to the severity of the virus and the pandemic regulations thereof.  ("Volunteering during the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic", 2021) .On the bright side, this taught me not to look so far to provide service to others, as I am able to help those around me, be it those who are in need of basic necessities or those who are in need of menial tasks, service to mankind cannot be measured by the importance of the support you provide, but rather the act of helping.', 'And then came the\xa0‚Äúvaccines‚Äù, this is probably one of the most controversial topics in discussion at the moment. I don‚Äôt think any of us have done as much research about medication, side effects and general health prior to this pandemic. With only 13.2% of our population vaccinated   ("Before you continue", 2021)  , and the remainder uneasy about receiving it, we face a drastic issue as we need to be vaccinated in order to return to our previous quality of living.\xa0', 'Thus, we as a society need to stay educated and updated on the current affairs and status of this pandemic, in order to make quality decisions that will not only benefit ourselves but those we love and care about, and the only way we can achieve this is by maintaining our strength even through the face of difficulties, and most importantly together as one.', 'References:', 'Before you continue. (2021). Retrieved 19 September 2021, from https://news.google.com/covid19/map?hl=en-ZA&state=7&mid=%2Fm%2F0hzlz&gl=ZA&ceid=ZA%3Aen  ', 'Marie Curie Quotes - BrainyQuote. (1934). Retrieved 19 September 2021, from https://www.brainyquote.com/authors/marie-curie-quotes  ', 'Jois, R. (2021). What Is Seva: The Yoga Practice of Selfless Service. Retrieved 19 September 2021, from https://www.sonima.com/yoga/yoga-articles/the-power-of-seva/  ', 'Singh, S., Roy, D., Sinha, K., Parveen, S., Sharma, G., & Joshi, G. (2020). Impact of COVID-19 and lockdown on mental health of children and adolescents: A narrative review with recommendations. Psychiatry Research, 293, 113429. doi: 10.1016/j.psychres.2020.113429  ', 'Volunteering during the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. (2021). Retrieved 19 September 2021, from https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/articles/volunteering-during-coronavirus-covid-19-pandemic']

Author: victory7493
Paragraphs: ['The first case of the COVID-19 pandemic was found in Wuhan, China. This pandemic has influenced the whole planet with its major impacts on the economy and businesses across the globe. The COVID-19 spread worldwide in unprecedented ways due to its high infectious and contagious nature. As a result, the greatest medical challenge in the 21st century is yet to be faced by physicians worldwide. Though the emergence of the\xa0virus\xa0can be traced back to Asia, many European countries, along with the U.S., have been struck massively by the pandemic. The virus has spread across all regions ranging from North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East, and Africa up to South America. The COVID- 19 has been declared as a pandemic by World Health Organization (WHO) due to its increased spread across the globe. After the declaration of the pandemic, various countries announced the complete lockdown, such as Russia, Europe, and many Asian countries in order to decrease its spread. During this pandemic of COVID-19, the rising prevalence of respiratory disorders and increasing demand for peak flow meters in hospitals due to\xa0airborne\xa0infectious diseases are accelerating the market growth amid this pandemic, the demand for ventilators,\xa0humidifiers, respiratory inhalers. According to the situation report of 8th June 2021 by WHO stated 173 million cases of coronavirus patients had been reported globally, and 3.7 million patients have died due to the coronavirus. America is leading in cumulative cases with a record of 68 million and 1.8 million death rates. At the same time, nearly 1.45 billion doses of Covid-19 vaccines have been administered globally. The outbreak of COVID-19 is having a huge impact on the healthcare and supply chain of various medical products, including peak flow meters.', 'The color code zones from peak flow meters help to detect when a patient should visit the doctor. The green zone determines that breathing is stable, yellow zone determines caution where a patient might have to increase the medication plans. The red zone indicates the dangerous situation where emergency care must be implemented.', 'Peak flow meters allow patients to regularly monitor breathing changes by detecting airway narrowing before getting noticing symptoms. They are easily portable and convenient in usage by blowing air through the mouthpiece of the\xa0device, which can measure the flow rate of air in liters per minute. These are available for usage by adults and young children of age 5. For instance, in asthma conditions, the device helps in tracking the control of breathing over time and helps to recognize the timely suitable treatment when required.', 'The COVID-19 pandemic has impacted the peak flow meters market from its niche pedestal to the mainstream sector. Even before the pandemic, the peak flow meters and based products were in high demand due to rising chronic respiratory diseases and advanced methods for treatments of various diseases globally.', 'For instance,', '¬∑\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 As per World Health Organization, around 65 million people have moderate to severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), out of which about 3 million die each year. These states respiratory diseases are the third leading cause of death.', '¬∑\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 World Health Organization also states about 334 million people suffer from asthma, which accounts for around 14% of children globally.', 'The rising transmission rate of coronavirus in the recent scenario has made high hospital admissions for various chronic diseases, and respective demand for respiratory ventilators and devices like peak flow meters are highly prevailing in the market. Peak flow meters could be used for measuring the force of air from the lungs to help in maintaining the asthma level of patients. Peak flow meters are portable and easy to use, which makes them more convenient for people to rely on. Regular use of this device will help the patient in maintaining their respiratory tract and thus, helps in detecting disorders earlier.', 'For instance,', '¬∑\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 As per World Health Organization, globally, at least 2 billion people are getting exposed to toxic industrial smokes of biomass fuels and burned gases which are released from poorly ventilated indoor stoves or fireplaces. This has dramatically increased respiratory illness among people irrespective of age.', 'The rising conditions of covid19 cases have further boosted the market growth due to the high requirement of oxygen level measurement at a constant time period. The rising home care facilities enabled for the elderly population with asthma and chronic respiratory conditions are aided by peak flow meters due to their easy application and less complex nature. These affirmative factors boost the demand for peak flow meters among healthcare professionals and customers.', 'This increases the demand for peak flow meters in the market. Several companies operating in other domains are eager to enter, and some have already entered the landscape of the peak flow meters market to increase their revenue by meeting the emergent need of various hospitals for respiratory ventilators and products. The demand is further rising in local clinics and small laboratories due to high awareness of the disease due to coronavirus.', 'The COVID-19 has created a great impact on the supply chain of peak flow meters. The sudden attack of COVID-19 and its subsequent impact on restrictions on trade and movement of goods has resulted in a shutdown of vast countries globally, resulting in disrupted supply chains due to limited materials and workforce, and slow down or stopping of manufacturing. Moreover, several manufacturing companies are retooling priority manufacturing to produce other essential medical supplies and equipment such as ventilators and peak flow meters; due to an increase in order from the consumers, the government has allowed the movement of transport vehicles to import and export the products which are highly required by hospitals and other healthcare sectors. Additionally, the manufacturers are also taking crucial steps to ensure the availability of raw materials by and also they have to look into the quality of products. Manufacturers need to take necessary steps about production processes, shifting to other facilities if required, changes in quality assurance, costs and procedures related to screening of workforce and offering of care if needed, changes in working hours, and others in order to maintain their supply chain.', 'To manage such a crucial situation, many organizations are looking forward to improving and diversified the supply chain model in all aspects. The resulting COVID-19 pandemic has shown the various ways for supply chain management, which may be effective by innovative solutions initiated by market players. \xa0', 'To minimize the supply chain crises, the government has been firmly monitoring the supply chain to assume that the COVID-19 outbreak may adversely impact the supply chain of a medical product, including shortages of ventilators and peak flow meters for various purposes in healthcare sectors in countries globally or potential disruptions in supply chains.', 'COVID 19 had a devastating impact on the global economy. Several establishments have to remain shut while others scale down their operations or put on hold expansion plans as they tried to survive the unprecedented crisis. However, the demand for respiratory devices, disposables, and measurement devices is rising due to increasing respiratory disorders and COVID-19. In spite of lockdowns and supply disruption crises during this pandemic, the companies are managing online sales for peak flow meters and their products. They are also maintaining fair prices owing to the high demand of these products in the market, but due to supply chain disruption price has risen slightly.', 'For instance,', '¬∑\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Netmeds sells their peak flow meter ‚ÄúBreathe O Meter Device 1‚Äôs,‚Äù which is a famous product of Cipla for Asthma and COPD at (INR 362.03) 4.88 USD.', 'The covid-19 impact has not affected the price of peak flow meters-based products at a high level because of advanced online sales and innovative delivery options available with utmost safety concerns.', 'The key players engaged in the global peak flow meters market are making improvements to keep the speed during COVID-19. They are taking every single choice cautiously so the development can be expanded on a consistent schedule for the market. The manufacturers are likewise giving a great deal of consideration in the improvement of inventive items that can be utilized for the attractive impacts. Organizations working in the peak flow meters market are embracing a few systems, including joint effort, arrangements, association, and market development to improve their business.', 'For instance,', '¬∑\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Vyaire Medical is one of the top players in the peak flow meter market. The company has taken the initiative in donating medical supplies and peak flow meters to India. They‚Äôve donated five Vela ventilators and two CPAP/BIPAP and oxygen concentrators to the Delhi E.N.T. Hospital, 100 Bellavista ventilators onsite for distribution in Delhi N.C.R., and 500 oxygen concentrators planned for distribution throughout India.', 'These essential choices by the organizations are required to give huge occasions to the market players working in the peak flow meters market.', 'The impact of the novel COVID 19 virus is expected to leave a long-lasting impact on each healthcare sector. The outbreak of COVID 19 prompted citizens to deal with confusion regarding the virus and its management. The virus poses a risk not just to human life but has caused economic distress and severe emotional strain. It produced a ripple effect that gave rise to a new collection of requirements and needs that were not much needed earlier, and an essential one is the peak flow meters and medicinal products, which are highly needed in hospitals, clinics, laboratories, and home healthcare setups due to rising chronic diseases and surgical emergence globally.', 'Moreover, many international governments, including U.S., Europe, and Asia‚Äôs healthcare organizations, have supported the supply of these products due to high priority in this crucial health crisis period. Many government bodies and significant market players are closely associated with patients as well as pharma industries for safe packaging of products considering contagious nature of virus and improvement of future economics.', 'It is estimated that the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak having a positive impact on the growth of the market owing to the enormous requirement and application of peak flow meters for respiratory disorders, chronic pulmonary conditions, asthma, and among more will resume with steady ease of supply restrictions by the government.']

Author: antilagardelle
Paragraphs: ['Good job Texas and Mississippi for reopening at 100% capacity and removing mask mandates! My thoughts on our catastrophic lockdown response to COVID:', '‚ÄúWe‚Äôre allotted a little space on earth [and] we survive in that wilderness that can take back what it has given, as easily as blowing its breath on us or sending the sea to tell us we are not so big. When we forget how close the wilderness is in the night, my grandpa said, someday it will come in and get us, for we will have forgotten how terrible it can really be. [...] ‚ÄòAsk no guarantees, ask for no security, there never was such an animal. And if there were, it would be related to the great sloth which hangs upside down in a tree all day every day, sleeping its life away. To hell with that,‚Äô [my grandfather] said,\xa0‚Äòshake the tree and knock the great sloth down on his ass.‚Äô‚Äù', '- Fahrenheit 451\xa0\xa0']

Author: somethingusefulfromflorida
Paragraphs: ['Most people probably think the word casualty is synonymous with the word death, but it actually includes both deaths and injuries; soldiers and civilians wounded during a war count as casualties, whether they die or not.\xa0 Since the American Revolution, there have been around 2.9 million American casualties in every war combined; 1.4 million deaths (48.3%), 1.5 million injuries (51.7%)', 'As of July 1, there have been 2.6 million cases of coronavirus in the United States alone.\xa0 The number of cases per day has surged recently, so we‚Äôll eclipse the total number of wartime casualties in about a week.\xa0 The actual death rate is much lower, only ~120k (4.6%), but I can‚Äôt stress enough how more people will have gotten sick in six months than have been affected by every single war in 250 years.', 'If we look only at the number of deaths, it still paints a horrifying picture', '37k Americans died in the Korean War: we passed this in mid-April', '58k died in the Vietnam War: we passed this in early May', '117k died in World War I: we passed this in late June', '405k died in World War II: we may plateau before we pass this, but there‚Äôs no guarantee. Cases could spike again, maybe a few times, before the virus finally burns itself out (if it ever does).\xa0 If things continue at their current rate, we won‚Äôt pass this until mid-2021.\xa0 I‚Äôd certainly hope our leadership will have pulled their heads out of their asses by then, but I‚Äôm not holding my breath.', '650k died in the US Civil War: likewise, we may not pass this until 2022.\xa0 Deaths appear to have been slowing in the last few weeks, so if we can get a handle on overall transmission, we should be able to keep this figure well below half a million.', 'It‚Äôs scary how widespread this is, and how little our government is doing to mitigate it.\xa0 If we don‚Äôt immediately change course, I can‚Äôt see an end in sight; we‚Äôre less than half a year in, things will almost certainly get worse before they get better.\xa0 Under any other circumstances, I would give a half-hearted platitude and simply say ‚Äúvote,‚Äù but that‚Äôs not going to be easy considering one half of the country is actively trying to disenfranchise the other.\xa0 That said, we‚Äôve been experiencing sustained social unrest for over a month now, so if this momentum continues we may be able to force the hand of the powers that be.\xa0 America is not doomed, there is hope, there is light at the end of the tunnel.', 'Keep the faith, stay strong, stay safe, stay home (if possible)']

Author: ucsdhealthsciences
Paragraphs: ['As the COVID-19 pandemic continues, there is an urgent need to determine who is at greatest risk for severe disease, better understand how the disease and treatments evolve, and predict the need for resources. But to get there, researchers and clinicians need more data about what patients have experienced so far, and what factors are associated with different patient outcomes.', 'To provide this information, a new research consortium invites clinicians, researchers, patients and the general public to submit questions that could be answered by COVID-19 patient record data from more than 200 participating hospitals. Questions are submitted and answers are provided via a new web portal: COVID19questions.org.\xa0', 'The consortium, called Reliable Response Data Discovery (R2D2), is led by Lucila Ohno-Machado, MD, PhD, chair of the Department of Biomedical Informatics at UC San Diego Health, and made possible by seed funding from the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation. R2D2 comprises 12 health systems (202 hospitals) to date: UC San Diego Health, Cedars Sinai Medical Center, Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich, San Mateo Medical Center, UC Davis Health, UC Irvine, UCLA, UCSF, University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus, University of Southern California, University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston and Memorial Hermann Health System, and the Veterans Affairs (VA) Healthcare System.', '‚ÄúNo single hospital alone has treated enough patients with COVID-19 to be able to see reliable patterns emerge, and use that information to guide the direction of new studies,‚Äù Ohno-Machado said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we formed the R2D2 Consortium.‚Äù', 'Unlike other patient databases and registries, the R2D2 COVID-19 Questions site allows health systems to maintain control of their own data rather than pool it in a central repository. No patient-level data are ever transmitted outside of each health system, only data aggregates, and the privacy of individuals and institutions is preserved. Through advanced computational methods, complex analyses involving multiple factors can be performed. Since the system queries all patient records, not just those with COVID-19, users can ask questions about how patients with COVID-19 compare to other patients. ', 'Here‚Äôs how the site works: Users submit questions about adults hospitalized with COVID-19. Consortium team members evaluate the submissions for clinical utility and likelihood that available data can provide answers. Questions are then translated into a computer code that queries a variety of electronic medical records in a way that will deliver reproducible results ‚Äî an ‚Äúapples to apples‚Äù comparison, as Ohno-Machado puts it. Each health system runs the code on their own patient records and provides the results to the consortium. When sufficient results accrue to be statistically meaningful, the answers are posted back to covid19questions.org ‚Äî not as definitive conclusions, but as data in the form of charts or other graphics, which researchers can further pursue. ', 'Among the questions already asked and answered: ', 'This graph represents part of the answer R2D2 Consortium electronic medical records provided to the question ‚ÄúAmong adults hospitalized with COVID-19, how does the in-hospital mortality rate compare between those who received glucocorticoids and those who didn‚Äôt? How does that differ by age, ethnicity, gender and race?‚Äù More data like this are provided at COVID19questions.org.', 'The COVID-19 Questions site can draw from data on more than 45 million patients, including more than 59,000 who tested positive for COVID-19 and 29,000 who were hospitalized with the infection. To position the data to best reflect U.S. demographics, the R2D2 Consortium made a point of diversifying the patient population by including not only academic health systems in wealthy metropolitan areas, but also small community hospitals, safety net hospitals and the VA. ', 'As additional health systems around the world join the consortium, Ohno-Machado said the data available will become more diverse and robust, and the team will be able to answer more questions, more efficiently.', '‚ÄúThe scientific community has talked about using electronic medical records for guiding research and for answering relevant questions for a long time,‚Äù Ohno-Machado said. ‚ÄúBut until now we haven‚Äôt been doing it in a way that the public can see ‚Äî this is much different than when only scientists can ask questions and publish their findings in academic journals.‚Äù']

Author: incorrect-pretzel-cheese-bag
Paragraphs: ['You check the time. It says 10:27. You could have sworn it said 10:27 and hour ago.', 'Even though you turned your camera off for the Zoom meeting, the green light of the webcam is still on. You check, and you have no other tabs open.', 'You look at all the others in the Zoom meeting. You focus on one of your colleagues. Their name and face is unfamiliar, but everyone insists they started working there the same day you did.\xa0\xa0', 'Every afternoon, at the same exact second, you receive an email from your boss, and every afternoon, it says the same thing,‚ÄùWe try our best to assist our beloved employees during these trying times,‚Äù and has an attachment attached. You know you‚Äôve clicked on the attachment before, but right after you click off it, you can‚Äôt seem to remember any of it.\xa0', 'Your coworker is a new mom and always has her child with her during the meets. One day, the child is gone. You ask about it, but everyone is confused. No one in your office has ever had a kid.\xa0', "Your supervisor has always had bright blue eyes. He has an odd ceramic behind him.\xa0‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an heirloom,‚Äù he always says whenever someone brings it up. Every meeting, you swear the ceramic moves ever so slightly closer. On day, it rests on your supervisors desk, instead of the back shelf. The next day, your supervisor's eyes are a dark brown color and his odd ceramic is back on the back shelf, but with bright, blue eyes.\xa0", 'You check the time. It says 10:27. It‚Äôs been 4 hours since the last time you checked it.']

Author: serenata-your-neighborhood-lefty
Paragraphs: ['Leading pollster firm YouGov had found\xa0‚Äúan immense increase in support for socialism over the last year‚Äù, particularly among Millennials and Gen Z.', '60% of Millennials support a ‚Äúcomplete change of our economic system away from capitalism,‚Äù and 57% of Gen Z does as well.\xa0', 'Over one-quarter of Millennials and Gen Z report a favourable view of Marxism.\xa0', 'Growing up, we witnessed the devastation of Afghanistan and Iraq from United States imperialism. When we were coming of age and entering the job market, our futures were severely impacted by the breakdown of the global economic system. And now, facing the worst pandemic since the Spanish Flu, the ruling class has refused to implement the necessary measures to stop the spread of the virus so that they can protect private profit.\xa0', 'It‚Äôs hardly surprising that young people are disillusioned by the capitalist system. And while there may be confusion over the meanings of the term ‚Äúsocialism‚Äù,\xa0  there is a general sense that it represents greater social equality, the guarantee of a decent wage, free high-quality education and the right to universal health care.  ', 'The world is changing - young people have the potential to change it for the better.\xa0', 'Source']
