Author: chrysocomae
Paragraphs: ['Please share this essay from a healthcare worker from r/CoronavirusUS', 'What to expect when you get critically ill from COVID-19. A healthcare worker‚Äôs perspective.', '"I am a healthcare worker who has volunteered to be a part of the COVID ICU ‚Äúproning team‚Äù at the hospital where I work. I am writing this because my colleagues and I had a long discussion today about how disconnected the public is when it comes to the harsh reality of this virus and what it does to people. I will describe in as much detail as possible what you should expect to ‚Äúexperience‚Äù when you get critically ill from COVID-19. ', 'By the time I meet you in the hospital, you‚Äôre already intubated in the ICU. This means that you likely started feeling terrible enough to get yourself to a hospital and then got admitted into said hospital. Your condition worsened to the point that the medical team determined that your best chance of survival would be to place you in a medically-induced coma and hook you up to a ventilator that literally breathes for you. The process that leads up to this point is traumatic, terrifying, and lonely. You are allowed zero visitors and your only interactions are with strangers that come into your room unannounced, wearing what look to you like hazmat suits. The hospital you‚Äôre staying in isn‚Äôt equipped with enough ‚Äúnegative-pressure‚Äù rooms to contain the virus and keep it from spreading to the hallway so there will be a giant window unit that pumps all the air from your room out the window vs allowing it back into the hospital. This window unit is LOUD (similar to a generator) and it will drive you absolutely insane because it MUST be running 24/7. So, you‚Äôre just going to have to accept that. As terrible as all this external hell feels, it‚Äôs nothing compared to what‚Äôs going on internally. Your body is deteriorating. Every breath is a gasp. Turning over to face the door when you hear a knock is impossible because you are literally THAT exhausted. Your oxygen levels continue to drop, even though you are being pumped MASSIVE amounts of pure oxygen through your nose (which is now bleeding constantly because it is completely dried out). The oxygen levels drop so low that the only course of action is to make you comatose, give you a paralyzing agent so you don‚Äôt thrash, and place you on a ventilator. Ok, so NOW let‚Äôs get to the bad part. ', 'You‚Äôre laying on a bed, on your back. Unconscious, naked, Foley catheter in your urethra, and maybe (if your nurse is lucky) a FlexiSeal in your anus to collect all your diarrhea (look it up if you have questions). A ventilator is placed down your throat, somewhere between 20-28centimeters down. It will probably move around if it‚Äôs not tethered, which is a no-no, so it will be taped to your head/face. We‚Äôll come back to this later, because that tape will eventually mess up your face, maybe permanently. A feeding tube goes down your nose because comatose people can‚Äôt eat, obviously. So your diet is now a nutrient-packed yellow mushy soup. Yum! Ok this is the basic setup. ', '', 'Even with all this medically-engineered hoopla, you continue to deteriorate. The ventilator is running 100% oxygen down your throat, into your lungs but still not enough is getting into your blood. This is where organ failure starts to happen. Kidney failure, brain damage, etc. And this is where me and my ‚Äúproning team‚Äù show up at your door. ', '', 'Prone = laying on your stomach. ', '', 'Supine = laying on your back. ', '', 'Proning = turning you from your stomach onto your back.', '', 'Why do we do this? Well, to simplify it, the back of your lungs are bigger and better at oxygenating your blood. But when you‚Äôre laying on your back, all the fluid (LOTS of fluid) in your lungs accumulates and fills the back of your lungs - thus drowning them and making them much less effective. Flipping you onto your stomach causes that fluid to move to the front of your lungs (because gravity), freeing up the back of your lungs to do their better job. Honestly, it‚Äôs pretty amazing to see how quickly you will go from 79% oxygen (SpO2) to 93% as soon as we turn you onto your stomach. It‚Äôs very satisfying for us. Makes us feel proud. We‚Äôll pat you on the back, literally, and give you kudos for this oxygen accomplishment. ', '', 'We will plan to leave you in this prone position for somewhere between 12 to 18 hours. Your head is turned to the side, otherwise the ventilator tube would be rammed through the back of your mouth. Don‚Äôt worry, we will position this for you, you‚Äôre paralyzed, remember? ', '', 'Once those 12 - 18 hours are up, the prone team comes back in to flip you back over to supine. This is where things can get ugly. Being paralyzed and on your stomach leads to A LOT of swelling/edema. Especially in your face. Your tongue has swelled up to ~5x it‚Äôs normal size and it doesn‚Äôt fit in your mouth anymore. Lips swell x5 times, too. Your eyelids have been taped shut but they‚Äôre swollen too. It looks like you have golf balls under your eyelids. Now, remember that tape that holds the ventilator tube in place? Well, it‚Äôs still holding tight. And with all the face/mouth swelling, I should emphasize the word TIGHT. You‚Äôll be in this condition for a while. Maybe a week, maybe two, maybe three. That tape will get replaced daily but it will do some damage to your skin, especially your lips and ears. And since your blood isn‚Äôt getting proper oxygen, your body isn‚Äôt great at healing wounds. So, expect your face to look a little different for a LONG time, if you make it out alive. I now can say that I have seen a living person‚Äôs cheekbones. Not the form of the cheekbones, but the ACTUAL bones, because their wounds on their cheeks got so bad that the flesh necrotized and sloughed off during the friction involved with a head turn. ', '', 'Where were we? Oh yes, we just flipped you back to supine. The 5 of us will be doing some routine care on you: wiping you down with Chlorhexidine Gluconate (CHG) wipes, putting Venelex cream and Mepilex patches your bed sores (think bony prominences - knees, clavicles, sternum, shoulders, nipples, shins, cheeks, etc.), using a suction device to suck up all the secretions from your mouth and nose, cleaning up your diarrhea from EVERYWHERE and changing that pesky face tape. Don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôll be gentle. ', '', 'Now, it‚Äôs been maybe 10-15 minutes on your back. We stand back and assess how you‚Äôre doing. If you‚Äôre a champ, your oxygen levels stay in the low/mid 90s and we can leave you like this for 1 to 8 hours before you start deteriorating again, at which point it‚Äôs back onto your stomach. ', '', 'The idea is that each time we put you back in supine, you‚Äôll be able to maintain longer and longer periods of time before your oxygen drops to the 80s or 70s (or 60s, 50s, 40s, you get it). ', '', 'The longer you‚Äôre in this ICU situation, the worse it gets. Eventually, we have to start doing all the routine care from the side-lying position, because putting you on your back could literally kill you. The supine position becomes intolerable - your blood pressure starts to plummet, your heart skips beats or shoots up to the 200s (or just stops) and your oxygen level drops immediately. So, unfortunately, you go back onto your stomach. More swelling, yay! Repeat this process daily and hope for better results each time. The more often we have to repeat, the less likely you are to survive, because it‚Äôs an indicator of how poorly your lungs are recovering. ', '', 'Now, this is the point where someone might ask, ‚Äúwhy are you keeping this person alive? Isn‚Äôt it inhumane to prolong this person‚Äôs suffering? What quality of life will they have when/if they survive?‚Äù Unfortunately, that‚Äôs not our choice. Even more unfortunately, it‚Äôs likely not even YOUR choice. Who‚Äôs choice is it? Your Medical Power of Attorney (MPOA), which 9 times out of 10, is a family member. Now, remember, there are zero visitors allowed for COVID-19 patients. That means that your family is getting ALL the information about your condition from a phone call or texts messages from someone on the healthcare team. Your family can‚Äôt see you and they can‚Äôt talk to you. Thus, they simply cannot appreciate just how much you are suffering. How could they? It‚Äôs not their fault. They love you. They‚Äôre praying for you. They‚Äôre wondering if they are making the right choice but they are doing so without all the information, because a phone call from a doctor or case manager can only go so far. ', '', 'Above all, they are holding on to hope. Hope that you‚Äôll come back from this. That you‚Äôll be that patient in that next news video that gets the standing ovation as they‚Äôre wheeled out of the hospital because YOU MADE IT. And I hope you do, too. We all do. We care about you. If you make it out of that ICU, you‚Äôve got months of rehab ahead of you. Your fight for life has JUST started. The success story is that, against all odds, you didn‚Äôt die. ', 'Or, maybe you did. As I write this, 170,000 people have died from COVID-19 in the US alone. Each one of those people had a story, a life, a family, dreams, goals and a future. So many of them suffered tremendously through their last days, with strangers. Now they‚Äôre gone, forever. And that ICU bed is ready for the next one. I hope it‚Äôs not you. I hope it‚Äôs not your mom, dad, grandpa, aunt, sister, child or neighbor. But if it is, you can count on me and my coworkers to be gentle with you and treat you with dignity and respect. We will do everything in our power to get you home. This virus doesn‚Äôt care about your political affiliations, your plans, your freedoms. It doesn‚Äôt care about you at all. So we will. ', 'Now, if I may.....please wear your damn mask.', 'Edit: The title says ‚Äúwhen you get critically ill.‚Äù Emphasis on the ‚Äúcritically ill.‚Äù This is NOT what the average person should expect when they test positive. Most people DONT get critically ill. The VAST majority of people will never even see a regular hospital room, much less the ICU - I tested positive and I recovered at home with no medical intervention. Most will have mild symptoms and then recover. That being said, this post reflects a real possibility and a current reality for many people. I want people to understand the harsh reality of COVID-19. It affects everyone differently and taking small, practical precautions can keep you from ever having to wonder ‚Äúis this going to happen to me?‚Äù or ‚Äúdid I get grandma sick because I didn‚Äôt take this seriously?‚Äù I apologize that this came off as fear mongering. The post reflects my experience as a healthcare worker and I feel that the public hasn‚Äôt had enough of that experience other than ‚Äúwe are overworked and tired.‚Äù']

Author: emmett-is-a-bad-poet
Paragraphs: ["It's been almost a year since I last took the train. ", 'I remember being so tired from my long half-day on campus and feeling so confused. ', 'We were to all go home for spring break a day early and wait for more instructions.', 'Campus shut down because COVID came too close.', 'We knew the virus was bad, and we knew it was spreading, but none of us knew just serious it would get.', 'I took the train for the last time that afternoon in March.', 'I was in one of the middle four cars, those open at the stop where I get off.', 'I remember being so relieved that I found a seat.', "It was only a few minutes after noon but the world stopped turning at 11:30 that morning and I wasn't sure how that would impact train passenger volume, so finding a seat was especially nice", 'I tried not to focus on the fact that this was a train from NYC, the closest spot where COVID was confirmed and there I was, touching the seat and hanging onto the pole. ', 'No gloves, no mask, not even hand sanitizer.', "We hadn't been told to social distance yet but that comes naturally in an almost empty train car.", 'The nearest person was in the line of seats across from me, closest to the door', 'His body faced mine as we sat and we exchanged a friendly smile.', "He couldn't have been older than 23 and I didn't even know if he was gay,", "But he was very attractive and I sure was upset that I didn't have my earrings in.", 'There was silence on the train,', 'I could still hear the train moving on the tracks and every few minutes I would hear my phone buzz with a COVID update, and I remember music playing through one earbud but it still felt silent.', 'There was no real news,', 'No numbers,', 'No projected outcomes,', 'Just silence and fear and disbelief.', 'The world had stopped that morning but the train was still moving and so were my thoughts,', "But I couldn't tell you exactly what was going on.", 'The words "pandemic" and "coronavirus" didn\'t live on my tongue yet and I am sure they didn\'t occupy the mouth of the hot guy in my train car but in the loud silence we were thinking the same things.', 'What is going to happen?', 'What will change?', 'Am I safe?', "And somehow being unsure was comforting because at least it wasn't that bad yet", 'The conductor opened the door and moved towards the front of our train through our car.', 'He coughed and I instinctively held my breath.', "We weren't sure how it spreads and we didn't know how far it had traveled, there was no real way to know if I was in danger", 'So my brain made the subconscious decision to protect my "high risk" body from the germs that were potentially on the train.', 'My commute home was only about 45 minutes,', 'I took the express.', 'And although the stuffy air felt like gelatin and smelled like old urine, it was familiar and grounding when nothing else was.', "I didn't know that it would be my last time on a train before entering a new life where we stay home to stay safe,", "But walking on that train platform and down the stairs to go home, I did know that things had shifted drastically in a way I didn't yet understand.", 'It has been almost a year since I took that train and sometimes I still think about how surreal that day felt.', 'I yearn for friendly smiles passed between passengers without cloth layers in-between,', 'And I wish I had told that man and the conductor and everyone I left behind at school to "have a good day" and to "stay safe"', 'Because who knows- ', 'Maybe they are among the millions dead and gone,', 'Only remembered as a tragic statistic.', 'Maybe one day I can take the train again and not be afraid that it will collapse my lungs and stop my heart,', 'Maybe one day I can get groceries at the store and go to school in person,', 'But for now, I wait. Anxiously.', 'Remembering that last train ride on the day the world stopped working.', '', 'Pandemic Poetry: number unknown by Emmett']

Author: thatonebicon
Paragraphs: ["My best friend (the one who makes gay jokes and won't go to chik fil a, an all around phenomenal human) texted me to tell me he may have been exposed to the virus. And let me tell you it hit me like a damn brick. He's young and healthy, even if he has covid he'll probably be fine. But what if he isn't? My stomach hurts just thinking about the idea of losing him. Or losing him to the pain of the grief that would accompany him losing a family member. ", 'He has done everything right. He has worn a mask and social distanced and stayed home as much as possible. But he had no control over all the people who decided not to keep him safe. ', "If you're not doing everything right, if you're not wearing a mask or going to parties: FUCK YOU. You are causing so much pain, and you're feeling none because everyone else is keeping you safe. ", "I'm in pain from the mere thought of losing my favorite person. I cannot imagine actually experiencing that loss. I cannot imagine not taking every step I can to prevent that loss. Not just for myself but for everyone around me. ", 'Step it the fuck up and care about another human being for once. ']

Author: your-isolation-buddy
Paragraphs: ['It‚Äôs more than understandable if you‚Äôre hitting a bump right now, this has been going on a while but it‚Äôs not getting any easier. In fact it might feel like it‚Äôs getting harder. I get it. Even without all the anxiety surrounding covid, just having your life change so much can be overwhelming even as time continues to pass- it certainly was for me when I first got sick and I still have days when it all feels to much. But you‚Äôre going to be ok.\xa0', 'Take a deep breath, drink some water, know you‚Äôre not alone, and keep taking care of yourself. You‚Äôve got this!\xa0', 'Here are some resources to help you:', 'Tenpercent coronavirus sanity guide', 'Calm together isolation resources\xa0', 'UCLA mindfulness app', 'UCLA and Headspace mindful meditations']

Author: y0ur-maj3sty
Paragraphs: ['This #virus is never gonna go away. Get that into your heads. It\'s not going away. This doesn\'t mean that it\'s always gonna be this virulent or catastrophic. It\'s being used to control the population. The question is, \'how are we going to deal with it?\'. Whether it\'s a vaccine, herd immunity, or just learning to live with it. Having a vaccine for something that\'s mostly likely been used as a bio-weapon, is NOT a safe thing. Supplementation, and boosting up your immune system is the right way to go.. and, getting these pharmaceutical companies to get these therapeutics like Remdesivir, Hydroxychloroquine, Convalescent Plasma, that are protease inhibitors and replicase inhibitors, to slow down the viral load in the population, thus slowly move into herd immunity. And not force a #vaccine program. What\'s also important is vitamin c, vitamin d, zinc, and even colloidal silver. It\'s also important to remember that the #CoronaVirus tests cannot be trusted. They often give false positives. Earlier this year, when the CDC sent out millions of Covid tests, they admitted that their labs were contaminated with Corona, and they sent out contaminated tests. This is why we had so many cases so fast. The new "Covid19 Tests" that have been sent out over the past 2 months by the CDC, to hospitals, drive up testing centers, and local clinics, have been AMPLIFIED with the parameters of infection being much much lower! Meaning they can test for the very smallest microbe of what they can ASSUME to be "Covid", and the test can come back "positive".. needing very very little to get positive results. On the CDC\'s website, they admit that they hold back IMPORTANT TESTING MATERIALS that are in short supply. THE MORE THAT PEOPLE GET TESTED, THE MORE CASES WE WILL HAVE.', 'Stop listening to people like Dr Fauci who tells people to stay home, don\'t get sick, and eventually get the vaccine. Start living your life and stop living in Fear. We\'ve tried the method of "shelter in place" for way too long. IT DOESN\'T WORK. I\'ve been saying this for 7 months. In New York we\'ve had the most draconian measures, and OBEDIENCE TO THOSE MEASURES, than anywhere else in the United States. People have been staying home for many months, their bodies haven\'t been getting exposed to the normal things that they\'ve always been getting exposed to when outside(certain pathogens, bacterias, etc.). So when everyone was staying home brainwashed and scared, their immune systems have been heavily declining. So when they do eventually go outside, their immune systems start going into overdrive, and this is when people get sick. Because these mainstream doctors anda hospitals aren\'t telling people to take D3 or vitamin c. Even with the mask(that does nothing), people are still getting sick. If your immune system is down and you get exposed to something that\'s essentially benign, your gonna start secreting mucus, and histamines, and all this other stuff that will create an environment that will be conducive for those pathogen to take hold. With a strong immune system, it won\'t take hold. This is also why it\'s a good idea to consume local/raw organic honey. Because it is contains many antigens to keep the immune system strong.', 'People need to be outside in the environment. Kids need to be out playing in the dirt and sand.. so they DON\'T get sick. A lot of these parents stop their kids from going outside and playing, then they start to developing asthma, and allergies, an other things like that. We aren\'t creating a world around us, that we\'re not trusting out neighbors, we\'re being brainwashed to think that everyone is sick. And no one is thinking about the detriment to the kids. You think it\'s a healthy to have a mask on when they\'re in school all day? Just from a breathing perspective. It can also effect their brain\'s oxygen flow. This is child abuse. And what about the psychological effects on the kids, that this PLANdemic(pandemic) is having? Is no one thinking about this? There\'s no way it\'s right or moral to send kids back to school, having to wear a mask all day, not being able to socialize and play with their friends. Most kids already don\'t like going to school, so having to go there with all these restrictions is NOT going to end well. Children, let alone people, are very social beings. They cannot be isolated. They need love, physical touch, and interaction. I\'ve always been a big proponent of home schooling, so money that is allocated to teachers unions should be available for parents to do home schooling or to find alternative private teaching sessions. No one should accept this "New Normal" way of life. This is not appropriate. Do not send any kids back to school, until things are how they were before this #PLANdemic.', 'Fauci and the establishment want you to stay home, hunker down, and keep using all this technology that emits tons of radiation, social distance, and wear masks all day every day, so you get sicker, so you can take the vaccine. Period. Live your life in Fear, or take back your Life.']

Author: gemsofgreece
Paragraphs: ['Anon said: I love your blog but I will unfollow you as requested\xa0 because I am one of those people you mentioned, my grandfather was killed by the protocol used to cure the coronavirus he didn‚Äôt have, the doctors knew and told us he didn‚Äôt have it but they had to cure him for it anyway because of government rules', 'First of all, my condolences for your loss. I am so sorry. My thoughts are with you and your family.\xa0', 'I originally answered to you after having misread - and I thought you said the doctors told you he did have it although he didn‚Äôt. So I answered thinking he was misdiagnosed and then I deleted my answer which is why I reply like this now.\xa0', 'Nevertheless, the points I made there weren‚Äôt very different. I thought it was a case of doctor incompetence / test unreliability but it turns out it was to a criminal level. I think your family could press charges against that hospital / doctors? Also, I am curious where you‚Äôre from. Different countries might follow different protocols according to how much coronavirus has affected each of them.\xa0', 'I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre from Greece, right? The biggest scandal in Greece associated with the virus was the death of an otherwise healthy 37 year old when he got infected because the protocol states that patients should be admitted to hospitals only if they have very serious symptoms. So nobody took him seriously fast enough because he was young and healthy and what could possibly happen to him but coronavirus killed the man all the same. So, as you see, it is the opposite experience to the one your family had. And both resulted in death. Both patients were victims of the coronavirus. The young man was an immediate victim as well as a victim of doctors not knowing how to deal with the situation and your grandfather was a victim of the chaos of confusion the virus has created in the medical community. I do not condemn the confusion itself as it is expected in this novel situation but I do condemn the circumstances at which the doctors you had chose to follow the protocol.\xa0', 'Now, I will try to reason a little as to why that protocol is the way it is. First of all, I make the assumption that you live in a country with many cases or many casualties. Was your grandfather admitted to the hospital to have some surgical procedure? This could only remotely make sense if the hospital had so many COVID-19 cases that the statistics were for your grandpa to get infected in there rather than not. We have to stress that what they gave your grandpa was not the\xa0‚Äúcure‚Äù. There is not such a thing as a COVID-19 cure, otherwise everything would be okay. What they gave him is an experimental blend of drugs that might or might not have some positive effects on people infected by coronavirus. This experimental blend can also slightly vary from country to country or hospital to hospital. These drugs are not designed for coronavirus and if they help at all, it‚Äôs because of a similar structure of the virus with what they are actually fighting and blah blah blah. What I mean is that they help somewhat and incidentally. They sort of prevent the virus to multiply or spread in multiple systems inside the body but they do not destroy it. If your grandfather had to have a surgery or stay for a prolonged time in the hospital, they probably calculated that it was statistically extremely likely that he would get the virus as well, and then because of his age and (IDK) probably already fragile health (?) he would most definitely die, so they chose to give him the\xa0‚Äútreatment‚Äù as a preventive measure against contracting the virus. Now, the drugs used in this treatment are no laughing matter / some of them are heavy, they come with a lot of side effects and they need medical attention near you when you take them. If your grandpa was already in bad health it was very possible that those drugs would do more bad than good and it was a grave, criminal miscalculation from the doctors‚Äô part.\xa0', 'On the other hand, if you are from Greece or a country with few recorded cases / casualties and your grandpa was otherwise very healthy and robust or seriously ill but without covid cases around him and they still did that, I do not know what to say because there is simply no reasoning to make. Perhaps there are legal procedures you should follow against that hospital.\xa0', 'These drugs have helped many patients with medium or severe symptoms to get through it. These drugs had no effect whatsoever on other patients, who either survived or died from the virus regardless. And these drugs also caused severe side effects to a few and your grandfather must have been sadly one of these. Unless of course there are more miscalculations on the doctors‚Äô part that they are not fully revealing to you, things that could also be irrelevant to the COVID treatment. And all those different outcomes are explained simply by the fact that coronavirus is not what these drugs were originally designed to fight.\xa0', 'However, even in this case, the ultimate culprit was the virus. The virus is the immediate cause of many deaths but also the cause of this chaos and confusion in the medical community that does not know how to react. The government protocol exists because there is evidence it has helped some infected people compared to the absolute nothingness of no treatment at all. It‚Äôs a choice of despair. It is bad but it is not a plan to purge the population. There was no ill intention against your grandfather but a bunch of bad or simply confused or desperate doctors following a generalized protocol that didn‚Äôt take into account the parameters of your grandfather‚Äôs case. Needless to say, I downright object to the application of a generalized protocol that doesn‚Äôt examine needs unique to each patient but I think this responsibility falls on the doctor‚Äôs judgement mostly and I am sure it is not a mass murder / control attempt by whichever government.\xa0 I‚Äôm so very sorry, I understand that right now little does it matter to you what the intent was as long as the mistake was heartwrenching and irreversible.', 'But please understand that the point I am trying to make comes from a place of worry and need for this nightmare to end for all of us. In my opinion, this can happen only if we all take seriously what is going on or at least respect the boundaries of those who do. I am not talking about consuming heavy drugs without reason / evidence of course. If we did that, we might as well just follow Trump‚Äôs advices, drink bleach and just die all together. No no no. Besides, I said in a previous reply\xa0‚Äúdo not rely on the medical community for the time being‚Äù. The only thing we need to rely on\xa0 for now is our ability to protect ourselves and our loved ones and this can only happen when you remove yourself a little from unnecessary social interactions or protecting your face in necessary ones. Does anyone think I am having a good time when I do that? Of course not. Who would. But we should understand that only like this we will eventually find our way out of this dystopia, at least until a medicine or a vaccine is designed. It is not the time for Orwell fantasies.\xa0', 'Again, my sincere condolences. What happened to your grandpa was terrible and should probably be further investigated. I can only bearly imagine your pain and frustration. Feel free to unfollow or not. Do what makes you feel best.\xa0']

Author: prettylittleghostboy
Paragraphs: ["Ah COVID, it's the gift that keeps on giving... giving bad gifts.", "Besides the typical stuff, I broke out so badly all over, well, my breasts, of all areas. I broke out in a rash that was prickly with heat and rough to touch. I have tiny fluid filled blisters on the side of my fingers, perhaps dyshidrosis. Lost my taste and smell, classic. Had burning in my nose and eyes for about a week. Vision is all fucked up, more than usual. My ankle and feet were in so much pain it was hard to walk. I was hallucinating, I would see little creatures and things staring at me and I would hear noises that weren't there. All of those are not in order. ", '-10/10 would recommend']

Author: jinuley
Paragraphs: ['I‚Äôm with the dissenters. However, I do not try to antagonize. The covid19 pandemic is real. It can kill, and it can be scary. People should do their best to keep their germs to themselves. DO NOT cough or sneeze into your hands (use your elbow people!) and stay home if you‚Äôre sick. The surface cleaning is important too, and honestly, we should try to stick with that practice. Especially in schools.', 'Masks... I‚Äôm tired of it. Sometimes I wear one, mostly I don‚Äôt. I prefer to breathe air that‚Äôs not stale. I‚Äôd rather not have my face oils constantly being rubbed back in. If you are immunocompromised or have some health issue that makes you vulnerable, you probably should wear a mask if you will be close to people for longer than a few minutes. It‚Äôs your body, therefore YOUR responsibility. I will do my part, you do what you need to, and ask your closest friends and loved ones to work with you and respect that you have a health issue that makes you vulnerable.', 'I am healthy and low risk. My immune system can fight it and make antibodies, and if I get sick (again), I will stay home/clean my area/etc. to prevent myself from spreading it. I had it in November 2020, and it was literally like another cold with a very mild fever for 1 day. The loss of smell only lasted as long as my congestion did, which was as long as a regular cold.', 'Getting to my point about the vaccine...', 'BY ALL MEANS, I don‚Äôt think vaccines are evil or anything, and there are people who should probably have it. But please don‚Äôt ask me to get it. Please don‚Äôt FORCE me to get it. It is my body, my choice.', 'This pandemic has become soooooo politicized and it frustrates me to no end. Yes, I am conservative, but I have liberal views too, and I‚Äôm not evil for choosing not to get vaccinated or not wearing a mask. I‚Äôm tired of hearing about dissenters like me, particularly the reasonable ones, being demonized because they are actually thinking for themselves and trying to make choices that keep our American values alive. The media is biased, and our government‚Äôs a hot mess.\xa0', 'Read on about how the hospitals are handling the pandemic when for most people, all they need is rest and an immune system boost - not a vaccine or a ventilator.', 'https://www.christianitydaily.com/articles/13088/20210830/radio-host-shares-husbands-harrowing-icu-experience-revealing-doctors-covid-protocols-are-killing-people.htm', 'Dalley came to the following conclusions as a result of the experience:']

Author: travelasiamitchblatt
Paragraphs: ['The real problem was trying to stop coronavirus, the City Journal argues.\xa0‚ÄúFearmongering from journalists, scientists, and politicians did more harm than the virus.‚Äù', 'Those 600,000 dead Americans? It was nothing.', 'The harm to the economy?\xa0John Tierney bizarrely cites economic harm as an argument against slowing the spread of coronavirus when the pandemic itself caused consumers to avoid crowds, caused factories to cease production, supply chains to get messed up, caused the economy to crash.', 'Countries like Korea, China, Taiwan, and New Zealand, which did much better jobs controlling coronavirus, had their economies perform better in 2020, and even restaurants were open and doing better for most of 2020 and 2021.', 'Oh, and masks and other measures lumped together as\xa0‚Äúlockdown‚Äù (the U.S. never really had much in the way of actual lockdowns like some other countries did) didn‚Äôt do anything to help, the author writes, citing no evidence.', 'Nevermind that the U.S., which had very lax measures, had one of the highest death tolls per capita. The author ignores that if you plot mask wearing in a country with deaths per capita a clear correlation shows masks prevent coronavirus spread and keep businesses open.']

Author: somethingusefulfromflorida
Paragraphs: ['Korean War: 37,000', 'Vietnam War: 58,000', 'World War I: 117,000', 'Confederate Dead: 290,000', 'Union Dead: 365,000', 'World War II: 405,000', 'Total Civil War Dead: 655,000', 'All deaths in all wars combined: 1,4000,000', 'COVID-19 in the United States surpassed Korea in mid-April 2020, Vietnam in early May, and World War I in late June.', 'On July 1, 2020, I predicted that we‚Äôd pass 290k in December, 365k in spring 2021, 405k in mid-2021, and 655k sometime in 2022.', 'On October 22, I updated my prediction, with 290k in mid-January 2021, 365 by late April, and 405k by mid-June.\xa0 I assumed that we‚Äôd hit a peak back then; we were recording 700 to 800 deaths per day, and my predictions assumed the worst case scenario that it would stay steady at this unthinkable level', 'We passed 290k deaths in early December.', 'We passed 365k deaths in early January', 'We passed 405k deaths a week later in mid-January', 'We will almost certainly pass 655k deaths by May, and that‚Äôs under the best case scenario that the number of deaths per day stays exactly where it is.\xa0 At this rate, we‚Äôll see more American dead from the virus than from all wars since 1776 by the end of the year.\xa0 If the number of deaths per day goes up, we‚Äôll pass these bloody milestones even sooner.', 'Surely the worst is behind us.\xa0 With the vaccine on its way and the bare minimum of competency from our leaders, surely things couldn‚Äôt get worse, right?']

Author: brokensadboy

I just spoke to my sister who recently come from the hospital she has been sick for the last few days with a bad sore throat and some fever she thought it was streptococcus / strep throat, however, with an Lab confirmed test Ôøºit‚Äôs negative strep. So the doctor is thinking it might be the first signs of COVID-19 viral infection. I have recently been around my sister as well so I‚Äôm not only worried for her but now myself and the others she has been around. The hospital has preformed a COVID-19 test and will contact her back within 48 hours to go over the results of the test. I‚Äôm really hoping she is negative for Covid as well and doesn‚Äôt have it.  COVID-19 is an awful virus that has swept across the world so vciously causing chaos and deathÔøº in its path. This is a pandemic that‚Äôs never been seen like before. I don‚Äôt know if my sister would be strong enough to fight the virus or even myself for that matter however, my sister has Lung and heart issues.  Please send good spirits and vibes for her and hope that she has not been infected with the awful virus. Thank you. ', 'COVID-19 test results pending .... update will be posted once results has been given. ']

Author: avaduta
Paragraphs: ['With over twenty-three and a half million people infected globally, nations are still struggling to control the spread of Coronavirus. Also, in treating those diagnosed positive for the virus.', 'In the past several months, worldwide, Governments are dedicating all necessary resources to handle this massive healthcare disaster of modern times. Notably today, we are also on the verge of producing Covid-19 vaccines that may bring a logical end to this pandemic.', 'Nevertheless, these efforts would mean nothing to those who died of Coronavirus (814,072 people as of today), and they are not going to offer any solace to their families and friends. Indeed it is regrettable that despite our scientific and technological advancement in medicine, we could do nothing to prevent these deaths.', 'It has been months since the outbreak of the virus. People are losing their loved ones and breadwinners in their families; many more are losing their livelihood. Though lockdowns and curbs are still necessary, not every household will be able to afford to stay indoors for a long time.', 'For people with surplus wealth, their survival is not going to be at stake even if their economic activity comes to a halt for months in a row. But what about those who have little or no savings and have nothing left to pledge for a loan or no means to repay?', 'The struggles of people in the medium to low-income groups have become more apparent with the pandemic. Layoffs, loss of jobs, and no business for months are hurting many. In times like this, what should those sitting on their riches do? Should they not find ways to reach out to those in need?', 'The pandemic is also taking a heavy toll on healthcare. In many cities, there is a shortage of beds. There are cases where patients are stranded at hospitals without critical care. In some places, hospitals are fleecing patients.', 'It is deplorable. People are going to hospitals to save their lives. What if some of them behave like parasites, strip patients of whatever money left with them, and leave them to die? Are they not criminals punishable under severest of laws?', 'Now, the responsibility of controlling the virus from spreading is also on us, the public. Governments around the world are advising people to wear masks, maintain social distancing, and follow certain restrictions, to protect themselves and others from getting infected by the Coronavirus.', "However, there are some among us who would not follow them because we are either ignorant or indifferent. We consider our personal choice more valuable than the life of our fellow humans. The point is, even if we are not convinced about these measures, why should we behave blatantly selfish and put other's lives at risk? \xa0", 'Sadly, the pandemic has done its damage, and it is not over yet. As we stand with our vulnerabilities exposed, the message is clear‚Äîwe are ill-prepared to face a pandemic like Coronavirus.', 'Now, what if tomorrow another pandemic strikes, what are we going to do? Are we going to respond the same way‚Äîfind a vaccine after losing hundreds of thousands of people, and livelihood of millions more in every country?', 'We have seen how in a well-connected, globalized world, a pandemic can spread like wildfire. So, today if we fail to investigate its origin, in the future, another virus deadlier than Covid-19 could devastate our entire human race or leave us in dire straits. \xa0', 'By now, everyone knows the sequence of events that probably lead to the pandemic. The popular understanding is, Covid-19 started from a wet market in Wuhan, China. However, as people were still traveling, those infected by the Coronavirus carried it to various parts of the world. Then it began spreading rapidly before lockdown measures were in place. Some still speculate that the Coronavirus was leaked accidentally from a lab in Wuhan.', 'Incidentally, China, which is also the most populous country in the world, and the country where the pandemic began has reported only 84,981 cases and 4,634 deaths to date. Whereas, neighboring India has over 3 million cases, with 58,390 deaths, and the figures across the rest of the world are even more startling. \xa0', 'Now, what is the real reason behind the virus outbreak? How did it start? Is it the way the wet markets function, or consumption of wildlife that should have been banned permanently and much earlier? Is it the destruction of ecosystems that made us susceptible?', 'Can the World Health Organization (WHO), or any other international body investigate the cause, and tell us what went wrong‚Äîprecisely? Several months have passed since the pandemic began, yet we do not have a definite answer for this.', 'The Chinese government should not see an investigation into the origin of Covid-19 as an effort to pin the blame on them. Instead, they should take the first step of bringing nations together for a transparent investigation. They should shoulder that responsibility, as the virus outbreak began from their country.', "Moreover, we deserve to know how it happened? Haven't we all lifted the burden of the pandemic, some way or the other? Also, let us not forget that living elsewhere on the planet, we are suffering because of the error of some unknown person, persons or thing. \xa0", "The loss to humanity is immense. So there ought to be a frank debate on how the Coronavirus pandemic started and corrective measures to prevent another one. If SARS was a warning that we got before Coronavirus, isn't Coronavirus a sign before something more lethal and catastrophic? We must think. Certainly, it isn't wise to neglect human errors behind the Covid-19 outbreak and allow another cycle of suffering on humanity.", 'Photo by Anna Shvets from Pexels ']

Author: the-tiny-bean-sprout
Paragraphs: ["I work in a popular seasonal amusement park that's aiming to open this fall. We've had as many as +600,000 people walk though our gates a year or so back. The park is going to do temp checks and require masks before entering the gates for both park attendees and staff, along with only doing ticket sales for certain dates as to not overpopulate the park. But even with all of these precautions I'm terrified. ", "In a typical year, I'm yelled at by guests at least once. Not that I'm doing anything wrong, I'm just doing my job. They get in my face, sometimes threatening me for just looking at them wrong. If I find a guest wearing their mask improperly and I have to correct them, I know they're going to react with hostility. I'm scared they'll try to remove my mask or they'll spit on me. Even if they don't react this way, one handshake, hug, or even just getting too close could infect me if they're asymptomatic.", "So I'm having to come to terms with the fact that I'm going to get COVID-19. Not probably, it's going to happen. To make matters worse, I don't have insurance and my state has some of the highest cases atm. All because the owner is a greedy, selfish old man has no regard for the wellbeing others. "]

Author: somethingusefulfromflorida
Paragraphs: ['It has gotten demonstrably worse; this is the fourth day in a row that we‚Äôve gained 50k cases nationally.\xa0 Florida has broken its cases-per-day record 13 times in the last month, rising from 1419 on June 4 to 11445 on July 4.\xa0 Deaths are lagging behind, but give it a week or two and they‚Äôll start surging as well.\xa0 The case fatality rate is around 5% worldwide.', 'I think the government is purposefully stalling; they‚Äôre hoping that things get REALLY BAD really soon, so that they can say ‚Äúlook, we‚Äôre over the hump, the worst is behind us, it‚Äôs all downhill from here!‚Äù\xa0 It‚Äôs nowhere near over, but they keep acting like it is.\xa0 It‚Äôs not just gonna go away by itself, and once it DOES start to go away, there will be multiple surges as people start relaxing their safety measures because they think it‚Äôs finally getting better.\xa0 How many peaks and troughs will it take?\xa0 How many months?\xa0 Years?', 'It can‚Äôt last forever, eventually the number of cases-per-day will drop to zero, but I don‚Äôt see that happening in the United States any time soon.']

Author: disabilityaware
Paragraphs: ['‚ÄúIf this is the end...we are 10% closer.‚Äù', 'Conversations around death and disability are normal in my household. The above was said by my mother and for some reason, this time, it shook me up. I guess we were so determined to survive this pandemic that I did not foresee other factors (health complications, emergency surgery) contributing towards eventual or immediate death.', 'We measure life expectancy of children with disabilities who grew into adults with disabilities based on when their peers passed away. This has always been the case for us and continues to be. It is a fact of life and I was immune to it until now. This morning, the reality of what my mother said REALLY set in and I‚Äôm not ready for death to arrive at our doorstep yet. Can we negotiate with the Angel of Death?', 'In solidarity,', '- A']

Author: poemofthepandemic-blog
Paragraphs: ['When an unknown disaster loomed, you hid it from my neighbors.', 'You sold your stocks and held your tongue,', 'And you killed them.', 'When you howled for the economy, you asked for my grandfather‚Äôs life.\xa0', 'You sacrificed the elderly for your donors,', 'And you killed him.', 'When you left the states to fend for themselves, equipment was in shortage,', 'My sister could not be given a ventilator,', 'And you killed her.', 'When you uploaded your conspiracy videos, you misinformed my uncle.', 'Your comments rose; your links spread,\xa0', 'And you killed him.\xa0', 'When you laughed at those in masks, my aunt blushed in embarrassment.', 'She took hers off to please your politics,', 'And you killed her.\xa0', 'When you demanded your right to haircuts, my cousin packed your groceries.', 'You whined ‚Äúfreedom,‚Äù but stole his future.', 'You killed him.\xa0', 'When you hocked your snake oil religiously, your followers were watching.', 'You asked what they had to lose,', 'And you killed them.', 'When you rejected the words of scientists, you overwhelmed the hospitals.', 'My father pulled overtime with poor equipment,', 'And you killed him.', 'When you opened the bars and beaches, the workers were at your mercy.', 'They crossed their fingers and wore their masks,', 'But you killed them.', 'When you waxed poetic on your ‚Äúvictory,‚Äù my grandmother took you at your word,', 'When you lied it would ‚Äúdisappear,‚Äù', 'You killed her.', 'When you waved your fake graphs, and denounced your advisors,\xa0', 'My mother relaxed in her newfound relief,', 'Until you killed her.', 'Now you threaten lack of funding with a wicked ultimatum.\xa0', 'Your children will be ‚Äúdistance learning,‚Äù but ours must go to school.\xa0', 'You want ignorance and loyalty to let you kill them.\xa0', 'Now you demand we leave our safety to participate in democracy.', 'Now you remodel our constitutional rights for your pleasure.', 'Your enablers will probably let you kill us.', 'Murderers! You murderers!', 'Murderers! You murderers!', 'I must say this now,\xa0', 'Before you kill me.']

Author: pls-just-be-a-decent-human
Paragraphs: ['they don‚Äôt care about us.', 'we say we don‚Äôt want to go to school because we‚Äôre afraid for our safety. but that‚Äôs not new. school shooters? we said the same thing. we are still afraid to go to school. school should not be a place where kids might die. it shouldn‚Äôt be a place where kids are afraid.', 'i remember the day they announced we would be going home from school. that morning i had had a conversation about school shootings with my mom & sister. walking out the door, i thought ‚Äúwhat if it happened today? what if i died today?‚Äù', 'then later that morning in pe, the fire alarms went off. at the same time, kids started banging on the locker room doors. i was nearly crying. i thought i was going to die. i thought they had guns, i thought those were my last moments. turns out, chemistry kids had set the alarm off with an experiment. the banging was just other pe kids trying to get in to change.', 'period 2 is when we found out about school closing. the girls at my table said it was scary. they said all of a sudden it was too real, & they were worried about dying.', 'at break, i had forgotten to print out some forms for my course requests. i was rushing in the library - there were tons of students there. there wasn‚Äôt enough time. i broke down crying as soon as i saw my sister. she tried to calm me down. i tried to explain through shaky stuttering words that this morning i thought i would die. i will never forget that she responded, ‚Äúwell, you don‚Äôt have to come back here for a long time.‚Äù', 'the break from school was nice. it allowed me to feel a little bit safe. but now, cases have shot up again, & they‚Äôre telling us to go back. i‚Äôm afraid of going back. because covid-19 is too big of a risk. & i‚Äôm still afraid of being shot.', 'they don‚Äôt care about us.']

Author: blackwoolncrown
Paragraphs: ['Okay here it is. Disclaimer: !!!I am not a medical professional in any way, shape or form. None of this information is meant as a cure nor diagnosis or treatment of any disease and is simply being compiled and presented for the sake of amateur research.!!!', 'Again: I am not a medical professional.\xa0', 'Initial article that spurred the search:', 'https://theconversation.com/the-right-way-to-breathe-during-the-coronavirus-pandemic-140695', 'Highlights:\xa0‚ÄúThe reason is that your nasal cavities produce the molecule nitric oxide, which chemists abbreviate NO, that increases blood flow through the lungs and boosts oxygen levels in the blood. Breathing in through the nose delivers NO directly into the lungs, where it helps fight coronavirus infection by blocking the replication of the coronavirus in the lungs. But many people who exercise or engage in yoga also receive the benefits of inhaling through the nose instead of the mouth. The higher oxygen saturation of the blood can make one feel more refreshed and provides greater endurance.I am one of three pharmacologists who won the Nobel Prize in 1998 for discovering how nitric oxide is produced in the body and how it works.‚Äù', 'Question: how effective is NO against Covid19?\xa0', 'A: Nitric Oxide inhibits SARS-CoV-2‚Ä≤s replication cycle ON CONTACT.\xa0https://jvi.asm.org/content/79/3/1966', 'A: Inhaled Nitric Oxide is being tested as a treatment for Covid19 patients and shortens the intensity and duration of illness:\xa0https://www.healio.com/news/primary-care/20200520/evidence-mounts-supporting-inhaled-nitric-oxide-as-covid19-treatment', 'A: Similar treatments have been used aganst SARS in hospitals.\xa0https://academic.oup.com/cid/article/39/10/1531/460542', 'Question: How can one increase NO levels on their own in the absence of access to inhaled NO?', 'A: Nitric Oxide is increased 15x by humming.\xa0https://www.atsjournals.org/doi/full/10.1164/rccm.200202-138BC', 'Question: Humming increases Nitric Oxide in the airways up to ~500/800ppb. What is the dose of INO \xa0used as a useful Covid treatment in hospitals?', 'A: It varies depending on trx', 'https://www.webmd.com/lung/news/20200513/inhaled-nitric-oxide-explored-for-covid-19-oxygenation#2', "‚ÄúThe patient's therapy consisted of nitric oxide at a dose of 20 ppm plus supplemental oxygen delivered by nasal cannula at a dose of 2 L/min for 12 to 14 hours a day. After symptomatic improvement, a stepwise reduction in nitric oxide was implemented from day 13 to 17, with the dose dropping to 10 ppm, 5 ppm, and then 0 ppm.‚Äù", 'Summary/Takeaway: Increasing NO levels could possibly be beneficial as a preventative against Covid-19 and it wouldn‚Äôt hurt\xa0to do so. NO is produced all over the body and can be increased intracellularly through eating leafy greens, celery and especially beets. However direct application of NO on possibly contaminated respiratory tissues can be achieved through nasal inhalation, and the amount of NO inhaled can be increased by humming the previous exhale, and by breathing in slowly which increases the length of time of NO release. Used in conjunction with mask wearing, social distancing and hand washing, humming and inhaling NO may be a useful immune boosting practice to limit the ability for any stray viral particles to replicate in one‚Äôs respiratory tract.', 'Furthermore (AND REMEMBER I AM NOT A MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL OF ANY SORT AND YOU MIGHT BE WISE TO DISREGARD WHAT I SAY) Covid19 seems to decrease NO in the body by damaging respiratory tissue, simultaneously causing lowered oxygenation and reducing the body‚Äôs ability to fight viral infection as well as causing constriction and damage to blood vessels (remember that nitric oxide relaxes tissues and keeps them supple) which may also account for the kinds of blood vessel damage seen in advanced cases. Given this, it seems absolutely vital that all individuals maximize their NO and oxygenation through breathing exercises before and in the case of contracting Covid, as doing so provides antiviral benefit and counteracts the blood vessel damage this disease is capable of.', 'Other interesting factors/readings: (these are more complicateed and go beyond the scope of my suggestions)', 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1089860320301610', '---', '‚ÄúAbstractThe nasal cavity and turbinates play important physiological functions by filtering, warming and humidifying inhaled air. Paranasal sinuses continually produce nitric oxide (NO), a reactive oxygen species that diffuses to the bronchi and lungs to produce bronchodilatory and vasodilatory effects. Studies indicate that NO may also help to reduce respiratory tract infection by inactivating viruses and inhibiting their replication in epithelial cells. In view of the pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), clinical trials have been designed to examine the effects of inhaled nitric oxide in COVID-19 subjects. We discuss here additional lifestyle factors such as mouth breathing which may affect the antiviral response against SARS-CoV-2 by bypassing the filtering effect of the nose and by decreasing NO levels in the airways. Simple devices that promote nasal breathing during sleep may help prevent the common cold, suggesting potential benefits against coronavirus infection. In the absence of effective treatments against COVID-19, the alternative strategies proposed here should be considered and studied in more detail.Keywords: Innate immunity, Coronavirus, COVID-19, Nitric oxide, Breathing‚Äù', 'https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7200356/']
