Author: luisa-writes
Paragraphs:
['Abstract', 'The People Power Revolution sparked change all over the Philippines and liberated the vast majority of Filipinos from oppression and issues of similar nature. Consequently, Filipinos were free from verbal restrainment and have played a huge factor in voicing new ideas, constructive criticism, and analytical thinking in terms of political matters over the decades. Unfortunately, the country still faces corruption and mediocrity from politicians who swore equity and justice. There has seemed to be a conspicuous pattern over the years as to the causes of political corruption and incompetence: political dynasties. The topic of political dynasties has seemed to stir controversy amongst the politically aware, principally because it demotes political competition and historically results in an abuse of powers. In the following pages, the researchers will be tackling comprehensive information about one of the most familiar political dynasties in our generation today, the Cayetano Dynasty. The family‚Äôs background, the beginning of their dynasty, their political history, programs and laws, and issues they are associated with will be introduced and discussed informatively. ', 'Summary', '\xa0The Cayetano dynasty began with Rene Cayetano, a lawyer, journalist, television presenter, and politician who gained recognition for his efforts and sincere devotion to crime prevention and improvement of the criminal justice system. Rene Cayetano was not wealthy during his early political journey as he had been a working student during the time where he was working for a law degree. Despite this, Rene Cayetano was extremely intelligent as he had studied at the University of the Philippines and had even procured a scholarship grant in the United States. Rene Cayetano married Sandra Schramm, and together they had four children. Because of Rene Cayetano‚Äôs popularity and expertise in the field of politics, his children were influenced to undergo the same path he had taken. Rene Cayetano‚Äôs intelligence was naturally passed down to his four children who have graduated from prestigious universities such as the University of the Philippines and Ateneo University. The Cayetanos are presently wealthy, but in contrast to other known politicians, they were not as rich but not entirely poor either. A study had shown that in 2013-2014, Alan Peter Cayetano was one of the poorest members of the Senate with a net worth of 23 million pesos. In 2020, it was shown that Pia Cayetano was listed 10th as one of the richest members of the Senate.', '\xa0Rene Cayetano paved the way for the family‚Äôs political journey to begin when he was the Senator of the Philippines from 1998-2003. Pia Cayetano, his eldest daughter, took office after him in 2004-2016 and 2019-present day. Alan Peter Cayetano, Rene Cayetano‚Äôs eldest son, began his political journey as a member of the Municipality of Taguig from 1992-1995. He, later on, became the Vice Mayor of the Taguig Municipality, a senator from 2007-2017, and is presently a Congressman representing Pateros-Taguig. Ma. Laarni Cayetano, Alan Peter Cayetano‚Äôs wife, also became part of their family‚Äôs dynasty. She became a congresswoman of the Pateros-Taguig in 2007, later became the city‚Äôs mayor in 2010, and finally became a congresswoman in Taguig‚Äôs 2nd district. Rene Cayetano‚Äôs last two sons, Lino Edgardo Cayetano and Renren Cayetano also rose to power just like the other Cayetanos. Lino Edgardo Cayetano became a barangay chairman of Fort Bonifacio in 2010, later became a congressman of the 2nd district, and was elected mayor in 2019. Renren Cayetano was a Muntinlupa councilor in 2001 and ended his career in 2007.', '\xa0The Cayetanos are well-known for their activeness in the field of politics and have even provided significant contributions to the nation. As a senator and former prosecutor, Rene Cayetano was able to legalize a number of republic acts that highlight criminal prevention and improvement. An example is Administrative Order No. 51-96 which designates special criminal courts in cities to hear cases involving heinous crimes and finish the trial within 60 days. Other than this, Rene Cayetano filed Resolution No. 579 to fight for the ban on the collection of parking fees, R.A. 8972 which aims to provide benefits to single Filipino parents, and R.A. 8975 which is an act to ensure implementation and completion of government infrastructure projects by prohibiting lower courts from issuing temporary restraining orders. In addition, Rene Cayetano provided free legal advice to television and radio listeners through a weekly television program entitled ‚ÄúCompanero y Companera.‚Äù ', '\xa0Rene Cayetano‚Äôs eldest daughter, Senator Pia Cayetano, sponsored the ‚ÄúBayanihan to Heal as One Act.‚Äù, alongside several other senators. Pia uploaded promotional videos and statements regarding this as a contribution. The Bayanihan to Heal as One Act is an act that outlines the government‚Äôs response to Covid19 and promoted funding for programs for 18 million poor families. Pia also sponsored the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or ‚ÄúBayanihan 2‚Äù, a measure that involves a Post-Covid recovery plan. Other than this, Senator Pia Cayetano established a program named ‚ÄúPilipinas In Action‚Äù or PIA, which is to provide assistance to the vulnerable sectors in the country during the pandemic. ', '\xa0As chairman of the Committee on Education, Alan Peter Cayetano initiated efforts in educational loans and scholarships more accessible to Filipino students; R.A. 9500 or ‚ÄúUniversity of the Philippines Charter Act of 2008‚Äù. He implemented this because he believed that, in order to fight corruption, Filipinos must be empowered and educated. Secondly, as chairman of the Committee on Public Information and Mass Media, Alan Peter Cayetano campaigned for the ‚ÄúFreedom of Information Act‚Äù to become law in order to increase transparency and accountability. This act provides improved access to information for the Filipinos and became a bill in 2012.', '\xa0Despite the Cayetanos‚Äô above-average intelligence and praiseworthy contributions, some of the members of the family have been repeatedly involved in national controversy and problems. One issue that had occurred years back was when Alan Peter Cayetano defended the controversial war on drugs. In an event with Asia Society, he talked about the Philippine war on drugs with a verbal justification that "The Philippines had no other choice and not acting on it will let drugs take over the Philippines." He had also stated that all the police brutality and killings were not the root effects of the war on drugs, and these issues had existed beyond the time that the war on drugs was declared. Many Filipinos were infuriated by his defense, 'blind' vigilantism, and utter confidence during this speech last 2017. ', '\xa0The second issue that the Cayetanos were associated with was when Alan Peter Cayetano launched a congress bloc entitled "BTS Sa Kongreso". Much like the South Korean septet that it was based on, the bloc comprised of seven members from the Congress. This bloc received backlash from BTS Fans, fellow politicians, and Filipinos. Senior Deputy Speaker Salvador said that the launching of Cayetanos' House bloc was "an obvious publicity stunt and gimmickry." BTS fans even launched the hashtag #CayetanoStopUsingBTS which trended on Twitter, with over 7,000 tweets. Other fans had decided to take a different route and decided to send an email directly to BTS' music label, Big Hit Entertainment regarding "unauthorized use of artist imagery and trademarks in publications" and spread the notice on Twitter.', '\xa0Alan Peter Cayetano held up a sign ‚ÄúTogether with doctors and frontliners, we went to work for you, so please stay home for us.‚Äù Later on, reports said that politicians and their families were receiving special treatment and getting tested for the Coronavirus despite not showing any symptoms. It was stated in one news article that Cayetano and other politicians were getting tested for COVID-19 not just once but twice despite the utter lack of test kits for the frontliners who are continually and more exposed to the virus. Because of this, #ANGKAKAPAL went viral on social media platforms. ', '\xa0On October 2, 2020, Velasco accused Alan Peter Cayetano of blackmailing Duterte into holding the 2021 budget hostage if his term was not extended. Velasco noted that Cayetano did not want to step down yet from the speakership post at the House of Representatives due to a ‚Äúbudget‚Äù. Velasco appealed to Cayetano to resign as House Speaker on October 14. ', 'Conclusion', 'Isabelle
The Cayetano family was able to accomplish great things despite their relatively new presence in the field of politics which contrasts the older and more well-known political dynasties. They have had their fair share of contributions to the nation, but are not entirely along the lines of what is rightfully deemed as "noble politicians". Similar to other political dynasties, the Cayetano family has been involved in issues and controversy which shape them to be disputable politicians (in terms of whenever or not they are corrupt or righteous). \xa0 Personally, I commend the family for being politically active, but my doubts are placed on my own personal dilemma. It is hard to say if the Cayetanos are praiseworthy for their political activeness or their willingness to carry out a political dynasty and its deleterious effects.', "Luisa
The Cayetano family had their fair share of politics. They contributed both good and bad projects to our country. It was evident that they went through a lot to get where they are now, they were able to gain a reputation despite not being that well-known. Although I'm grateful for all their positive contributions to our nation, I am still hesitant to support them wholeheartedly. The negative outcomes of their projects still greatly affect their name.", 'Josef
The entire Cayetano family started off their journey on a clean slate and successfully rose to power. They‚Äôve been through a lot of ups and downs to gain power at a very young age. They implemented many programs for the betterment of the country although it had some flaws. Even though I highly value their services to the country, I get the feeling that I only support them a bit. When problems arise in their projects, it slowly tarnishes their name.', 'Raffy
The Cayetano family has done many things to improve the country, things which can make you say that they are great people and see how much they care for the country. Even after the controversies, you can see that they can still do good things despite their wrongdoings, I have to get credit because they were not a well-known political family but they still made a name in that area despite being new. They did good things for sure, but those good things do not outshine their wrongdoings to our country, therefore I cannot say I fully support them. They could have been a strong family with a lot of supporters, but due to the controversy and horrible outcomes of their projects, their name is already negatively affected to the point where it is hard to support them.', "Steffan
Much like most other things, the Cayetano actually has it's generally good side and it's more questionable bad side. While it's actually had it's contributions, it's also had it's fair share of controversy with the whole BTS thing, the stand on the war on drugs, and others. Their contributions and the work that they've put into the country are definitely admirable and respectable, however, you cannot ignore their more questionable actions. I definitely commend them for their efforts, but that's about it. I do not personally support any individual, and hold a neutral stance towards the individuals themselves, nonetheless, I still support any movements I find reasonable and detest the more questionable decisions and actions.", 'Group Conclusion
In conclusion, we recognize the Cayetano Family‚Äôs contributions and political efforts for the betterment of society and praise them for making a name for themselves despite being younger compared to other political dynasties. On a personal level, however, we can say that we support their reasonable decisions, but we cannot really say that we support their dynasty or political members as a whole because they are not entirely ‚Äúclean‚Äù politicians.']

Author: eurojirorebo
Paragraphs: ['‰∏ñÁïå„ÅÆCOVID19ÊÑüÊüìËÄÖÊï∞„ÅåÔºëÂÑÑ‰∫∫„ÇíË∂Ö„Åà„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ', 'Ôºä', 'The number of confirmed coronavirus cases around the world has passed 100 million since the start of the pandemic, according to an AFP tally.', 'Up to 9:30pm, a total of 100,010,798 infections had been reported, according to figures provided by national health agencies. ', 'Worldwide, at least 2,151,242 people have lost their lives to Covid-19. ', 'The vast majority of people infected with the virus recover, but some patients suffer from symptoms for weeks or even months. ', 'Many countries were late to implement systematic testing, and some continue to test only the most seriously ill. ', 'The poorest nations meanwhile only have the capacity for limited testing. ', 'The United States, which passed 25 million confirmed cases last weekend, remains the country with the largest outbreak. ', 'India is second with 10.7 million cases, and Brazil third with 8.9 million cases. Author: marrionjoseph-blog
Paragraphs: ['Life in a pandemic', 'My life in pandemic is very hard because i feel like iam always bored in house i can not go to my friends and i feel lonely because only my sister and my mother can go ouuside because iam only 14 years old and i need to solve my problems then i try to play some online games then i found my friends in online then iam not super bored because i found my friends only then they helping me always on my problems they make me happy and they always joking then i feel that the ECQ helps me to find another friends in online then i solved my problems in pandemic life but the main problem in the pandemic has triggered a wave of mental health issues. Whether it‚Äôs managing addiction, depression, social isolation or just the general stress that‚Äôs resulted from COVID-19, we‚Äôre all feeling it iam lucky that i saw my friends in online then they help to not be depressed they help me to be strong and not giving up always trust my self and Lord the life in pandemic is very bored but i time to relax while we are in pandemic and practice mindfulness by taking deed breath and always positive thinking then i always focus on eat some healthy foods to avoid covid19 then always trust God that God will help us to this big problem that we facing then i think that we can win this pandemic but we still and always listening to the rules that we proper hand washing (at least 20 seconds) and physical distancing are the best ways to prevent the spread of this novel coronavirus. These practices are crucial since infected individuals can also spread the disease by touching materials and leaving droplets containing the virus behind for others to acquire. A study found that the lifespan of the virus on plastic and stainless steel could be up to 72 hours, cardboard for up to 24 hours, and copper for up to 4 hours.10 Make sure you do not touch the portion of the mask that faces outward as you remove it, and only touch the ear loops or ties.']

Author: globaltrustopedia
Paragraphs: ['Phobia- is one of the most serious mental conditions where a person feels fear in a particular situation or a specific object.', 'According to A Special Health Report from Harvard Medical School, common phobias are related to fear of flying, heights, insects, animals, and injections, or usually the sight of blood. ', 'Corona- has derived from the new pandemic ‚Äòcoronavirus.‚Äô', 'The term coronaphobia emerged in 2020 as the pandemic triggered vastly in the world. During the lockdown phase, there are a lot of things that changed people‚Äôs lives in terms of social life, livelihood, economy, and most importantly, mental health. Apparently, mental health is not always a genetic bourn disorder; it is an outcome of various environmental factors.', 'Coronavirus is a new pandemic to this world that started in December 2019 in Wuhan, China, and due to contagious disease, it has taken over all over the place. Coronavirus has common symptoms like body ache, sore throat, cough, fever, loss of taste, and smell; however, the outcomes of covid 19 are not so common. Covid 19 infection can lead to death, and people with low immunity levels are more prone to detect coronavirus from others. ', 'Besides its outcomes, covid 19 treatment is not completely easy because a person needs to quarantine himself for 14 days minimum as per the guidelines of WHO (2020) as the viruses stay on the surface for a longer period. ', 'Despite that, scientists are still working on coronavirus vaccination; therefore, there are greater chances of fear and complications of covid 19. Besides, the world health organization has introduced a few guidelines to protect from covid 19, for instance, maintaining a 6ft distance, covering mouth and nose, constantly cleaning hands and clothes. For elders, pregnant ladies and children under 6 years old are not allowed to go out amid lockdown as their immunity level is completely lower than others, and fewer changes to cure covid19. ', 'The vaccination of covid 19 is not here yet, but health care providers are constantly working through medicine to suppress the symptoms of covid 19. Therefore, you might get recovered from this disease, but there is also a higher probability of diagnosing covid 19 again. ', 'Covid 19 recent updates:', 'According to the worldometer, there are 69.6M total cases globally, whereas 44.9M are successfully recovered, and 1.58M people are dead due to covid 19. Among other countries, the United States of America is leading on top with 17M cases, and India is the second most vulnerable country with 9M total cases.', 'Socio-cultural factors:', 'Socio-cultural factors are the type of environmental influences that induce and reduce the mental health of a person. According to Leighton and Hughes (1961), family culture and norms are linked with mental health where child-rearing behavior, hygiene, nutrition, perception to adapt medical services, etc., are responsible for how we use to express symptoms of mental disorder or any other undesirable disorder. ', 'On the other side, social factors refer to the interaction of society and community on the basis of gender, social class, race and ethnicity, and household patterns, thus maintaining the quality of education, livelihood, and family income by reducing discrimination, violence, and poverty. However, every society and community norms are different from each other, which affects society‚Äôs development as a whole. ', 'Education factor:', 'Education is the key to impart knowledge, skills towards a better world by treating himself and his family well in terms of providing better healthcare service and detecting the disorder early. According to the study of SAMHSA (2016), education and psychological independence are positively interlinked, where 3.9 million people have anxiety with lower education levels and vice versa. ', 'Therefore, people with less educational qualifications have less awareness to cope with psychological disorders. In order to which coronaphobia emerged at higher rates because people are less aware of dealing with the situation. ', 'Socio-economic factor:', 'The economy is the base of any medical treatment; therefore, a family‚Äôs economy has a positive relationship with mental health treatment. A similar study was introduced by the U.S Department of Health and Human Services (2001), families with low-income status and poor occupation level are more prone to have mental disorders. ', 'A similar study was conducted in 2008, where financial crises were destroying public health sectors and people‚Äôs lives individually. Due to coronavirus, there has been a shift in unemployment status that further leads to indebtedness and insecurity and poor primary care for mental disorder diagnosis. ', 'Hence, mental illness, including anxiety, stress, and depression, is completely high amid lockdown as the increase in 19 million adults have a specific phone, and 15 million adults have social phobia. Besides, in the 2020 era of the pandemic, there are more panic disorder populations (6 million) and general anxiety (6.8 million) among the American population. ', 'Coronavirus becoming Coronaphobia', '.', 'At the beginning of 2020, the novel covid 19 rapidly spread across the globe and infected more than 3 million people in 187 countries, and WHO (2020) report also shows the increase in mortality rate by 13000 in a single month of March. ', 'During the skyrocketing cases of covid 19, there have been high traumatic stress rates at 73.4% with 50% prevalence of depression and 44.7% have generalized anxiety (Lee, 2020). Aside from that, insomnia is one of the major cases increased in lockdown 2020 with 36.1%. It is clear evidence of outbreak impacts on people‚Äôs minds that elevates stress, depression, social phobia, health anxiety, and post-traumatic stress. ', 'In the study of Kwasi Ahorsu et al., (2020), a clear relationship of fear due to covid 19 has been identified by developing FCV-19S (The Fear of Covid-19 Scale). The scale has all the factors affecting mental health, including education, income, age, and gender.', 'It is possible to assess the severity of people‚Äôs perception related to covid19 outcomes through the psychometric scale. For instance, anxiety and depression got the highest score on the scale, like ‚ÄúWorrying thoughts go through my mind‚Äù (anxiety). On the other side, many respondents respond to ‚Äústrongly agree‚Äù to ‚ÄúI prefer to wash my hands pretty soon after shaking someone‚Äôs hand‚Äù (germ aversion), which is clearly evident of their fear of getting virus exposure. ', 'Conclusion', 'The study of coronavirus turning into coronaphobia is necessary because the novel coronavirus has impacted the lives and affected personally and professionally. The fear triggers by the sudden increase of mortality and morbidly rates in the month of March 2020, although it is going to be a whole year, and things are not normal yet. ', 'Coronavirus pandemic has shown us and put us where we have never imagined. Due to the pandemic, economic crises, social distancing, emotional crises, and education backwardness emerge. ', 'According to the recent study and report of the World Health Organisation (2020), the vaccine of coronavirus is not the market yet because continuous trials are going on; hence people still need to maintain the guidelines of covid-19. ', 'Physical illness is visible and measurable, and yet curable. However, mental health is not easy to observe, analyze, and treated in a day or two. And covid-19 not only comes with physical illness symptoms but in this year WHO has recorded the rates of anxiety, depression, fear, phobia, and insomnia due to the major factors affecting the mental health of an individual. ']

Author: prithvithakur1
Paragraphs:
['COVID19 had a very bad effect on the economy of the world and is causing a lot of distress all over the globe there were a lot of deaths and people were getting infected with the virus at a very exponential rate, till the mid of 2020 the world was in a complete shutdown and we did not know when we will be free to go out. The economy was all time low, many lost their jobs and many migrated due to loss of job and no place to live.', 'But even in this pandemic while facing the grave danger of becoming the number one in the infected by the virus, India did a very brilliant of holding the virus outbreak at bay, many necessary and important steps were taken in time which prevented the\xa0 death toll and the infected cases to a minimum. Here we will discuss about the 5 long term positive effects of COVID19.', "1) A more digital economy
Demonetization was the shock that pushed India into the digital era as people adopted online payments in the absence or short supply of cash. Covid-19 is the shock that is forcing everyone to adopt digital in everything ‚Äî from buying groceries to seeking online consultations with a doctor for minor conditions. 

India's total e-commerce shopper base, at 30% of its online population, is quite low when compared with 78% in China and over 70% in the US. In a 53-page report on 'India's Digital Economy in a Post-Covid-19 World', Morgan Stanley has projected that India's online shoppers will jump to 590 million from 190 million in 2020. The average spend per online shopper is also projected to nearly double
to $318.

2) Global supply chains will be redrawn
China has been the factory of the world for quite some time now and as a result it has become the pillar of global supply chains for everything from chips to drug APIs. The world has realized that it might not be a good idea to put all eggs in one basket. This would mean that countries like India that have long waited for their turn to make for the world would increasingly see more foreign businesses set up base and generate large scale employment.

3) Policy reforms gathering pace
The coronavirus pandemic has led India to initiate reforms that have been stuck in red tape for decades. For instance, the government has liberalized the coal sector and changed certain labor laws that were said to have been hindering businesses. Moreover, the government has also announced \xa0agri market reforms such as bringing in legislation that will allow farmers to sell their produce to whoever they choose.

4) Liquidity rush in the capital markets
Central banks all around the world have cut interest rates and launched borrowing programs to inject cash into the capital markets. The Reserve Bank of India came out with a plan in March to supply Rs 3.74 lakh crore of liquidity to the financial markets. While banks may have not been lending off the bat, their cash reserves ‚Äî coupled with low interest rates ‚Äî will mean that individuals and businesses will be afforded a huge breadth in borrowing once green shoots start to appear in the economy.   ", '5) Nature of jobs will be transformed
The coronavirus pandemic has led to a lot of companies rethinking office spaces and on-site work. Tech bigwigs such as Facebook, Google and Twitter have already made announcements regarding giving staff the option to work from home in the long term. It‚Äôs only a matter of time that many more companies follow suit as they determine that spending on office spaces can be cut and productivity can be measured better in terms of to-do timesheets. More workers are also finding out that the gig economy perhaps offers a lot more flexibility to earn money and follow passions.  ', 'In conclusion we can only say that we just have to look forward for this transformation to happen. #positivelife #effectsodCOVID19 #Changes']

Author: articlesofnote
Paragraphs:
['was reading this article just now:\xa0https://www.themarshallproject.org/2020/08/21/covid-19-s-toll-on-people-of-color-is-worse-than-we-knew

and was struck by these statistics:

‚ÄúIn an average year, somewhere around 1.7 million people die in the United States between January and the end of July. This year the figure was about 1.9 million, according to the CDC.

Of the possible 215,000 additional deaths above normal through July‚Äîa total that has since risen to as many as 235,000‚Äîmost were officially attributed to coronavirus infections. The rest were blamed on other causes, including heart disease, high blood pressure and other types of respiratory diseases.‚Äú

in other words, the COVID pandemic has increased the death rate in the US by roughly 12%, by itself - ~1.9m divided by ~1.7m is about 112%.\xa0 most but not all (official US death toll as of writing is ~181,000, per ncov2019.live) of these excess deaths are directly caused by COVID.\xa0 the balance of excess mortality (jesus, what a grim fucking sentence) of ~35k (as of July) to ~55k (current) deaths could reasonably represent the indirect COVID deaths due to inadequate health infrastructure, and it is suggestive that the\xa0‚Äúother causes‚Äù blamed for the excess deaths (eg heart disease, high blood pressure, other respiratory diseases) could plausibly still be COVID-related, as there is at least anecdotal evidence that COVID has severe impacts on the cardiovascular system (see, eg., https://www.statnews.com/2020/07/27/covid19-concerns-about-lasting-heart-damage/\xa0or https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/pdf/10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.120.047549\xa0,both from July).

OTOH I would expect the hypothesis of\xa0‚Äústressed medical infrastructure is causing excess deaths‚Äù to result in a rise of deaths from all causes, not just COVID-related, as presumably all patients would have trouble getting medical care in overcapacity hospitals, and I haven‚Äôt heard any information that would weigh one way or another in testing that hypothesis.

and of course, we must remember that all, or nearly all, of this was avoidable and the hundreds of thousands of COVID deaths are pretty much directly attributable to the current administration and their catastrophic decisionmaking or lack thereof.']

Author: maskandmore-blog
Paragraphs: ['With the rising COVID-19 situation, we see an increase in the need for private safety. PPE kits, face masks, sanitizers, soaps are the necessity of the hour. Seeing numerous brutal cases and even deaths, these essentials became of massive importance alongside isolation and maintaining social distancing.', 'Your safety, the market is flooded with safety face masks, both medicated and general. Many face masks do are available several layers underneath to supply refined and improved protection against viral infection and pollution. We encounter different sorts of face masks for instance color-blocked, printed, designer, branded, cotton face masks, and artificial face masks.', 'N95 mask manufacturer in India\xa0says that These Masks play an eminent role against catching any infection as they keep you safe from coming in direct contact with people and also filters the air you inhale. Coronavirus is probably going to spread massively by coming in direct contact with the symptomatic person, mouth, and nose. Face masks ensure to hide your nose and mouth completely and protect you from being infected with the deadly virus which is additionally present within the air.', 'But the very next question arises: how can we confront and affect the spreading of fatal and deadly coronavirus?', "The first and straightforward to succeed in an answer thereto may be a mask, regular or surgical. Face masks are of sheer importance and are the primary and foremost safety against any direct contact with the symptomatic or asymptomatic humans or maybe the items. The Disposable Face Masks are designed to supply a protective covering to the face in such how that it doesn't allow germs or the infection to enter the physical body while breathing.", 'Why actually wear a face mask?', 'By wearing a security mask amidst this pandemic, one can prevent the spread of coronavirus infection and also prevent you from coming in direct contact with people and other present objects. Consistent with COVID19 personal protective equipment manufacturer India, A mask is of utmost importance because it can prevent from catching the deadly infection. When a private cough, talks, sneezes they might release germs into the air which will infect others nearby. Face masks function as an infection control strategy to eliminate cross-contamination.', "This Pandemic, we've only two weapons for safeguarding ourselves and our loved ones which weapons are Social Distancing and Wearing Face Masks all the time, as you never know who has this dangerous Infection. That's why taking all safety measures and precautions may be a huge necessity of today's time. The govt can only help us if we help ourselves first. Now‚Äôs the time to urge serious of this example and handle it'll all Faith, will power, and Confidence. So, if you do not have masks buy one now otherwise you also can purchase it from any medical or Confectionery stores.", 'How do you have to wear a face mask?', 'Features of Disposable Face Mask:', "Face masks are the foremost crucial and important measure towards keeping yourself safe from the tough and Ill effects of catching the novel coronavirus infection. So, It's Better to remain safe, stay inside, and if you're going outside for a few important work it's good to require precautions and wear masks, use Sanitizer all the time.", 'For more info :- personal protective equipment manufacturer india']

Author: breathing-in-waves
Paragraphs: ['COVID UPDATE- TW ', "For the most part, my friends and followers are unaware of this, but for the past couple days I've been going through the stages that come after receiving my dreadful positive covid test.", "I'm not quite sure of what day I am on officially but to give you an idea of where I at - I started showing symptoms when my mom tested positive on Wednesday, May 4th (the force was not with us that day.) And I originally tested negative that day but already felt a little sick. Fast forward to Thursday, May 5th and my sinuses were awful and ding, ding, ding! I'm positive. ", "So, I guess it's sort of day 3¬Ω? of Covid and my throat hurts now and I'm trying not to talk much at the moment. My coughing seldom compared to what I've heard from others but is on the cusp of being really sharp now whenever it happens, making my throat hurt more. Hurray! üòí taste is gone and smell is bad too atm..", 'As for my symptoms, ', 'Up until yesterday, it was acute sinuses and a slight (but very scary heavy) cough. I went onto a coughing spell on Thursday that scared me enough to beg the doctor for meds cause it was looking like either that or the emergency at that moment. ', 'Currently, sinuses are stuffed, I have horrible insomnia, rough cough and sore throat. üôÉ ', '', 'Posting to see what other people have experienced cause I hear that day 5 gets worse but nobody is really talking about the symptoms with 2 or more vaccines...', 'If anyone can relate, please let me know and feel free to ask me any questions too!!', "And because I know it's a frequently asked question in covid talk,", "Just to clarify, I have had two Pfizer vaccines and was awaiting my third, which last month I qualified for but procrastinated because I knew it would likely cause me to take time off work (as most people like me with autoimmune issues have to do.) And already have no sick days left as I've had some health issues earlier in the year so I was quite hesitant to take a pay hit. Though, I have also not gone places without my mask, despite recent mandatory actions being lifted. And take great precautions as my mom and grandmother have health issues as well.", '', "More updates to come but for now I'm gonna rest! Make sure to get your shot cause I honestly can't imagine how bad this would be right now without them. ", "Stay safe and keep wearing masks! I had someone in the family who refused and that is why my mom and I are sick! Masks do help and if they were still mandatory I can almost guarantee we wouldn't have covid19 right now.", 'Bye for now!']

Author: thecpdiary
Paragraphs: ['The new Covid-19 vaccine manufactured by Valneva has now been licensed and approved for use in the UK.', 'The UK is the first country in the world to approve the new Valneva  vaccine, which becomes the sixth vaccine since the pandemic began, to be  granted an authorisation. It is also the first, whole-virus Covid-19  vaccine to gain regulatory approval.', 'The vaccine uses more traditional technology similar to how polio and  flu vaccines are made. It contains a whole copy of the virus which has  been inactivated, so that it can‚Äôt cause the disease but does teach the  body how to fight it.', 'As with the AstraZeneca and Pfizer vaccines, it is designed to be  given as two doses. The vaccine is approved for use in people aged only  18 to 50 years, with the first and second doses to be taken at least 28  days apart.', 'In trials, results from volunteers who received the jab had high  levels of antibodies against the virus and the vaccine outperformed the  AstraZeneca vaccine on this measure in comparison tests.', 'Experts say it is possible that by using the whole virus, rather than  just the spike protein, the vaccine may be more useful against future  emerging variants of Covid.', 'Scientists have produced a newer long-lasting vaccine to tackle  Covid-19. The newly licensed vaccine is limited in use, due to target  age range, and doesn‚Äôt say how long immunity lasts. It also still  doesn‚Äôt help high risk and vulnerable people in the absence of efficacy  in those who are high risk and vulnerable.', 'The first vaccines, were not protecting enough, even more so if you  were immunocompromised, and you could still catch and spread the virus.  Now this new age bracket means many people will now not be eligible.', 'Source: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news', 'For more inspirational, life-changing blogs, please check out my site https://www.thecpdiary.com']

Author: artykyn
Paragraphs: ['there‚Äôs this headline on some articles going around that‚Äôs like\xa0‚Äústudy finds that natural immunity is superior to vaccines against delta variant‚Äù', 'And that wording makes it sound like\xa0‚Äúyou don‚Äôt need a vaccine‚Äù but if you read the articles, what the study ACTUALLY shows is:', 'People who are vaccinated and who\xa0already caught COVID have the best immunity against future reinfection, meanwhile people who already caught COVID but were unvaccinated came in second place, ahead of people who were vaccinated but have not gotten sick at all. But among everyone who has not gotten sick, people who are vaccinated are still more protected.', 'Remember that even though the\xa0death rate seems low, almost half of people who get COVID experience symptoms for 6+ months (‚ÄùLong COVID‚Äù). These can include new physical and mental disabilities. There are people who, a year or more\xa0after getting sick, are still sick. COVID is still a new disease so it‚Äôs hard to tell just how many of those people will continue to suffer symptoms permanently. Sure, they didn‚Äôt die, but they didn‚Äôt recover either!', 'So, yeah, sure, catching COVID is good at preventing you from getting it a second time, but getting a vaccine is good for preventing you from getting it the first time. It‚Äôs pretty stupid to take a 50/50 risk with your entire quality of life because you expect your immune system to do a perfect job.']

Author: twitterexile
Paragraphs: ['"The ‚ÄúSpanish Flu‚Äù was only named after Spain because it came during World War I when journalism in most belligerent countries was censored. The media in Spain, not being in the war, widely reported the flu, and so that pandemic took the name of the country. In fact, evidence showed that the Spanish Flu began in the United States, in a military base in Kansas where the chickens transmitted the virus to soldiers. It would then travel to British India, where 60 percent of the casualties of that pandemic took place. It was never named the ‚ÄúAmerican Flu‚Äù and no Indian government has ever sought to recover costs from the United States because of the animal-to-human transmission that happened there." - https://countercurrents.org/2020/05/truth-and-propaganda-about-coronavirus/']

Author: mommyblessing-fyi
Paragraphs: ['12/18/21', 'Daddy Blessing was vaccine-hesitant for the longest time.\xa0', 'One of the things I‚Äôve always cherished about him is that he‚Äôs typically open to changing his mind. This was different. Just about anytime the matter would come up he grew more resistant.\xa0', '[ Blessing supposed her dad might be quite upset with her if she‚Äôd been the one holding out. ]', 'I can see how Daddy B could be swayed by social media controversies about vaccines. He‚Äôs shown me how Nigerians share videos of violent clashes in the moment via social media - stories that Nigerian mainstream news might miss, play down, or intentionally omit.\xa0', 'While I like to listen to BBC World Service reporting on Africa, Daddy B does not. In his eyes Great Britain is a colonizer, the oppressor.\xa0', 'I can imagine how people outside of Africa and the African diaspora might miss the nuances in BBC reporting that Daddy B finds objectionable. And while bias in reporting may be waning due to Black Lives Matter and increased attention to unintended microaggressions, trust isn‚Äôt earned overnight.\xa0', 'All in all, Daddy B is liable to trust social media over mainstream news, and perhaps especially over news coming out of the western world.', 'His primary reason for putting off getting vaccinated was concern over possible unforeseen side effects. I researched matters from all angles (and was hugely alarmed by the minuscule chance of death due to blood clots with the AstraZeneca vaccine !).', 'I set up our annual physicals early with hope this would give Daddy B the chance to discuss Covid-19 vaccination options with his doctor‚Ä¶ but Daddy B wouldn‚Äôt talk to the doctor about it at all. Sigh‚Ä¶', 'How could we make a vaccination appointment for Daddy B ? If he changed his mind at the last minute, would it be possible to secure another appointment at a later date ?', 'Truman Medical Center/University Health at 2211 Charlotte Street in Kansas City, Missouri takes walk-ins from 7am-3:20pm Monday through Friday. I like the idea of going to a hospital versus a drug store or Walmart. Blessing and I got vaccinated there earlier this year.', 'I posted a note inside our front door with the University Health vaccination center‚Äôs details and pointed the location out to Daddy B when we happened to be driving by that way after hours‚Ä¶', 'How about a little vacation over Thanksgiving break to celebrate Daddy B‚Äôs November birthday ?\xa0', 'If we were going to travel, he‚Äôd have to get vaccinated.', 'Monday, November 8th, with heavy hearts, we attended the home-going of Blessing‚Äôs best friend‚Äôs dad. This father, adored by all, had been so alive to us. Now he was‚Ä¶ gone. ', 'As we drove in the cortege to the cemetery, Blessing wondered why a fellow on the roadside was taking off his hat. Daddy B explained, ‚Äúout of respect for the dead.‚Äù\xa0', 'This dad‚Äôs passing is a complicated story wherein he was separated from all his family due to Covid-19 regulations at St. Luke‚Äôs. Circumstances surrounding his death painted a vivid picture of what being in a hospital Covid ward entails.', 'I continued to ask around about vaccine hesitancy in an effort to find out what seemed to sway people‚Äôs loved ones to get vaccinated at last. I saw that offering to accompany the individual to get vaccinated was a way to encourage and support him or her.', 'On Monday, November 15th I accompanied Daddy B to get his first Pfizer vaccination at University Health. As we waited for doors to open at 7am, we observed a nurse carrying a cooler of vaccines over from the pharmacy.\xa0', 'Then Monday, November 22nd we were off to St. Louis on holiday ~', 'Monday, December 6th Daddy B got his second shot.\xa0', 'And Wednesday this week Daddy Blessing called me up to get the address of the University Health vaccination center for a workmate ~', '¬© Mommy Blessing, 2021']

Author: ghawyymedia
Paragraphs: ['Superstar Salman Khan on Wednesday received the first dose of the coronavirus vaccine.', 'The 55-year-old actor, who was spotted at the Lilavati Hospital in suburban Bandra in the evening, shared the news on Twitter.', '‚ÄúTook my first dose of vaccine today‚Ä¶.‚Äù Salman Khan wrote on the microblogging site.', 'The ‚ÄúBharat‚Äù star‚Äôs parents ‚Äî veteran screenwriter Salim Khan and producer Salman Khan ‚Äî received their first dose of the vaccine a few days ago, a source close to Salman Khan told PTI.', 'On Tuesday, the government announced that from April 1, all people above 45 years of age will be eligible to get COVID-19 vaccines.', 'Union minister Prakash Javadekar said now even people without comorbidities who are more than 45 years of age can get inoculated.', 'Salman Khan is the latest Indian film celebrity to be vaccinated, after Sanjay Dutt, Sharmila Tagore, Dharmendra, Hema Malini, Mohanlal, Jeetendra, Kamal Haasan, Nagarjuna, Neena Gupta, Rakesh Roshan, and Johnny Lever.', 'According to the Union health ministry, the number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country has crossed 5 crore till Tuesday.', 'The countrywide vaccination drive was rolled out on January 16 with healthcare workers getting vaccinated first and immunisation of frontline workers began from February 2.', 'The next phase of COVID-19 vaccination commenced from March 1 for those who are over 60 years of age and for people aged 45 and above with specified co-morbid conditions.', 'Read More such articles on https://www.ghawyy.com/\xa0\xa0']

Author: nuadox
Paragraphs: ['- By Prof. Wolfgang Preiser , Cathrine Scheepers , Jinal Bhiman , Marietjie Venter , Tulio de Oliveira , The Conversation -', 'Since early in the COVID pandemic, the Network for Genomics Surveillance in South Africa has been monitoring changes in SARS-CoV-2. This was a valuable tool to understand better how the virus spread. In late 2020, the network detected a new virus lineage, 501Y.V2, which later became known as the beta variant. Now a new SARS-CoV-2 variant has been identified, known as B.1.1.529.\xa0']

Author: eerash29-blog
Paragraphs: ['I am now preparing for anything. I find myself pushed to blogging because I am expecting, struggling with the covid situation and staying with my parents.', "I fled Mumbai/Bombay recently in light of the spiraling out of control Covid situation. I am now stationed in Calcutta/Kolkata at my parents home coping with the fall out. I am sad, miserable and depressed and feel suffocated. It's one thing dealing with a pandemic but another dealing with a pandemic while pregnant. Isnt it much tougher? I feel locked in and boxed in.", 'And of course staying with parents is never easy, let alone under such circumstances! My husband is away. He left when I was in the 7th week to focus on his much delayed start up. With the global lockdown in 2020, he was unable to get into gear and get his start up started. In the beginning of 2021, with covid seemingly under some control, a pregnant wife, he determined that he had to get his start up up and running. ', 'So once he left for EU in mid February, there I was in Bombay coping with the sickness of the first trimester and with my parents in the house. My parents and I have not gotten along too well after my marriage. Being an only child and having married on my own have resulted in some insecurities and pettiness surfacing from my mother. Further, the fact that I am the breadwinner of my family while my husband figures out his business idea was too much for my mother to bear. There are always outbursts from her on and off where she laments everything from me, to my husband, to her husband, to her life!', 'Anyway, right now I find myself with my parents and feeling sad and miserable. I would think covid has made it harder to deal with pregnancy both from a physical and mental stimulation perspective. Where does one go? What does one do? All my school friends are no longer in Calcutta. I feel that managing the emotional and mental aspects of pregnancy become quite challenging in the middle of covid. Unlike in the US and Europe, there is no support group or chat group for pregnant women. The whole situation and experience feels terribly isolating. While all articles on pregnancy seems to affirm much of what I feel, how I react to my parents - there does not seem much validation in the real world. How does one manage to get out of it? Or is it down a rabbit hole?   ']

Author: frsnworldwide
Paragraphs: ['LE PHILOSOPHE ET INTELLECTUEL EUROP√âEN FERNANDO SAVATER S‚ÄôINTERROGE SUR LES CONS√âQUENCES DE LA CRISE EN EUROPE ET SUR LA SP√âCIFICIT√â DES CAS ESPAGNOLS ET PORTUGAIS.', 'Une fronti√®re s√©pare le Portugal et l‚ÄôEspagne, mais, de chaque c√¥t√©, le bilan est dramatiquement oppos√©. Comment le comprendre ?', 'L‚ÄôEspagne est l‚Äôun des pays qui a connu le confinement le plus exigeant et qui comptait en Europe le plus grand nombre de morts par rapport √† son nombre d‚Äôhabitants ‚Äì environ 28000 en juillet 2020. Au Portugal, le nombre de morts √©tait consid√©rablement moindre ‚Äì environ 1400 -, alors que le confinement avait √©t√© plus flexible. √Ä San Sebastian on pensait que c‚Äô√©tait un probl√®me sp√©cifiquement italien, li√© √† l‚Äôimportance des travailleurs chinois dans le nord du pays. Les r√©unions publiques et les √©v√©nements sportifs se sont donc poursuivis tardivement. En revanche, le gouvernement portugais a r√©agi avant m√™me le premier mort. Il a ferm√© les √©coles et ses fronti√®res et adopt√© des mesures sociales en faveur des plus pauvres. Les loyers ont √©t√© suspendus, et les immigr√©s ont √©t√© r√©gularis√©s afin de b√©n√©ficier de la protection sociale le temps de la crise. L‚Äôun des aspects du probl√®me espagnol est la dualit√© du gouvernement, partag√© entre Podemos et le groupe socialiste. Ce face-√†-face a favoris√© l‚Äôadoption des mesures contradictoires d‚Äôun jour sur l‚Äôautre.', 'La solidarit√© des pays europ√©ens est-elle mise √† l‚Äô√©preuve ?', 'Comme on l‚Äôa vu au Portugal, ainsi que dans des pays comme la Su√®de ou la Gr√®ce, la ¬´ coop√©ration ¬ª des citoyens, soutenue politiquement, leur a permis de conserver certaines libert√©s. La crise nous a appris que la solidarit√© est un √©go√Øsme intelligent : nous sommes solidaires, parce que c‚Äôest bon pour nous. Et cela vaut politiquement aussi : sans la solidarit√©, la soci√©t√© n‚Äôest qu‚Äôune foule. L‚ÄôEurope est un petit continent. Nous avions l‚Äôhabitude de voyager et de travailler dans les pays voisins. Je crains que cette √©preuve ne soit d√©cisive pour ¬´ l‚ÄôUnion ¬ª, qui s‚Äôest d√©j√† divis√©e dans l‚Äôurgence. Maintenant qu‚Äôil y a moins de voyages, que certaines fronti√®res sont ferm√©es, la peur de l‚Äôautre gagne du terrain ? Ce que Nietzche appelle le ¬´ pathos de la distance ¬ª, soit le d√©sir d‚Äôune distinction irr√©ductible entre les √™tres et entre les peuples.', 'Peut-on parler d‚Äô¬´ esprit des peuples ¬ª pour qualifier les diff√©rents choix √©thiques adopt√©s sur le continent ?', 'Disons que, dans un pays comme l‚ÄôEspagne, le confinement contredit le sens m√™me de la soci√©t√©, faite de r√©unions familiales et de c√©l√©brations collectives. Les Espagnols √©voluent dans un monde de places publiques, inconnues dans l‚ÄôEurope du Nord.\nLes Espagnols vivent dehors contrairement aux pays de l‚ÄôEurope du Nord !', 'Ensuite, les moyens pris pour lutter contre la pand√©mie ne sont pas d‚Äôordre √©thique. Ils sont hygi√©niques et politiques. Mais, effectivement, un champ de r√©flexion philosophique s‚Äôouvre √† partir du moment o√π l‚Äôon se pose des questions pol√©miques comme : ¬´ √Ä partir de quel √¢ge est-on consid√©r√© comme vieux ? ¬ª, ¬´ Faut-il prot√©ger les ¬´ actifs ¬ª et les ¬´ improductifs ¬ª de la m√™me fa√ßon ? ¬ª, ¬´ Les citoyens le sont-ils identiquement, depuis l‚Äôenfance jusqu‚Äô√† la mort ? ¬ª‚Ä¶', 'L‚Äô√©thique commence quand nous nous demandons comment utiliser notre libert√©, et la situation de la crise sanitaire nous y oblige.']

Author: floydvalleyhealthcare
Paragraphs: ['Many of us are looking at life with a renewed sense of hope these days. Covid-19 vaccines are currently being administered, and it feels like the veil is beginning to lift. While we want to leap for joy, hug strangers on the street and burn every mask we own, we must approach this time with cautious optimism‚Ä¶ which means continuing to wear the masks and avoid crowds - for now. Let‚Äôs further explore that importance.', "A study published in ‚ÄúThe New England Journal of Medicine‚Äù in December 2020 found that protection doesn't start until 12 days after the first Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine, and that effectiveness reaches 51-52% a few weeks later. One week after the second vaccination, effectiveness hits 95%. Moderna reported a efficacy rate of 51% two weeks after the first immunization and 94% two weeks after the second dose. ", 'The FDA allowed distribution of these two vaccine brands citing only their ability to keep you ‚Äî the person vaccinated ‚Äî from becoming severely sick with COVID-19. So anyone who has not been fully vaccinated can still get it. The bottom line is still what it has always been - my mask protects you, and your mask protects me. Until we have the majority of the population fully vaccinated, and scientists deem it safe for us to stop using masks and social distancing, we must remain vigilant for the greater good. ', 'We are\xa0still\xa0all in this together but the end is in sight.']

Author: journalofaltsciencesandfacts
Paragraphs: ['ACT 1 SCENE I\xa0', 'Set in ancient Nazareth. There is a chain link fence, or something similar. Has large holes.\xa0', 'Enter JOSEPH', 'Joseph is wearing a disposable mask, a cloth mask, and a face shield. He is working on the fence.\xa0', 'JOSEPH: I can‚Äôt believe she did that to me. A baby! Ee-mawn-oo-ale, really?', 'Joseph splits into a yawn. He plops himself on the ground.\xa0', 'Enter GABRIEL', 'Gabriel wears a white robe. He approaches Joseph.\xa0', 'GABRIEL: Joseph, son of David. Don‚Äôt be‚Ä¶ Gestures toward the fence. I see you‚Äôre building a fence.\xa0', 'Joseph sits upright.\xa0', 'JOSEPH: Yes, to keep the mosquitoes from coming into my yard.', 'GABRIEL: Don‚Äôt like mosquitoes?', 'JOSEPH: They carry deadly diseases. They killed 250,000 Israelites this year.', 'GABRIEL: is stifling a smile. And you heard building a fence will work?\xa0', 'JOSEPH: It will...it won‚Äôt work unless everyone else in Nazareth builds fences to keep mosquitoes out of my yard.\xa0', 'GABRIEL: What if they can‚Äôt? Or they don‚Äôt want to?\xa0\xa0', 'JOSEPH: It‚Äôs not that hard. Building fences saves lives.\xa0', 'GABRIEL: What if 99.9% of mosquitoes don‚Äôt carry diseases?', 'JOSEPH: You‚Äôre not taking the mosquitoes seriously. What did you come to tell me?', 'Gabriel gestures, and opens his mouth, as if to talk, but‚Ä¶', 'Blackout']

Author: fluidcomplex
Paragraphs: ['I know that a lot has been written about\xa0‚Äúkeyboard warriors‚Äù and\xa0‚Äúecho chambers‚Äù with regards to online debate and discussion.', 'Once upon a time the mad ravings of uninformed and myopic trolls were interesting accentuations to otherwise bland online discourse.', 'However, times have changed.', 'With so many people now in lockdown, and whipped up into a frenzied state of fear of COVID-19 by news media and their governments, these lunatics have multiplied by many orders of magnitude.', 'Not only multiplied, but have been joined by people who were otherwise normal, sane and rational.', 'The old rule applies: when everybody is fat and happy, nobody complains. But take away their jobs, and render them idle, they will find everything and anything to rant and rave about, no-matter how unjustified, warped or perverted those views might be.', 'A frustrated, angry, idle, and broke population always leads to a very dangerous climax: intolerance and violence.', 'It‚Äôs starting with online words. Most notably amongst those people who are wholeheartedly supporting draconian measures of their political leaders. There are some who are opposing this, but unfortunately the keyboard justice warriors are making sure that this opposition is cruelly labelled (‚Äùrat lickers‚Äù,\xa0‚Äúconspiracy nutters‚Äù, etc.) irrespective of any valid concerns, facts, values, or intellectual thought.', 'I find it ironic that the people claiming to be on the righteous side of the government fail - time and time again - to make genuine efforts at educating themselves on the real issues in any meaningful way. They gobble up media headlines and government press speeches - feeding their already heightened fears and growing their anger towards any opposition. Only seeking truths that support and stoke their fears, and reject all other facts. By doing so, they are creating a very large and very intense echo chamber fuelled by irrational fear that keeps growing.', 'I confess: I am scared. Not about the virus. That will come and go (the number of people who will ultimately succumb to the virus will be a very small percentage of our normal annual death toll).', 'I am scared about how this situation - not brought about by the virus itself, but by official government responses to it (for the most part) supported by a baying mob - is creating very similar dynamics to those that lead to the rise of Communist Russia, Nazi Germany and other totalitarian regimes.', 'The keyboard warriors will tell me I‚Äôm crazy. No, actually they won‚Äôt. They‚Äôll call me all sorts of names. They‚Äôll call me hysterical. Yet they are blinded by their fear and their myopic views.', 'Whenever you take away people‚Äôs liberties - no matter the reason - their jobs, and whip them into any sort of fearful frenzy... that‚Äôs when they turn to authoritarian saviours to rescue them and punish everybody else who they see as contributing to their fear and suffering. In this case - as in most cases - their anger is directed towards anyone who bothers to think critically.', 'Even some of my friends, who I once counted amongst the rational and fair, have joined the mob in its merciless attacks on those who stand against their fear-ridden howls.', 'Any good news that dares to break the airways is immediately dismissed - even condemned - because to accept it would be to deny everything they‚Äôve said and felt in the past months of lockdown.', 'History is a wonderful teacher, if we bother to pay attention and learn from it. Those who believe that\xa0‚Äúeverything will be ok once we get a vaccine‚Äù are deluding themselves. It‚Äôs not the virus that is causing the damage to our society. It‚Äôs the fear that‚Äôs been instilled into the mob. Couple that with idle hands due to widespread unemployment and business contraction (mandated by government dictates), and the historical evidence for what happens next is sadly predictable.', 'I wish I could go away, to another country where the people aren‚Äôt so perversely agitated. But this seems to be a global hysteria contagion, leaving waste to the production of distribution of essential commodities (such as food).', 'This calamity that we have brought upon ourselves is leading to a global famine, the likes of which has not been seen for many generations. That will lead to civil unrest and political turmoil. Political leaders will create external enemies with which they hope to channel the anger and desperation of citizens. They will then demand war.', 'The past several generations have grown up with the expectation, and reality, of bequeathing a better life to their children and grandchildren. In the blink of an eye we have completely reversed this basic human right and hope, and have condemned our offspring to suffer as we never have. The virus did not create this. We did.', 'To all the fearful, angry, hurt and scared people out these: turn off your social media. Go and read a book. Walk in the outdoors (if you‚Äôre allowed to!). Doodle. Make love. Anything! Just turn off the news, stop reading social media. If we, en masse, switch off from the vicious cycle that social media is shoving down our throats, then perhaps we might stand a chance.']

Author: partnersrelief
Paragraphs: ['As a tumultuous summer bleeds into fall, our world and our futures remain uncertain while we live through a pandemic that has swept up hundreds of\xa0 thousands of lives and many of the hopes and dreams we had for 2020. We wait with baited breath for a vaccine or some cure to quell our anxieties. As students return to school and workers return to their jobs, the virus remains an omnipresent threat to our lives, our families, and our communities.', 'In Sittwe, Myanmar, the COVID-19 outbreak is rapidly escalating. Sittwe is the nearest city to where over 100,000 Rohingya live in internment camps and surrounding villages. The first cases in the area were identified mid-August, and since then the numbers have risen, with 100 new cases reported on August 26th alone.', 'This is deeply concerning as access to medical care has been routinely denied to Rohingya in Rakhine State. Of the 100 new cases in Myanmar on Wednesday, 99 were transmitted within the community. All cases were connected to the Sittwe township.\xa0', 'On August 28th our team began supporting Rohingya and Rakhine communities at risk of COVID-19 near Sittwe, Myanmar. Distributions included 100 full PPE suits and 3,000 surgical masks delivered to Sittwe Hospital to support health workers and patients.', 'Bangladesh, home to over 700,000 Rohingya refugees, has one of the lowest ratios of hospital beds to patients in the world. There has been a shortage of ICU beds during the coronavirus outbreak - figures vary, but it is estimated that there are just over 1,000 beds for a population of more than 160 million.', 'The coronavirus has forced a growing sense of urgency around the issue among international aid responders. Since the pandemic began in March, household purchasing power has shrunk: daily wage earners can only afford to buy about four kilograms of rice ‚Äì a quarter of what most households could afford in February, according to UN agencies. Both the Rohingya in Bangladesh refugee camps as well as their host communities are suffering significantly from this virus.', 'Partners equips Community Health Workers (CHWs) in the camps with medicine and infant malnutrition packs to provide healthcare for Rohingya refugees who rarely have access to outside medical care. We are also distributing urgent food relief in the camps as food access has stalled due to the pandemic.', 'In Syria, nine years of fighting have left the country in an extremely poor position to confront the pandemic. Critical infrastructure such as energy, water, sanitation and healthcare facilities have been repeatedly targeted throughout the war and are largely crippled or destroyed. Healthcare facilities have been attacked more than 600 times in the course of the Syrian Civil War. According to the UN, at the outbreak of the pandemic, only 57 hospitals and clinics were fully operational in Syria for a population of around 16 million.\xa0', 'Social distancing is not possible for most Syrians living in crowded apartments or refugee settlements. Furthermore, important protective gear has been in short supply and subject to rampant price gouging and profiteering.\xa0', 'Our team is providing food assistance in Northeast Syria and have repurposed a school into a quarantine center in Daraa Governorate, Syria.', 'In the first half of 2020, we‚Äôve helped more than 142,000 people as part of our COVID-19 response plan.\xa0', 'Though we work to provide lifelines and hope for the most vulnerable, we can also make room for lament. Our world is weary of this struggle. We are heartbroken by the loss of life, security, and hope brought about by the pandemic. We won‚Äôt relent in helping children affected by conflict and oppression. And when there is disaster and suffering, we will weep alongside them.']

Author: bhaskarlive
Paragraphs: ['Even as India races to develope a cure for the Covid-19 virus, and despite all safety protocalls in place for the last four months to contain the pandemic outbreak, the number of infectees are increasing drastically each day. A total of 48,916 fresh cases were reported on Saturday after 49,310 on Friday taking the total to 98,226 ‚Äî touching almost a lakh in less than two days.', 'In the last 24 hours, 787 people succumbed to the deadly virus, as there is a huge surge in cases in the hinterlands.', 'According to the latest data available on the website of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, total number of cases in India reached 13,36,861 of which 31,388 people have lost their lives while 8,49,432 have recovered. The total number of active cases are 4,56,071 cases. The ministry stated that the recovery rate is 63.53 per cent.', 'The highest spike in cases was reported from Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi and Andhra Pradesh.', 'Maharashtra has recorded 3,57,117 Covid cases out of which 13,132 people have lost their lives, followed by Tamil Nadu with total 1,99,749 cases, and 3,320 deaths.', 'Delhi has registered 1,28,389 cases out of which 3,777 people have lost their lives.']
